loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for notebooks, backpacks, shoes, and school enrollment and monthly expenses.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man. He opened his own clothing shop three years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He worked in this domain with his father for ten years before he decided to become independent.

Mohammad is an ambitious man who is working hard to develop his shop. Today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with a new collection of clothes to satisfy his customers' needs in this winter season.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and build his own future.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Agsan

texts.en:
Agsan is a 24-year-old married woman from Tubas, a village near Nablus city. She lives with her husband and one small daughter. Her husband works as a construction worker. He gets a low and unstable income due to the demand. Agsan is a student in the university. She studies Social science. She wants to complete her studies and find a job to improve the family's living conditions.

Agsan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to cover part of the urgent expenses she has.

Agsan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Ana Del Transito

texts.es: Ana de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su nieto, ella se dedica al cultivo de loroco, maíz y maicillo desde hace 30 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y tiene clientes fijos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, age 62, lives in her own home with her husband and her grandson. She works in agriculture, growing peppers, corn, and maicillo grain for 30 years. She sells her produce in neighboring communities and has many dedicated customers. The income she earns is enough to cover some of her household expenses. She is seeking this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, disease control, and to improve her fields (shown in the photo) so she can continue growing her crops and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, disease control, and to improve her fields

loans.name: Pedro  Pablo

texts.es: Pedro de 58 años de edad se dedica desde hace 34 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, Pedro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old.  He has worked as a farmer for 34 years.  He plants corn and beans.  He sells his products in the different markets located close to his home.  He lives with his four children in a house he owns.

Pedro is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides and to make improvements to his land, which is shown in the photograph, so that he can continue his work and earn better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos todos ya mayores de edad,  su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
Ella es trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona de la Mutualista  de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. Un área caracterizada por el comercio informal y la manufactura, de clima cálido tropical; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 30-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Flora es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro, habla español Su vida la comparte con su esposo quien trabaja como transportista, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos como; zapatos deportivos, de vestir, mocasines, botines, tacones para mujer, de charol, etc. Labor que realiza durante todas la semana sin descanso de forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos a peatones y trabajadores de oficinas, restaurantes, y personas que trabajan en todo tipo de comercio. Sus productos mayormente de cuero son de gran competencia porque se ocupa de buscar los mejores y mas atractivos tanto para varones como mujeres. “sé que modelo viene bien para cada ocasión…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia bajo techo para dejar de ambular. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio por motivo de las fiestas de fin de año, para contar con variedad de modelos en todos los tamaños y así generar mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia  de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Flora solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de zapatos por mayor para complacer a sus clientes y generar bienestar en su familia.
texts.en:
Flora is 54 years old, and she is married with four grown children.  Her business is selling shoes, and she is hard-working. She carries out her work on foot in the Mutualista Zone in the city of Santa Cruz.  It is an area characterized by informal commerce and manufacturing.  It has a warm, tropical climate, with a daytime ambient temperature between 30 and 35 degrees Centigrade year round.

Flora is tan skinned and petite, with black hair.  She speaks Spanish.  She lives with her husband, who is a driver.  They live in their own house, which has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system.

Her business is selling shoes such as sports shoes, dress shoes, moccasins, ankle boots, high heels for women, patent leather shoes, and such.  She carries out her work on foot without stopping to rest, every day of the week, offering her products to pedestrians, office workers, people in restaurants, and people working in every type of commerce. Her products are mostly leather, and they are very, very, good, because she takes care to seek out the best and most attractive shoes for men as well as women.  “I know which styles work well for every occasion”, she says.

Her dream is to have a store of her own, under a roof, so that she can stop walking.  She wants to make an investment in her business so that she can have a variety of styles in all sizes for the end-of-year festivals, and thus generate more income for her family’s well-being. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the four years that she has been engaged in this occupation.

These are the reasons why Flora is requesting a loan; to purchase a variety of wholesale shoes in order to please her customers and provide for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Bosque Del Lirio Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Bosque de Lirio lo integran seis socios emprendedores, quien lo coordina es María Marcelina que tiene la edad de 52 años, acompañada, ella se ofrece en su domicilio venta de hielo, helados y leche, es el cuarto ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento y ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable y con alto espíritu de superación, ya que con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar los productos ofrecidos, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de quintal de queso y bolsas plásticas, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mantener el negocio y con este crédito se ha propuesto implementar la venta de ques, ya que es uno de los productos que la población demanda y que le permitirá implementar la venta de este producto. El resto de los integrantes son, Julio un joven de 21 años que comercializa verduras en la capital desde hace cinco años, Isabel una señora que a sus 64 años, Julio que tiene  la edad de 25 años y comercializa frutas y verduras en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace diez años, María Elena que tiene la edad de 30 años y comercializa ropa de segunda y cosméticos desde hace ocho años, y la última integrante es Iluminada una señora que tiene la edad de 68 años y comercializa ropa de segunda en diversos mercados del país.
texts.en:
The "Bosque del Lirio" loan group is comprised of six entrepreneurial partners, and is coordinated by 52 year old María Marcelina. She sells ice, ice cream, and milk out of her home.

This is the fourth cycle of funding provided by ADIM, and María has proven herself to be a responsible woman with a great resilient spirit, because with the earlier loans, she has managed to increase the products offered. The current loan she requests, is to purchase a hundredweight of cheese and plastic bags. With the previous loans, she managed to keep her business going, and with this loan she plans to begin to sell cheese, since that is one of the products that the local people request, which will help with sales. 

The rest of the members are; Julio, a young man of 21 years old, who has sold vegetables in the capital for 5 years, Isabel, a 64 year old woman, Julio, 25 years old and seller of fruits and vegetables in the most popular market in the capital for 10 years, Maria Elena, 30 years old and seller of second-hand clothes and cosmetics for 8 years, and the final member is Iluminada, a 68 year old woman and seller of second-hand clothing in different markets across the country.

loans.use: to buy a hundredweight of cheese, which is one of the products that people of the area request, which will help with sales.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is in her fifties, and still manages the raising of chickens. She has been in this business 15 years and her income serves to meet her family's daily basic expenditures. Some of her income is invested in buying a motorcycle through an installment basis, which she uses to sell her chickens around their village. Narcisa wants to grow the business to earn higher income and be able to pay her monthly installment on her motorcycle. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more chicks to raise and sell. She hopes that by having the loan she will both meet the needs of her four children and pay her motorcycle monthly amortization.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 60 years old, married, and has six children. She has been in the pig fattening business for four years, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Adelaida has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more feed.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old, married, and has eight children. She is married, has one child still in school, and has raised pigs for the last three years to earn an income.

Erlinda requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed five times from NWTF in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a farmer. She is humble and hard-working, with the drive and perseverance that distinguishes the men and women that work the field. She is a woman with an entrepreneurial mindset. Born in 1957, Emily has grown into a strong and independent woman. She is a mixed farmer, who grows maize and vegetables for both consumption and sale.

Emily is seeking a loan, with which she intends to purchase a high-quality dairy cow. The dairy business is very profitable in this area. Most families rely on milk to feed their children and prepare their meals. Ugali is the staple food of people from Litein area of Kenya. Ugali is tasteless, as it is made from pure maize flour and water. To make this into a mouthwatering delicacy, it has to be accompanied by sour milk and well-cooked vegetables, and meat for those who can afford it. Milk is also an ingredient in the preparation of vegetables. The heavy reliance on milk allows dairy farmers to do well in this region. Milk prices are always high because of the high demand. Little product marketing is required here, because milk is milk. 

With your loan, Emily will not only reduce the amount of money she must spend on milk for the family, but also she will increase her income from the sale of milk. She will use the profits to expand the business and to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy a high-quality dairy cow

loans.name: Rosabelle

texts.en:
Rosabelle is 40 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Rosabelle has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rosabelle aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 40-year-old married woman living in southern Ghour.  Her husband is not working. 

Fatima wants to secure a comfortable life for her five children, who have many needs.

Fatima did not stop to wait for help.  She is a woman who wanted to be useful to the community and to her family, and initially opened a Housewares shop, and after a successful start has expanded to a shop that sells baby clothes.

Recently, she decided to buy more goods to sell, in order to increase their sales and increase their monthly income.  Due to this, she asked for a loan to help her buy more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her business

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta educación básica, está casada y su esposo tiene diez años de vivir en el extranjero, tiene dos hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive junto a ella.

Dinora, desde que era muy joven, siempre le gusto el comercio, su madre la ponía a vender frutas, actualmente ya tiene doce años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa, pues tiene su local comercial en el mercado de su municipal.

El dinero de este crédito, lo utilizara para comprar ropa al por mayor para surtir su negocio, ya que está en temporada estudiantil.	

El sueño que tiene es poder ampliar su negocio y sabe que con la ayuda de dios lo podrá lograr.
texts.en:
Dinora is 51 years old and has a primary school education. She is married and the mother of two children one of whom still lives with her, but Dinora's husband has lived and worked abroad for the past ten years. 

Dinora has liked to do business since she was a young girl, and her mother arranged for her to sell fruit. She has now sold clothing for the past two years and has a stall in a market in her town. 

Dinora will use the funds from this loan for the purchase of wholesale clothing to stock her business, as the school year is underway. 

Dinora hopes to expand her business and is sure she'll succeed with the help of God.

loans.use: to purchase of wholesale clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Oroub

texts.en:
Oroub is 23 years old and lives in Irbid, Jordan. She completed high school successfully and was accepted at one of the universities. At that time she felt that life was beginning to take shape, like one of the artworks that Oroub paints. Over the years, she persevered and became optimistic and ambitious. And she is now seeing the light at the end of the tunnel.

Oroub's father works day and night to secure a living for his children. He takes as many jobs as he can, and yet the income he earns is not enough to afford Oroub's entire tuition costs.

Since Oroub became such an ambitious girl, she never stopped trying to achieve her dreams. She is now a second-year student majoring in communications engineering, and she is eager to earn her certificate and to start looking for a good job 

Therefore, Oroub has requested an educational loan to be able to pay her tuition fees so she can finish university and start on yet another successful road, with her career path.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees so she can finish university.

loans.name: Delmi Del Rosario

texts.es:
Delmi, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, vive junto a su esposo y 2 hijos.

Delmi, es costurera, este oficio lo aprendió de una tía, este negocio le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia por varios años, ahora Delmi, posee un cafetín en la escuela de su lugar de residencia, el cafetín lo atiende de lunes a viernes de 6 a 12 del día y la costura la realiza por las tardes.

Delmi, solicita un crédito para poder comprar golosinas, sodas y agua.- Porque es temporada escolar y es cuando más demanda existe de estos productos.
 
Delmi, en un futuro sueña ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, pues ellos son su motivo para luchar cada día.
texts.en:
Delmi, 47, studied until the seventh grade.  She lives with her husband and two children.  Delmi is a seamstress, work that she learned from an aunt; and this business has helped her to support her family for several years.  

Now, Delmi has a small café in the school near her home, which she runs from Monday to Friday from 6 A.M. until Noon, working as a seamstress in the afternoons.

Delmi is requesting a loan in order to purchase snacks, sodas, and water, because it is the school season, when there is the most demand for these products.

Delmi dreams that in the future she will see her children become professionals, as they are her reason for striving every day.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, sodas, and water.

loans.name: Khor's Group

texts.en:
Khor, 36, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district in Cambodia. She is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school. For the last 18 years, Khor has been working as a rice farmer while her husband is a paid construction worker. Together, they can earn about 52,000 KHR per day.

Khor is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use a portion of the loan to buy seeds for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to harvest more rice so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland and to pay for labor

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Bunna's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Bunna is a 34-year-old father of four children. One child is still small while the other three are in school. 

Bunna is a farmer who has been farming rice and planting cassava in the local area, and he also supplements his family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for eight years, he can earn 47,000 KHR in daily income from his current business. After expenses, he is able to save about 20,000 KHR per day for his future needs.

This is the first loan for Bunna with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and he is leading his group to request this loan. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. 

Bunna hopes to have a decent house and also to have improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lin's Group

texts.en:
Lin, 30, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. All of her children are dependent on her and are still in school. 

She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice on two-hectares of farmland.  She has been in the business for 16 years while her husband is a paid construction worker to earn additional income for their family. Together, they can earn about 38,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Lin is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthy crops to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Edgar Enrique

texts.es:
Edgar Enrique es un hombre muy disciplinado y por lo mismo ha logrado superación en la vida y es más por el bienestar  de su familia, él tiene ahora 36 años de edad, es un hombre casado y vive con su familia en una comunidad de San Andrés Sementabaj. 
Edgar por ser una persona  con buenos principios y por ser responsable, pues ha tenido la oportunidad de conseguir sus préstamos, pues con el anterior prestamo le fue muy bien  con las ganancias que obtuvo  pudo cancelar a tiempo y él se siento contento porque también con las ganancias logro construir un  macro túnel para sembrar tomate, me gusta solicitar prestamo en ADICLA porque me atienden con amabilidad y la gestión es rápida. Edgar para generar otros ingresos él también trabaja como jornalero. 
 Pues con el logro del anterior crédito, ahora solicita nuevamente otro prestamo  que le servirá siempre en el cultivo de tomate, Edgar  es un hombre perseverante no descansa  sino hasta conseguir sus sueños, el ahora busca la forma de cómo hacer para poder exportar su cosecha, Edgar es un hombre muy conocido en su comunidad  ya que es muy sincero con las personas.
texts.en:
Edgar Enrique is a very disciplined man who has managed to succeed in life in order to provide for his family.  He is now 36 years old, married, and lives with his family in the community of San Andrés Sementabaj. 

Edgar, being a responsible person with good principles, has taken the opportunity to obtain some loans.  With his previous loan things went well, and he was able to pay off the loan on time with his earnings.  He feels good, because with his earnings he also managed to build an enclosed greenhouse where he is cultivating tomatoes.  "I like applying for loans with ADICLA because they treat me well, and they work very quickly."

In order to generate additional income, Edgar also works as a laborer.

With his success with the previous loan, he is now requesting a new loan that will help him with his business growing tomatoes.  Edgar is a tenacious man who does not rest until he achieves his dreams.  He is now seeking a way to export his harvest.  Edgar is very well-known in his community, because he is very sincere with people.

loans.use: to buy supplies to cultivate tomatoes

loans.name: Rut

texts.es: Rut de 46 años de edad se dedica desde hace 13 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rut, who is 46 years old, has earned her living from age 13 in agriculture. She grows corn and beans and sells her produce in the different markets that are located near her house. She lives with her husband and their two children in a house that they own. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seed, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, etc., and to improve the land shown in the photograph in order to continue with her work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Pardahol

texts.en:
Pardahol is a hardworking, experienced woman. She was born in 1955 and lives in a rural area. She is a widow, and has one child. 

For about twenty years, she has beens keeping cattle and planting forage. She likes to keep livestock and work the land. She buys, feeds, and keeps cattle and sells them in domestic markets at a higher price. She makes enough profit from her activity, and is satisfied with her work. 

Pardahol is asking for financial support to buy forage.

She hopes to do well and increase her activity.

loans.use: to buy forage

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol, 42 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this business for twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of 2.50 USD a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitary facilities, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Areen

texts.en:
Areen is 21 years old and married. She lives in Nablus city with her husband, who works near Nablus and its villages. Three years ago, Areen started raising chickens in her own yard to sell to the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement. She had started this business after she failed to find a job. 
She applied for this youth loan to buy chicks in large quantities to improve the financial condition of her family. 
Areen is very grateful to everyone who will help her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks in large quantities to improve the financial condition of her family.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a married mother of two, describes herself as honest. For five years now she has operated a farm where she grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. Her business is located in a busy area, and she describes her biggest challenge to be lack of finances. 

Susan will use this Kes 40,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; her previous loan was repaid.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Ruchell

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ruchell works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Ruchell is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store business like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ruchell has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Sarah works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. Having repaid her previous loan, she is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional varieties of ready-to-wear items to sell. 

Sarah hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of ready to wear items to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is an ambitious man. He is 28 years old, single, and lives in Irbid. He has three siblings. He graduated well with his first degree and is now studying for his master's degree. He is a psychological science student who is well known among students and friends. 

Mohammed also works as a teacher in school. His manager has encouraged him to get a master's degree; he sees Mohammad is an ambitious, young, intellectual man who must increase his success to serve the community.

Unfortunately, Mohammed does not have enough money to pay for this education. He has therefore requested financial support to pay his tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition for university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her semester fees and complete her education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's university fees and buy the books that he needs.

loans.name: Adriana Janeth

texts.es: Adriana tiene 27 años, esta casada y su hija tiene 7 años y ya asiste a la escuela y que por cierto le gusta mecho estudiar, el esposo de Adriana trabaja en el jornal y la ganadería,Adriana se dedica a la ganaderia, tiene vacas lecheras y comenta que pormedio del ordeño y la venta de leche es como obtiene sus ingresos,y aveces tambien trabaja al jornal, Adriana necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, lo que mas aspira Adriana es seguir trabajando junto a su esposo en la ganaderia y la agricultura, y de esta manera piensan completar un capital que viene juntando desde tienpo atras con la finalidad de a futuro compra una casa en el campo para vivir con su esposo y su hija.
texts.en:
Adriana is 27 years old. She is married and has a seven-year-old daughter—who goes to school and who, by the way, loves studying. Adriana's husband works as a day laborer and also works in farming. 

Adriana works sometimes as a laborer and in farming: she sells cow's milk.

Adriana needs the loan to purchase a cow. 

Adriana greatest wish is to keep on working hard with her husband as a day laborer and in farming, to be able to save money in order to buy a house in the countryside, where she will live with her husband and their daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Marina es madre soltera, tiene 37 años de edad, sus dos hijas tienen 9 y 14 años de edad y están estudiando, Marina se dedica a la crianza animales menores, y también es empleada domestica, el credito lo necesita para  comprar chanchos ya que comenta que vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo y también hay lugar donde cria chanchos, la aspiración de Marina es sacar adelante a sus hijas y que tengan una mejor viva que ella.
texts.en:
Marina is a single mother. She is 37 years old. Her two daughters are 9 and 14 years old and are in school. Marina makes her living raising small animals, and she is also a domestic worker.

She needs the loan to buy pigs, because she says that she lives in a house that she rents and that there is also space to raise pigs.

Marina's dream is get her daughters ahead and for them to have a better life than her.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies so that her daughter continues in school.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is the victim of a failed marital relationship.  Her husband left her and their four children years ago without any monthly income.  She is 41 years old and lives in Wihdat.  

Basma thought about a way to save herself and her children by earning a living to provide for them.  She began looking for a job, but did not find one, because she has not completed her studies and because of her inability to leave her children alone. She started working by repairing clothes for her neighbors to earn a simple income to cover some of her needs, and pay her rent. 

Basma started to feel that she was able to start her own business, even if it's very simple.  She just wants to protect her family from hunger, so she asked for a loan to buy a sewing machine and made an agreement with a clothing store to repair and alter their clothes.  She hopes this will be enough to raise the level of her income and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to fulfill an agreement with a clothing store to repair and alter their clothing

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, 43, is a married mother living with her three children in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice and cassava. She has been in this business for 23 years, earning about KHR 36,000 per day and is able to save about 15,000 each day after expenses for the future needs. 
Pheap’s Group consists of two members who joined VisionFund for this loan. As the leader, Pheap wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is a 29-years-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her husband and three kids. Her husband works as a teacher in a public school. He gets a low income. Enas is a student at the university. She studies Arabic literature. She wants to complete her studies and find a job to improve the family living conditions.

Enas took a 2,200 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester, and buy a new laptop for her studies. This will help her to cover part of the urgent expenses she has.

Enas appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester and buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and has a large number of customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy animal feed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kamayel

texts.en:
Kamayel is 23 years old and is studying for a degree in accounting. She lives in Ajloun and is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.
Kamayel dreams of having a good job so that she could help pay her daily expenses and help her family meet household expenses. 
She requested a loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education, graduate and then try to find a good job in her field.

loans.use: To pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is studying nursing and is in her fourth year. Abeer chose this major because of her desire to help people. 
Abeer lives with her mother in Irbid. She was very depressed with the death of her father, losing her hero and her only breadwinner. 
She has a dream to complete advanced nursing studies and eventually open a charitable medical center for people in need. Her income from her father's pension does not cover all her needs and her education. Therefore she applied for an education loan to pay her semester fees and help her to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To pay her semester fees and help her to achieve her dreams

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a motor vehicle repair business. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are loyal. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation of spare parts. 

He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy vehicle spare parts. His business goal is to own many garages within 5 years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be polite and honest. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are ladies. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have a bigger salon within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's living standards.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man, and has 3 children. He describes himself to be hardworking. 

He operates a retail shop where he sells eggs, flour, sugar, soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a competitive place and has a variety of customers.  

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the 95,000 KES loan to buy sugar, eggs, flour, and other items for his store. 

His business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a warehouse. 

He will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, eggs, flour and other items

loans.name: Aneka

texts.en:
Aneka lives in South Bogor, West Java. She owns a stall where she sells consumer products every day, such as small snacks and mobile airtime credits. 

This is the third time Aneka is requesting a loan from Kiva. She feels glad because she can can give access to those who need it in her community and she improve her own business as well.

As the business grows, Aneka hopes to get further working capital loans from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is a 49-year-old mother of four children and earns a living through farming rice. To supplement her income, she also sells snacks. She has been in this business for 31 years and the current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

Ly is a first cycled client with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her income through the current business to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en: Bryan is twenty-three years old and he is studying architecture at a state university. Bryan occupies himself by making works for school students (a volcano model for example) and also making furniture such as drawers. Bryan lives with his brothers. Bryan needs a loan to buy paperboard, glue, cardboard and other materials that will help him to build furniture. Bryan wants to finish his studies and to have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: to buy paperboard, glue, cardboard and other materials that will help him to build furniture

loans.name: Marta De Jesus

texts.es: Marta de 26 años de edad se levanta desde muy temprano a comprar la leche recién ordeñada para luego salir a recorrer las calles de los municipios cercanos ofreciendo sus productos, además la que no logra vender la guarda y compra más para convertirla en queso que luego vende de forma ambulante, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 2 y 4 años de edad.  Marta ha observad que cada día son más las personas que gustan de sus productos, por lo que desea vender una mayor cantidad de productos, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en leche para vender y elaborar quesos y de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marta is 26 years old. She wakes up very early in the morning to buy freshly squeezed milk. Later, she walks the streets of the nearby towns to sell her products. That which she does not sell, she saves and buys more of in order to make it into cheese. She later sells her cheese on the streets, an activity that she began two years ago.

Marta is a very enterprising woman that lives with her life companion and her two daughters, aged 2 and 4. She has observed that each day there are more people that like her products, and because of this she hopes to sell a larger amount of product. For this reason Marta is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in milk to sell and produce cheese and therefore obtain a better income.

loans.use: to invest in milk in order to sell and produce cheeses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sand, cement, steel, zinc sheets and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo es un hombre de 44 años de edad, soltero, tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 16, 8 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes.
El es emprendedor, buen padre, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su labor lo realiza en la zona ‘Central’ un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas; conviven lado a lado, de clima semi tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 16-26 grados centígrados en todo el año.
Adolfo es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Quechua que usa en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijas, las 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y la menor se encuentra al cuidado de su madre, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con el servicio de agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de juguetes; para bebés, para niños/as, educativos y para todas las edades. El oferta los juguetes en un puesto de venta propio en una avenida conocida, él comenzó esta actividad con la ayuda de su primo que anteriormente realizaba el mismo trabajo en el mismo lugar. Su principal dificultad es que su puesto de venta es a la intemperie y toda su mercadería se encuentra expuesta a los cambios climáticos como el sol y la lluvia. Actualmente su hija mayor se turna con él para la venta. “tengo suerte de estar ubicado en una zona comercial eso beneficia sobre todo a mis hijas que después se harán cargo ellas solas…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia y estable, él desea realizar la compra de juguetes por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adolfo solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes por mayor para ampliar su oferta.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a single 44-year-old man with 3 daughters, ages 16,8, and 4. He has a business selling toys.

Adolfo is entrepreneurial, independent, responsible and hardworking, and he is a good father. He works in the 'Central' area, an area characterized as having commerce everywhere - universities, public offices, and private businesses operate alongside each other. The climate there is subtropical with a temperature that varies during the day between 16-26 degrees centigrade, all year long.

Adolfo is dark-skinned and short in stature with short black hair. His native language is Quechua, which he uses with his family. He also speaks Spanish in general life and for his business. He shares his life with his daughters. The two oldest study at school, and the youngest is in the care of her mother.They live in a rented house made of bricks with a corrugated metal roof, and they have potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Adolfo has a business selling various kinds of toys: for babies, for children, educational toys, and toys for all ages. He sells toys in his own kiosk on a well-known street. He started working in this profession with the help of his cousin who had previously worked in the same occupation in the same place.

His main difficulty is that his kiosk is out in the open, and all of his merchandise is exposed to the elements such as the sun and the rain. Currently, his oldest daughter take turns selling with him. "I am lucky to be located in a commercial area, which will especially benefit my daughters who will take over the business themselves later", says Adolfo. His dream is to have a stable store of his own. He would like to buy toys at wholesale to supply his customers with seasonal products.

This is his first loan with the institution in his 5th year working in this occupation. For these reasons, Adolfo is requesting a loan to buy toys at wholesale to expand his inventory.

loans.use: to buy toys at wholesale to expand his inventory.

loans.name: Azjan

texts.en:
Azjan is a 48-year-old married mother of five children. She works to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.
She is conservative woman and asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Azjan is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying desperately to satisfy her children's needs . Thus, she is acquiring a loan to pay her daughter's university tuition fees.

Azjan hopes to increase her income and continue to satisfy her children's needs.

loans.use: To pay her daughter`s university fees

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a married mother of four children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for  two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juana De La Paz

texts.es:
Juana, de 39 años, estudió hasta segundo grado, está casada y tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales, 4 de ellos dependen   económicamente de ella.

Juana, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 25 años, su esposo se dedica a la apicultura de colmenas y peceras.

Juana, necesita el crédito para comprar pantalones, faldas, blusas y ropa interior para ambos sexos.

Ella sueña con tener un local en el cual pueda vender su ropa, sin necesidad de salir a vender por las calles.
texts.en:
Juana, 39, studied until the second grade.  She is married with eight children, four of whom depend upon her financially. 

Juana has been selling clothing for 25 years, and her husband is a beekeeper and works with aquariums.

Juana needs the loan to purchase pants, skirts, blouses, and underwear for both sexes.

She dreams of having a stall from which she may sell her clothing, without the need to go out to the streets to make sales.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, blouses, and underwear for both sexes.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a conservative woman. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Wafaa has one girl child. Wafaa and her husband want to insure a comfortable life for their child. She is working as an employee in a company. Her husband is retired from the army. After that, they want to start a business to increase their income and to educate their daughter. 

They opened a market beside their house to keep them close to their daughter. The market is working well, but their daughter is becoming bigger and her needs will rise, so they think about expanding their market.

Wafaa is doing her best to insure the best life for her child. She does not want see her need anything. She asked for a loan to help her husband and to buy more products for their market and to expand it. She really needs your support.

loans.use: To help her husband and buy more products for her market and to expand it

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has 2 children.

Josephine operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, onions, cabbages and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a secure place and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of products.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, the business will support her family.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
Neng is 27 years old and the mother of one son who is still small. She and her husband make a living growing rice and as garment workers. Having been n this business for 27 years, she is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day and saves bout 20,000 KHR daily for future needs. 
Neng has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for two loans already. The past loans have helped her to support her family. Now, she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to raise crops to sell for a good price to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in a glass case, and cement, sand, gravel, and blocks, to construct a room for her store, and products to sell in the store.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Мээрим, 25 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Мээрим среднее образование, с 2009 года она в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. У Мээрим в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 23 овцы. На земельном участке мерою 1,0 ГА она выращивает люцерну. Мээрим известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и корма на зиму для животных. Доходы от кредита Мээрим планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Meerim is 25 years old, married and has two children. Meerim has secondary education. As the main income for her family, she works with agriculture, and has done so since 2009. Meerim has three cows and 23 sheep on her farm. On a plot of land of 1.0 hectares she grows alfalfa. 

Meerim is known as a principled, honest, decent and reliable person. To further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock feed for the winter. Meerim plans to use the income from the loan to further develop her business, building a livestock barn.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and livestock for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married father of eight children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a business transporting customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have five motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married mother of four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy animal feed and other farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will buy more dairy cows. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy animal feed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, fasteners, and wire to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, who is the mother of five children, has been a farmer for many years now. She lives with her family in Kitale, Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry at her farm, and she derives her income from selling milk and eggs. She makes extra money on the side by holding a wage-paying job and venturing into small personal businesses. 

Grace is seeking a loan with which to purchase poultry. She enjoys raising chickens. She has been to trainings that have empowered her to take calculated business risks. 

With your loan, Grace will be able to expand the poultry section of her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save money. Grace is very concerned about her children’s education; therefore, profits that will be acquired from the poultry sales will go towards her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Bahrigul

texts.ru: Бахригул жительница района Н.Хусрав. Ей 41 год. Она шустрая и ответственная женщина. Она имеет троих детей. Дети учатся в средней школе.Бахригул три года назад начала заниматься выращиванием мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас Бахригул берет кредит, чтобы сохранить бизнес, дальше продвигать деятельность и обеспечить семью. Она на заемные деньги будет покупать скотин. Это кредит поможет ей увеличить поголовье скота и не лишиться источника дохода и в будущем расшить бизнес и быть одним из успешных предпринимателей в этой области.
texts.en:
Bahrigul is a resident of the N. Khusrav region. She is 41 years old. She is a nimble and responsible woman, who has three children. The children are in high school. 

Bahrigul started working with breeding sheep and goats three years ago. Currently she takes a loan in order to keep and advance her business and provide for her family. She will purchase livestock for the loan amount. 

This loan will allow Bahrigul to increase the number of livestock and not lose her source of income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be one of the successful entrepreneurs in this area.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding, in order to keep her source of income

loans.name: Normhol

texts.ru: Это женщина Нормхол. Нормхол 54 летняя жительница района Шахритус. У нее большая семья. Она замужем и мать шестерых детей. Ее старшие сыновья находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Нормхол занимается разведением скотов течение 6 лет. Она занимается этой деятельностью у себя во дворе. От дохода животноводческой деятельности она обеспечивает семью. Нормхол покупает мелко рогатого скота, откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом вывозит на продажу. Ей в этом помогает ее муж. Цель данного кредита является развитие животноводческой деятельности. Нормхол планирует увеличить поголовье скота. Она надеется на Вашу помощь. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас.
texts.en:
This is Normhol. She is a 54 years old resident of the Shahrituz region. She has a large family. She is married and the mother of six children. Her eldest sons are migrant workers in the Russian Federation. 

Normhol has worked with cattle breeding in her own yard for a period of six years. She uses the income from the livestock breeding to provide for her family.

Normhol purchases livestock, fattens them for some months and then resells them. Her husband helps her with this. The goal of this loan is to develop her business. She plans to increase the number of livestock and hopes for your help. You can support her now.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kholjon

texts.ru: Холчон проживает в городке Турсунзаде. Город был назван в честь великого народного писателя и героя Таджикистана. Холчон годится тем, что живет в этом городе. Она живет вместе с семьей и детьми. Холчон занимается продажей тканей. Работать в сфере торговли ее научила мама, уже 4 год она в этой сфере деятельности и надеется, что будет дальше развиваться в этом направлении. Холчон любит свою работу и очень ценить свою семью. Смысл ее жизни это ее семья ее дети, ради них она живет и работает. Холчон решилась обратиться за кредитом, потому что хочет расширить свою деятельность и покрывать семейные расходы. Растут дети, растут и их расходы. Холчон за счет заемных средств купит тканей на продажу. Холчон безумно любит свою работу и верит, что может стать хорошим предпринимателем в своей сфере деятельности благодаря Вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
Kholjon lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. The town was named in honor of the great writer and national hero of Tajikistan. Kholjon is proud to live in this town. She lives together with her family and children. 

Kholjon works with selling fabric. Her mother taught her how to work in retail sales, and she has been in this area for four years. She hopes that she will further develop in this direction. Kholjon loves her work and appreciates her family. Her family and children give meaning to her life, and she lives and works side-by-side with them. 

Kholjon decided to apply for a loan because she would like to expand her business and cover the family's expenses. When the children grow, so do the expenses. Kholjon will use the loan amount to purchase fabric for selling. She loves her work and believes that she can become a great entrepreneur in her type of business. She thanks you for the support.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for selling and expanding her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has 2 children. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells cook stoves, basins, caps, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy cook stoves, basins, and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cook stoves, basins, and other items

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a married woman. She has three children. 

Robina operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high food prices. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a wholesale business. 

This is Robina's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baby clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 22-year old single woman from a village near Jerusalem. She lives with her family in a simple house and works as a nurse in a local health center. The income she earns is low.

She wants to improve herself and earn a higher degree in her field, so she has enrolled at the university. She has requested a loan from FATEN to help pay tuition. This loan will also help her to cover part of the urgent expenses she has.

loans.use: to pay university tuition this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gulbairakan

texts.ru: Гульбайракан успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Гульбайракан на сегодняшний день есть 4 коровы, 3 теленка, 10 овец. На участке мерою 0,50 Га она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Гульбайракан составляет 7,000 сом (KGS), этих средств кататстрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Гульбайракан и ее детей. Поэтому она решила и дальше развивать свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Гульбайракан планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также улучшить материальное благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en:
Gulbairakan successfully repaid her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. Currently Gulbairakan has four cows, three calves and ten sheep on her farm. She grows sweet corn on a plot of land of 0.50 hectares. 

Gulbairakan's monthly income is 7,000 som (KGS). This sum is unfortunately not enough for a decent life for Gulbairakan and her children. Therefore she decided to further develop her business and she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 95,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep for breeding. 

Gulbairakan plans to use the income from the loan to increase the number of livestock and also to improve her family's material well-being.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for breeding

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Она успешно погасила свой кредит. В хозяйстве Айгуль на сегодняшний день есть 2 дойной коровы, 15 овец, ежедневно она продает около 20 литров молока. На 3,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Айгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы и овец.  Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, а в ближайшее будущее планирует отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Aigul thanks Kiva as well as all the lenders who financed her previous loan, which she successfully repaid.  She currently has two dairy cows and 15 sheep on her farm, and she sells close to 20 liters of milk every day.  She also grows beans for resale on three hectares of her own land.  She makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).

Aigul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to help her buy one cow and a few sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her business and, in the near future, to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and some sheep to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Bar Phnom district in Prey Veng province, Kanha is a 20-year-old and she is single. To make a living, she has been farming rice and raising pigs for 2 years. She can earn a daily income of approximately KHR40,000 and is able to save about KHR20,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Kanha with VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan to pay her tuition fees to study Banking and Finance. She hopes to have a good job with a high salary after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees to study Banking and Finance.

location.town: Prey Veng province, Bar Phnom district

loans.name: Manar

texts.en:
Manar is 19 years old and lives with her family in Salt. She is in her second year in university, studying special needs.

Manar chose this major because of her love to help people and to provide service to the community. She aspires to open a health center for people who need special care which will be free. 

This will achieve her dream, of which she has long dreamed. She applied for an education loan to pay university fees and achieve her goals in her life.

loans.use: To pay university fees and achieve her goals in her life.

loans.name: Maria Maura

texts.es: Maura, de 26 años, estudio en la escuela de su comunidad donde solo pudo cursar hasta su cuarto año, sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarle. Ella está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura la siembra y cultivo de hortalizas, maíz, frijol y café son la fuente principal de ingresos económicos en su familia y hogar. Junto a él tienen cuatro hijos, dos estudian en la escuela y los otros dos están en lactancia. Mientras su esposo está en el campo ella elabora viveros de café los cuales son vendidos para obtener ingresos económicos que ayuden en el mejoramiento y economía de su hogar. Ellos agradecen a Dios por la oportunidad de proveerles compradores en otros municipios y lugares cerca de la ciudad por medio de contratos teniendo en estos una entrada segura. Sus viveros están ubicados en la parte de atrás de su casa de habitacion siendo ella la encargada de llevar a cabo la elaboración de los mismos mientras su esposo a diez minutos de su casa de habitacion se encarga de dar el mantenimiento y cuidado a la plantación de café. Sus metas ampliar aún más su propiedad, cultivar y sembrar más planta de café y que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro y oportunidades en la vida. Así mismo seguir mejorando su casa de habitación ya que necesita muchas mejoras. Maura solicita crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, foliares con los cuales podrá asistir sus cultivos de café por lo cual espera ser apoyada.
texts.en:
Maura, 26, attended school in her community but was only able to study until her fourth year.  Her parents had little resources and were not able to support it.  She is married, and her husband makes a living in agriculture by planting and growing vegetable crops. Corn, beans, and coffee are the main source of income for her family and the household.  Together they have four children; two are in school and the other two are breastfeeding.  

While her husband is in the fields, Maura prepares nurseries for the coffee plants that are later sold in order to get an income that helps with the improvement and finances of her household. They thank God for providing them buyers in other towns and places near the city; by means of contract they have a secured entry in these.  Their nurseries are located at the back of their house since Maura is in charge of preparing these while her husband is ten minutes away from home and in charge of the maintenance and care of the coffee plantation.  

Her goals are to increase their property, grow and plant more coffee, and make sure her children have a better future and opportunities in life.  At the same time, she wants to continue improving the house they live in because it needs many improvements.  Maura asks for a loan so that she can buy fertilizer, manure, and leaf treatments with which she will be able to tend to her coffee plants.  She hopes, therefore, to be supported.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and leaf treatments to  tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 48-year-old divorced mother of two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She has worked as a tailor from her home for twenty-five years to cover the needs and expenses of her family.

She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who has professional skills in her domain. She is trying her best to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary raw materials which will help her create unique clothes, and also she wants to help her son repair his car.

Asmahan hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials for her business and to repair her son's car

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a posho mill where she grinds maize to produce maize flour. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. 

Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be breakdowns of the posho mill. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy posho mill spare parts. Her business goal is to expand and open other branches within 5 years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her posho mill.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells bread and soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of bread and soft drinks. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap, detergent, beans, sugar, rice, candy, toilet paper, and the like.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat, 60 years old, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has four children in total; one is single and three are married. To make a living and support her family, Yat manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland that is located in her community. 

So far, she has been in this type of business for more than thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of about USD 5.00 a day. Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. 

Yat would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Luz, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Medellin, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 11 horas.
Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Luz ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar bebidas e ingredientes como arroz y carnes para sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hard-working, this is Luz, a woman who has dedicated a great part of her life to taking care of her children. She lives in Medellin, where she earns a living preparing various foods such as lunches and breakfasts in a small restaurant. She works alone every day for 11 hours. Her meals are known by the area neighbors who visit her restaurant because they know that they will eat a delicious meal.

Luz has decided to improve her business and increase her sales, so she seeks a loan to buy beverages and ingredients such as rice and meat for her recipes. This loan will enable her to move her business forward in order to obtain the necessary income that will give her the opportunity to support her family and business.

Support this woman with a loan and make her dreams reality!

loans.use: to buy beverages and ingredients such as rice and meat for her recipes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Sokhorn, 55, is married with two children. 

She and her husband have been catching fish for 37 years, and her husband earns additional income by working as a garment worker. They can earn about 41,000 KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs and they manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Sokhorn with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy fishing materials for supporting her business. She hopes to catch more fish so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for supporting her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Cylenser

texts.en:
Cylenser is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. His business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Las Luces Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos,  y su negocio es la venta de dulces.
Ella es emprendedora, sociable, agradable, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por encontrarse enclavado en los márgenes del majestuoso curso de agua, paseo tradicional del fin de semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales regionales en donde puede degustar la tradicional comida típica y realizar algunas actividades deportivas. El clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo recogido, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, usa blusa a rayas y pantalón beige). Su vida la realiza en casa de sus familiares, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su deseo de superación la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; elaboración de colchones,  venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura, venta de productos cosméticos, venta de chamarras, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo y venta de mandiles, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de dulces; Los dulces artesanales que elabora son un buen complemento alimenticio, porque no sólo son el placer de degustar un sabor, sino aportan a la alimentación diaria mediante; un contenido de calorías adecuado, Un Sabor y color apropiado a razón de la fruta con la que está elaborada, una acidez media, una consistencia y aspecto agradable, Y un aroma agradable. “los dulces son populares entre grandes y chicos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de dulces, ella desea realizar la compra de materia prima como; azúcar granulada, ácido cítrico, pectina, fruta, frasco de vidrio y de plástico para envasar y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de dulces artesanales por mayor.
texts.en:
Maria is a single 24-year-old woman without children, and she has a business selling sweets.

She is entrepreneurial, sociable, nice, independent, responsible, and hardworking. She conducts her business as a street vendor in the southern area of the city, an area characterized as nestled among the banks of a majestic stream, an area for traditional weekend strolls, and rustic construction with regional materials, where one can savor the traditional food and do some sports. The weather is warm, tropical, and humid, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade, all year long.

Maria is dark-skinned with long black hair that she ties up. She is short in stature, and her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home. She also speaks Spanish for general purposes and in her business (in the photo, she is seated in the center, with a striped blouse and beige pants).

She lives in a relative's home. They live in a rented house made of bricks, with a corrugated metal roof. They have potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. Her desire for self-improvement led her to form a group of people with businesses such as: production of mattresses, selling flowers, tea service, seamstress shop, selling cosmetics, selling jacket, video store, selling silverware, selling cellular phones, selling chicken, and selling fishing nets. She formed this group in order to request a loan, and accomplish her goals. 

Maria makes and sells sweets. The traditional sweets that she makes are nutritious, because not only do they have an enjoyable flavor, but they also contribute to the daily diet a portion of calories. The sweets are a suitable flavor and color due to the fruit from which they are made, with medium acidity, and a nice consistency, appearance, and aroma. "The sweets are popular among adults and children" says Maria.

Her dream is to have a store of sweets. she would like to buy supplies such as granulated sugar, citric acid, pectin, fruit, a glass jar and a plastic jar for packaging, and other things. This is the first request for a loan with the institution in her 9 years of doing business independently.

For these reasons, Maria is requesting a loan to buy supplies at wholesale to make traditional sweets

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale for making traditional sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in candy made of eucalyptus, honey, peanut, and caramel, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Christinah

texts.en:
Christinah is a married woman. She has three children. 

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be crop pests. 

Christinah will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer. She hopes that, in the future, she will be a vegetable supplier in the country. 

This is Christinah's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer  de 25 años es soltera, ella es una persona muy amable, vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas la Unión, junto a su padres y hermanos.
