Margarita (la primera de izquierda a derecha de la fotografía) es muy disciplinada con su actividad, ella desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, ya que es una buena oportunidad de generar ingresos, Margarita es una vendedora ambulante vende en su comunidad y lugares aledaños. Ella necesita ampliar su venta pero el problema es que no cuenta con suficiente capital, a raíz de este problema Margarita está solicitando un prestamo y con este dinero ella estaría comprando más ropa para satisfacer a su clientela.
 
Margarita es una persona muy solidaria y le gusta  compartir con las personas, pues ella para obtener el prestamo conformo un grupo, para que las otras compañeras puedan generar más ingresos en  sus negocios y tener superación en la vida. Otra de las razones por que Margarita decidió buscar un prestamo grupal, es que la garantía que pide la institución es accesible y entre todas la consiguen más, esta es la razón del crédito grupal pero para conformar el grupo ella busco gente responsable para  no tener problemas con los pagos. 
Las aspiraciones de Margarita es conseguir un espacio donde puede construir su propio local y lo ideal es que sea en el mercado de su comunidad para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 25-year-old woman, single, and a very kind person. She lives in a community of San Tomas la Unión, with her parents and siblings. 
Margarita (first from left to right in the photograph) is very disciplined with her occupation. For the last three years, she has worked in the sale of traditional clothing, as this is a good opportunity to generate income. Margarita is a street vendor, she sells in her community and in adjoining places. She needs to expand her sales, but the problem is that she does not have sufficient capital. Because of this problem, Margarita is requesting a loan, and with this money she will purchase more clothing to satisfy her clients. 
Margarita is a very supportive person and she likes to share with people. To get a loan, she formed a group, so the other members can generate more income in their businesses and be more successful in life. One of the other reasons why Margarita decided to look for a group loan, is that the guarantee that the institution asks for is accessible, and together they can achieve it. This is the reason for the group loan, but to form the group she looked for responsible people so as not to have problems with payments. 
Margarita’s aspirations are to get a space where she can build her own store, and the ideal would be to have it in the market of her community to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing.

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Soeun (shown in the photo) is 52 years old and lives at Posen Chey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Soeun has been married since 1982 and has three sons and two daughters. Two are married, two are garment workers, and the last one has studied.

Soeun has been a farmer for 30 years, while her husband is a blacksmith with one year's experience. Now Soeun would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to take to work.

She said that "if my daughter has her own motorbike to take to work, it will make her transport easy." Every day,  her daughter goes to work with her friends.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to take to work

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; la socia sigue trabajando para una empresa pública y a la compra y venta de terrenos, la socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de un electrodoméstico para su casa.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank "Padre Urraca."  She continues to work for a public company and buy and sell land.  She is grateful for the loan that she is receiving through these means, and promises to comply with the established payment terms.  She is a responsible and hardworking person who, in this way, is getting ahead with her family. 

This borrower is requesting a loan to buy an appliance for her house.

loans.use: to buy an appliance for her house

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is 38 years old. She is a married woman who comes from a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

To earn a living, she manages and operates a framing business on a small piece of farmland, which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to local dealers. So far, she has been involved with this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of $2.00 each day.

The income that she receives from her farming is very low. She wants to have one more business as a supplementary income. However, her limited capital does not allow her to do so. That is why she is applying for a KIVA loan as capital to run a business of buy-and-sell scrap. This loan will allow her to have one more source of income, which helps to remove poverty from her life. 

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support to poor people.

loans.use: to provide capital to start a business of buy-and-sell scrap.

loans.name: Bima

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for us to introduce you to one of Ruma new agents, Bima. Bima lives in Sukabumi, West Java, located about two hours' drive from Jakarta. He just joined Ruma a week ago. He decided to join Ruma because he was interested in Ruma’s product called Mapan. Mapan is an e-commerce for lower communities. By serving Mapan to his customers, Bima will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Bima will simply send an SMS in a format to the SMS center and then the customer will pay him. After that, Ruma’s agent will come to his stall to collect the money and within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to customer's door.

As the business has just started, Bima needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Bima improve his business and accordingly, his community, who need access to such services. As seen in the photo, Bima is holding Mapan’s poster. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: To provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Soñadoras Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres muy emprendedoras: Velia, Alejandrina y Jordina que se organizaron hace aproximadamente hace dos años, para accesar a créditos mediante la metodología grupal, con el propósito de crecer en sus pequeños negocios que emprendieron con esfuerzos propios para generar ingresos y cubrir necesidades de educación, ropa y alimentación de sus hijos. El nombre del  grupo Soñadoras, lo escogieron porque para ellas significa un sueño hecho realidad el ser sujetas de financiamiento y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
 
Velia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Soñadoras, es una mujer alegre, con cualidades de líder, tiene 30 años de edad, originaria de Bilwi, tiene 4 hijos: El mayor de 13 años de edad estudia su segundo año de secundaria, el de 11 años de edad cursa su quinto grado de primaria y dos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como ayudante en un taller de mecánica. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 3 años con gran esfuerzo y apoyo económico de su esposo,  estableció una pequeña pulpería en un anexo de madera que construyo pegado a su vivienda, inicio con un pequeño capital de C$4,000 (Cuatro Mil Córdobas Netos), aun recuerda con gran alegría que su primera compra fueron granos básicos, aceite y chiverías.  Solicita financiamiento  para poder incrementar su mercadería y poder generar más ingresos, comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, embutidos, pollo, entre otros productos. Su sueño es compra una mantenedora para vender productos lácteos y carne molida, llegar a convertirse en una comerciante con un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 enterprising women: Velia, Alejandrina y Jordina who got together about 2 years ago in order to access the group loans. Their goal was to expand their small businesses that they began with their own efforts to generate income and cover the educational needs, clothing and food of their children. The name of the group is the "Soñadoras". They choose this as for them it represents a dream come true; to receive a loan and improve their quality of living and that of their families.

Velia is the coordinator of the group "Soñadoras". She is a joyful woman with leadership qualities. She is 30 years old and a native of Bilwi. She has 4 children. The oldest is 13 and is studying in second year of secondary school. The 11 year old studies in Grade 5 and there are two younger children. Her husband works informally as an assistant in a garage.

With the goal of making her own source of income and to help with the household expenses she opened a small store 3 year ago through much effort and with economic support from her husband. It is in a small add-on built onto her house. She started with a small capital of 4,000 NIO and she still fondly remembers that her first purchase was basic grains, oil and snacks.

She is requesting a loan to be able to increase her merchandise to be able to generate higher income. She will buy basic grains, snacks, cold cuts, chicken, amongst other products. Her dream is to buy a cooler to store dairy products and ground beef so as to become a merchant with a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, cold cuts, chicken, amongst others.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells maize, beans, groundnuts and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area. 

Margaret will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of maize, beans, groundnuts and other cereals. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her child to the highest level. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize, beans, groundnuts, and other cereals

loans.name: Fresa Roja Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por cuatro mujeres alegres y luchadoras (Dora Rosario, Elena Macarena, Rosa Maricela y Cindy Alsira), viven en Bilwi; se unieron hace cinco meses, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios: Venta de ropa nueva, pulpería y venta de verduras y bastimentos, para mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de sus familias.

Elena Macarena: Es integrante del grupo solidario,  es casada, tiene un hijo pequeño de 3 años de edad Su esposo trabaja como ayudante en una abarrotería. Desde hace 3 meses estableció su pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de madera, inicio con un pequeño capital de C$ 6000 (Seis Mil Córdobas Netos) que con esfuerzo y ahorro en conjunto con su esposo logran instaurar su pequeño negocio;  de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chivería, aceite, papel higiénico, detergente, cloro, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y diversificar con nuevos productos, como venta de cosméticos y ropa interior.
texts.en:
The group is made up of four cheerful and determined women (Dora Rosario, Elena Macarena, Rosa Maricela, and Cindy Alsira). They live in Bilwi, and they got together five months ago, with the purpose of working in a supportive manner to access loans in Pana Pana and to have the opportunity to increase the inventory of their small businesses: new clothing sales, small grocery store, and sale of vegetables and supplies, to improve their income and the quality of life of their families. 
Elena Macarena: she is a member of the supportive group, she is married, and she has a small son who is 3 years old. Her husband works as an assistant in a grocery store. Three years ago, she opened her small grocery shop in the hall of her wooden house. She started with the small capital of $6000C (Córdobas) which with a lot of effort and savings, together with her husband, they managed to establish their own business. In this way, she generates her own income, and contributes to household expenses and for the studies of her son. She is asking for financing to purchase: staple grains, dairy products, oil, toilet paper, detergent, chlorine, among other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and diversify with new products, such as cosmetic sales and underwear.

loans.use: to purchase: staple grains, dairy products, oil, toilet paper, detergent, chlorine, among other products.

loans.name: Channary

texts.en:
Channary (in photo) is 38 years old and lives in Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 2004 and has two sons. They are still young.

She is a caregiver for her kids and a farmer with two years' experience, while her husband is a construction worker with five years' experience. Now she is applying for a loan to plant lotus and buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To plant lotus and buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento EMANUEL compuesta por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como;  transporte público, cerrajería, venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.

Ninfa  es la presidenta del banco (en la foto es la que está sentada de chompa ploma y cabello corto la que esta con su sonrisa) es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo de 18 años y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en ferias de la ciudad como la ’16 de julio’ que se realiza los días jueves y domingos; donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para hasta un auto. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Ninfa es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, habla español, Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como empleado y su hijo que se encuentra estudiando. Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; Ají de lengua (lengua de vaca, papa, cebolla, acompañada de una de salsa picante), Fritanga (cerdo en pequeños trozos, ají, chuño y maíz), Lagua de Chuño (Sopa preparada con chuño, carne de cordero, chalona remojada, papas, hojas de repollo, cebolla, condimentos con orégano), Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana y recorre las diferentes ferias de la ciudad para vender su comida. “aprendí a cocinar ayudando a mi mama ..” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes de forma adecuada. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ninfa solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes de manera adecuada.
texts.en:
The communal bank Emanuel is made up of eight members, six women and two men. They work in different occupations, such as: public transport, locksmithing, fruit sales, juice sales, clothing sales, cosmetic sales, food sales, and vegetables sales. For this reason, they ask for a loan to expand their businesses. 
Ninfa is the president of the group (in the picture, she is the one sitting, with a grey sweater, and short hair, and is smiling). She is a 55-year-old woman, married, she has one son who is 18 years old and her business is food sales. 
She is a good and hard-working mother. She is a street vendor in city fairs, such as the one of ‘July 16,’ which is held on Thursdays and Sundays. Here you can find anything, from a needle to a car. It has a cold and dry climate, and a temperature which changes during the day from 2 to 12 degrees centigrade. 
Ninfa is brown skinned, she has short black hair, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works as an employee, and her son, who is studying. They live in a rental house which has potable water, electricity, sewage, and gas. Her business is the sale of traditional food, such as: Ají de lengua (cow tongue, potato, onion, with a spicy sauce), fritanga (pig in small pieces, pepper, potato, and maize), Lagua de Chuño (soup made with potato, lamb meat, soaked dried meat, cabbage, onion, and oregano condiments). She does this work every day of the week, and she goes to the different fairs in the city to sell her food, “I learned to cook by helping my mother…” she says. Her dream is to have her own home. She wants to expand her business by purchasing tables and chairs to tend to her clients in an adequate manner. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution, in the 20 years that she has had this occupation.
It is for these reasons that Ninfa asks for a loan, to purchase tables and chairs to tend to her clients in an adequate manner.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be business-oriented. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a favourable location and her primary customers are locals. 

Evelyne describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better living standard. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Thekrayat

texts.en:
Thekrayat is 33 years old and she lives in Irbid. She is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. She is married and has two children. 

Thekrayat is one of the successful businesswomen in her town. For more than three years she has been busy with buying and selling blankets. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experience and skills help her to develop her business and in this way improve her living conditions. Although she is suffering an illness due to disease, she wants to provide a comfortable life for her children. Therefore, she wants to develop her business further but her income is insufficient and she has asked for financial help to improve her business. Thekrayat has applied for a loan to buy clothes to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has three children who range in age from five years to 15 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing. 

He operates a grocery store where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are loyal. He will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy and stock more fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to improve his standard of living. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Mary, 62, a mother who has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and farming. Mary hails from Kapsowar, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns and this boosts crop production in the area. 

Mary, being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hardworking mother, Mary has always ensured that she puts food on the table for her family. She also ensures that she is able to send her children to school. 

Mary detests living in conditions of poverty and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold on the local market and this means improved cash flow. Through improved cash flow her profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and send her kids to school. 

Through your loan Mary will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living and also those of people living within the area. Mary is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sewing machine and some tools to improve and expand her husband's shop

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
Faysal is one resident of Sana'a, Yemen who runs a small cafeteria.  He is a married man and a father of only one child, living with his family in a rented house close to his business. He studied until the secondary education level. Due to the miserable conditions of his family, Faysal couldn't complete his studies.

His small cafeteria is the sole source of income for Faysal and his child. Inside that cafeteria, Faysal makes different types of sandwiches and drinks for local residents. In truth, his income is very low and not enough to cover the necessary expenses of his child because he doesn't have enough equipment as well as fruits and necessary materials to make sandwiches and drinks.

Faysal needs necessary financial support to improve the work inside his cafeteria. Therefore, he applied to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank and asked for a loan of 150,000 YER to purchase some necessary fruits and materials to make different kinds of drinks and sandwiches which will enable him to attract a lot of customers.

Faysal is looking forward to expanding his business more through opening another cafeteria.

loans.use: to purchase some necessary fruits and materials to make different kinds of drinks and sandwiches which enable him to attract a lot of customers

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is a conservative woman, so she asked her only son to take her place in the photo.

Intesar is 45 years old and lives in Salt. A widowed woman, she has only one child.

She is seeking a loan for her son who is 25 years old. He is a student in the university and majoring in accounting. He is facing some problems in covering his university fees due to the weak economic situation of the family but Intesar wants to see him become a very successful man in future. She doesn't have anyone but her son, so she applied for a loan to cover the semester fees. Maybe one day he can get a good job and be an important man.

loans.use: To cover the semester fees, hoping maybe one day her son can get a good job and be an important man.

loans.name: Sophol

texts.en:
Sophol is 58 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. One of her children is still in school. She has struggled to feed her children by farming rice for 33 years. She earns about 54,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 24,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Sophol has never been with VisionFund before and this is her first loan. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her production of healthy rice so as to increase her family’s income, enabling her to improve their living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and organic compost, and to tend to her rice crop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en un zona muy transitada, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con su familia, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: carne, pollo, huevos, arroz, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, refrescos,  etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated is 27 years old. She lives in a high risk area. She has sold food for 5 years. Her business is located near her home in a well-traveled area. With the earnings that she makes, she is able to help her family get ahead. The young woman lives in her own house with her spouse and their child. She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as: beef, chicken, eggs, rice, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, sodas, etc. wholesale to be able to continue with her business, since it is her only source of work. That way she will have greater income.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, eggs, rice, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, sodas, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; la socia Dominga continua dedicándose al negocio de autopartes de autos como parabrisas, faros entre otros, la socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de faros entre otros.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the communal bank “Padre Urraca.” Dominga continues working at her business selling spare parts for cars, including windshields and headlights, among other things. 

She is thankful for the loan through this medium, and she promises to comply with the established repayment schedule. She wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

She requests the loan to buy headlights among other things.

loans.use: to buy headlights, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in medications and vitamins to sell on foot.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; el socio  Manuel continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para autos, el socio continua vendiendo  lo que son parabirsas,faros,llantas entre otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
EL socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de faros entre otros.
El socio agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This man belongs to the communal bank “Padre Urraca.” Manuel continues working in his business selling spare parts for cars. He continues selling windshields, headlights, and tires, among other things. In this way, he takes his family forward.

He requests the loan to buy headlights, among other things.

He is thankful for the loan through this platform, and he promises to comply with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy headlights, among other things.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Evangelina  continua dedicándose al  negocio de venta de ropa como chompas, casacas entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the communal bank “Qorichaskas.” The bank is located in the province of Cusco.

Evangelina continues working in her business selling clothing, including sweaters and coats, among other things. She is thankful for the loan offered, and she promises to comply with the established repayments. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She requests the loan to buy coats, among other things.

loans.use: to buy coats, among other things.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 23 years old, and she lives with her family in Nablus.

She has a poultry farm, and she earns a monthly income of 800 USD. She started her business in 2010.

She needs this youth loan to expand her yard.  She wants to buy poultry feeds and increase the quantity of chickens, which will help her to improve their financial conditions, will lead to supporting the needs of her family, and she will reinvest in her business.

Lina is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and increase the quantity of chickens

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a married man. He has 2 children who are ages 4 and 9 years. He describes himself to be loyal.

He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in climate.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.). His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. A previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ala`a

texts.en:
Ala`a is a conservative woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo above,

Ala`a earned a diploma in English. Her husband has a cultural center located in the same place they live. The idea of creating the center came in response to the lack of cultural centers competent to teach high school students in the region. After a period of time, the pair decided to improve the center and her husband painted the walls and bought a board and set of chairs. In addition to that, her husband distributed pamphlets to promote the center and its goals. Through the establishment of good relations with the students and their parents, they achieved diffusion in the region and he decided to expand the project.

Ala`a, who wants to benefit the community and increase its culture and who also wants to encourage her husband to work hard to reach the summit, decided to request a loan to help her husband build an extra room. This room will be used for storage of books and papers and as an extra classroom when they need to open an additional course.  In addition, she will use a portion of the loan to buy teaching materials to help raise the quality of education and increase their monthly income.

loans.use: to help her husband build an extra room for storage of books and papers.

loans.name: Marinnho

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de snack, el socio continua vendiendo  hamburguesas, gaseosas entre otros, él socio  es docente en una de las universidades de la ciudad del Cusco, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
EL socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de galletas, tortas entre otros.
El socio agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en: The member belongs to the “PADRE URRACA” communal bank. He combines his daily activities with his snack business. He continues to sell hamburgers, soft drinks, amongst others. He is a professor in one of the universities in the city of Cusco and this is the way he supports his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy biscuits and cakes amongst others. The member is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of his installments within the specified time frame.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, cakes, etc.

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.en:
Bibirajab is an honest woman. She is a widow who was born in 1956, and has one child. She lives in a village. 

Bibirajab is a responsive, hardworking, and experienced person. She is a cook, and has worked at private restaurant for about three years. Her earnings are spent on her daily needs. 

Bibirajab's apartment is in bad condition, and she is planning to renovate. She would like to be financially supported for the renovating of her apartment.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells pineapples, mangoes, watermelons and other fruits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Margaret will use her KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of mangoes, pineapples, bananas and other fruits. Her business goal is to be able to serve a wide market within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mangoes, pineapples, bananas and other fruits

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sand. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are house builders. She describes her biggest business challenge to be not owning her own transport truck. 

Philis will use her KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of sand. Her business goal is to buy her own truck within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: yucca, potatoes, cold drinks, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wrenches, pliers, sledgehammers, exhausts, radiators, etc

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Sonia continua con su negocio de venta medias, la socia continua vendiendo  por el centro de la ciudad su mercadería a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de medias para niñas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Qorichaskas Communal Bank, which is located in the province of Cusco. 

Sonia continues with her business, selling socks.  She continues selling her merchandise throughout the city center to all of her customers, upon request.  She is a responsible and persevering person, as that is the way that she supports her family.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of socks for little girls. She feels grateful for the loan that she has been given, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase socks for little girls.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Justina  continua con su  negocio de venta de ropa al por mayor, la socia vende su mercadería  a todos sus cliente que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
texts.en:
The associate Justina belongs to the communal bank QORICHASKAS, the bank is located in the province of Cusco. Justina continues with her wholesale clothes business. She sells her merchandise to a wide array of customers. 

Justina feels thankful for the loan she will be given and is committed to paying the established quotas. In this way Justina can keep taking care of her family. 

Justina seeks a loan to buy jackets and other clothing products.

loans.use: to buy jackets and other clothing products.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. 

Noel will use her KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, potatoes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, potatoes

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a married man. He has 2 children aged 3 years and 8 years. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a laundry business. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are consumers. He will use his KES 20,000 loan to buy cleaning detergents.

loans.use: to buy cleaning detergents

loans.name: Mariví Adelahida

texts.es:
Marivi, es una joven estudiante que vive junto a sus padres y 4 hermanos. Ella es la segunda de cuatro hermanos. Su papá es mecánico automotriz, realizando trabajos temporales y su mami es ama de casa.
Actualmente, está cursando el 3° Ciclo de la carrera Redes de Computadoras y Comunicación de datos, la cual le parece muy interesante porque es una carrera de alta demanda. Ella piensa especializarse en el campo de redes, diseño web, entre otras áreas, porque siente que la beneficiaría en muchos aspectos por la vida actual que estamos llevando (mundo tecnológico).
 Debido a la situación económica de sus padres le es muy complicado poder continuar solventando sus gastos, es por ello, que recurre a KIVA para solicitar el apoyo y así culminar sus estudios exitosamente.
De no contar con el apoyo que le permita solventar su carrera, ella hubiera tenido que dejar de estudiar para trabajar hasta poder reunir el dinero necesario que le permita cubrir sus gastos. Es por ello, que se encuentra muy agradecido con el apoyo otorgado por KIVA para la culminación de su carrera y les pide que sigan apoyando a más personas que tienen deseo de superación, pero sin embargo no pueden culminar con sus estudios por medios económicos.
texts.en:
Marivi is a young student who lives with her parents and her 4 siblings. She is the second of four children. Her father is an auto mechanic, performing temporary jobs, and her mother is a homemaker. Currently, Marivi is in her 3rd semester of the Computer Networks and Data Communication program, which is very interesting to her because it is a career that is in high demand. Marivi plans to specialize in the field of networks and web design, among other areas because she feels that it would benefit her in many aspects of life today (the technological world).

Due to her parents' economic situation, it is very difficult for them to continue paying her expenses. For this reason, she turned to KIVA to request help and be able to finish her studies successfully. Because she didn't have the money to be able to pay for her program, Marivi had to stop studying to work until she can gather the money she needs to cover her expenses. For that reason, she is very grateful for the support offered by KIVA to finish her program, and she hopes that they keep helping more people who want to succeed but cannot finish their studies for economic reasons.

loans.use: to pay her expenses for studies in Computer Networks and be able to support her family.

loans.name: Saroun

texts.en:
Saroun is 24 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one son in a rural area located in Siem Reap province. She has been raising pigs and selling snacks in her village for 6 years. The current business earns her family about 80,000 KHR per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 3,000 KHR each day. 

Saroun is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sreytouch's Group

texts.en:
Sreytouch is a 45-year-old mother of two children living in a rural village of the Srey Snom District, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for 27 years; sometimes she also sells snacks. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth microloan for Sreytouch with Kiva partner VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sreytouch will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay labor fees

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Caramelo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por mujeres dinámicas y emprendedoras. Luisa Amanda y Erlinda tienen una pequeña pulpería y Celsi vende repostería, de la etnia miskita que viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Las tres se han propuesto luchar para hacer crecer sus negocios, con el deseo de llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida personal y de sus familias; se organizaron hace 5 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Erlinda: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, casada, tiene  3 hijos: El mayor de 20 años estudia su 5to año de su carrera universitaria Ingeniería en Sistema en una universidad del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, los gemelos de 15 años de edad cursan su quinto año de secundaria. Con el propósito de apoyar a su esposo que se encuentra desempleado y que colabore con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 6 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo de madera, la cual es atendida por su esposo. Ella cuenta con una experiencia de 8 años de ser docente de una escuela primaria en Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos para su pulpería: Granos básicos, chiverías, sopas instantáneas, papel higiénico, huevo, pan, entre otros productos, así incrementar sus ingresos. Ella y su esposo sueñan con diversificar su negocio y vender embutidos, productos lácteos, carne molida, pollo, verduras, bastimentos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is formed of dynamic and entrepreneur women. Luisa Amanda and Erlinda have a small convenience store and Celsi sells pastries. They are from the miskita ethnic group of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. The three have decided to work hard to grow their businesses. Their wish is to be able to have a better quality of life for themselves and their families. Five months ago they organized the group to have access to Pana Pana group guarantee loans.

Erlinda is a member of the group. She is a polite woman, married and has 3 children. The oldest is 20 years old and is in his 5th year of the System Engineering program at the university of the Puerto Cabezas municipality. The twins are 15 years old and are in their 5th year of secondary school. With the purpose of supporting her husband who is unemployed and to help with the house expenses and the education of their children, she established a small convenience store in her wood stilt home six years ago that her husband tends to.  She has 8 years of experience teaching in a primary school in Bilwi.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products for the convenience store: basic grains, snacks, instant soups, toilet paper, egg and bread among other products to increase their revenue. She and her husband dream of expanding the business to sell cold cuts, dairy products, ground beef, chicken, vegetables and supplies.

loans.use: to buy: basic grains, snacks, instant soups, toilet paper, eggs, bread, among other products.

loans.name: Diego Giraldo

texts.es:
Diego es caficultor desde hace 25 años él vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Diego está en el proceso de conversión de café convencional a café orgánico, él tiene 5.500 árboles de café y está sembrando 4.000 árboles de cafe organico, para esto el necesita 5.000.000 millones de pesos para comprar abonos orgánicos sólidos y líquidos que le permita mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción. Su meta a mediano plazo es certificarse como productor organico; a nivel familiar Diego quiere terminar sus estudios universitarios y garantizarle la educación a sus hijos.

La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Diego ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La Federación Campesina del Cauca está convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia
texts.en:
Diego has been a coffee grower for 25 years. He lives with his wife and his two children. Diego is in the process of converting his crops from conventional coffee crops to organic coffee crops. He has 5,500 coffee trees and he is planting 4,000 organic coffee trees. He needs 5,000,000 COP in order to buy solid and liquid organic fertilisers, which will enable him to improve his yield and the quality of his crops. His mid-term goal is to get certified as an organic producer. Diego wants to finish his studies at university and ensure his children get an education.

Converting to, and producing, organic coffee is an intensive process which is healthy, balanced, and environmentally-friendly in the long term. It is a challenge for the farmers of Colombia. Diego has decided not to risk his own health, or that of his family or the consumers, by continuing to use chemicals. The Federación Campesina del Cauca is convinced that it is worth it to support and strengthen these alternative initiatives. A loan with Kiva represents a sustainable future for their production, their land, and their families.

loans.use: to grow organic coffee

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa es una mujer muy sencilla y amable, ella es casada tiene 36 años, vive en una comunidad de San Antonio Suchitepéquez, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. 

Justa es una mujer muy perseverante para con su familia, ella desde hace 7 años se dedica a compra y venta de cortes típicos, ha sido muy responsable en su negocio y es por eso que tiene clientela y vende fácilmente, con este negocio Justa ayuda a cubrir algunas necesidades, cuando el esposo no se da abasto con los gastos del hogar.
Justa con el afán de darle una mejor comodidad a su familia, ella decide buscar un prestamo de cuatro mil quetzales que le servirá para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que ella necesita ampliar su casa y la meta de Justa es para que sus hijos tengan cada quien su propio cuarto.  

Justa tiene esperanzas  que le ira bien en su negocio y con los ingresos ella se encarga de pagar el prestamo respetando el plan de pagos, El anhelo de Justa es ver su casa con otra perspectiva y para que sus hijos vivan felices.
texts.en:
Justa is a very simple and kind woman. She is 36 years old and married. She lives in a community in San Antonio Suchitepéquez with her husband and her four children.

Justa is a very persevering woman. For seven years she has been making a living by buying and selling yards of traditional fabric. She has been very responsible with her business; for this reason, she has many clients and sells her products easily. This business helps Justa to cover some of her needs when her husband is not able to cope with all the household expenses.

With the goal of making her family more comfortable, Justa decided to request a loan of four thousand quetzals, which will help her to buy building materials as she needs to expand her house. Justa’s goal is for each of her children to have a room of their own. 

Justa hopes that everything will go well for her business and that, with the income derived from it, she will pay off the loan according to the repayment plan. Justa’s wish is to see her house from another perspective and for her children to be happy.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr: Djatougbé est une jeune femme de 23ans. Elle est mariée et ils ont un enfant de 1an 8 mois en charge. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle revend des pagnes et haricots à domicile et s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Son premier crédit l'aidera à acheter des pagnes et des céréales(maïs, haricot...). Elle désire devenir une grande commerçante et assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en: Diatougbe is a 23-year old woman. She is married and, with her husband, is taking care of a child who is one year and eight months old. In order to help her husband with family expenses, she sells traditional colorful “pagnes” fabric as well as beans out of her home. She stocks at the main market of LOmé. Her first loan will allow her to buy fabric and cereals (corn, beans etc). She would like to become a well-known vendor and provide for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура,  32 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование-среднее. Дети все школьного возраста, помогают по хозяйству. Уже 5 лет Айнура занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 2 коровы, 3 лошади. Также Айнура занимается швейным делом, у нее есть 3 швейные машинки, на которых она шьет постельные принадлежности под заказ местных жителей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 лошадей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Ainura is 32 years old, married and the mother of three. She has received secondary education. All her children are of school age and help out on the farm. Ainura has been engaged in farmwork for five years: she raises livestock and grows farm produce. Thanks to Ainura’s hard work, at present she has a nice farm: two cows and three horses. She also works as a seamstress; she owns three sewing machines and takes orders for bed linens from the locals. In order to develop her business further, Ainura has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS o buy two horses in order to increase her livestock. Ainura plans to use the resulting revenues for an additional livestock increase.

loans.use: to purchase two horses in order to increase the size of livestock.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells coconuts, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are regulars.

Mwanamisi will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of coconuts, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to expand to wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconuts, flour, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the soil for the new season by plowing it and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He describes himself as reliable. George operates a school and has been involved in this business for four years. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of enough desks and chairs. 

George will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy chairs, tables, and materials to build more classes. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and materials to build more classes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of artifacts.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is grateful that she was granted a prior 50,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Through the earnings made possible by this loan, she was better able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Now she is requesting a new loan for another PHP 50,000 which she will use to buy more fertilizer and farm supplies to produce a greater harvest on her farm.  She is grateful for having the chance to earn a good return on her investment, and dreams of being able to make her farm grow and flourish. She prays for the health and protection of her children as they go to work, and  faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening supplies.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is a conservative woman. She asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. Yousra is very active and a hard-working woman. She is 46 years old and a mother of three children.  Yousra cannot stop loving her work and wanting to do something special. She is making dairy products and all of her customers always recommend her products for their cleanliness and good quality.

Yousra does not give up in low dairy seasons, when she sews wool. She has always faced hard conditions in her life, but she knows very well how to cover her family's expenses without asking for help from any body. She has been working in this field since she was 15 years old.

Yousra's ambition is to develop her project, improve her reputation, and increase the number of her customers. So she is seeking a loan to make her dream come true. Yousra asked for a loan to buy tools that will help her to improve the quality of her products and expand her work.

loans.use: To buy tools that will help her to improve the quality of her products and expand her work.

loans.name: Makram

texts.en: Makram is 23 years old, single and lives in the town of Ajloun, where he is studying business administration. His dad has retired from the army, and lately his family has faced financial problems which have prevented Makram from paying his tuition. That is why he has decided to apply for a loan to help cover the cost of his education. He hopes this will enable him to finish his studies and get a good job with high salary.

loans.use: to help him pay university fees.

loans.name: Chheng Heng

texts.en:
Chheng Heng , 29, is from a rural village located in the Pouk district of Siem Reap Province. He is married with one daughter who is still small for school. To support his family, he has been working with World Vision for five years. The current job earns him about 17 USD per day. 

Chheng Heng has never been with VisionFund before. Now he is applying for a loan to pay for his tuition fees. He wants to study for a master’s degree in management. He hopes that this loan will enable him to stay in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition to study for a master's degree in management.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 52 years old and lives in the Chroy Changava district in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1981, with three sons and seven daughters. Five are married, three are factory workers and the others are attending school.

Presently, Sok is a farmer with 10 years of her experience, and her husband is a construction worker at a private company. She would like to apply for a loan to buy a machine and silks for her weaving. She wants to do it this during her free time.

loans.use: To buy a machine and silks for her weaving.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Nzinga

texts.en: Nzinga is a married man with two children, ages 3 years and 10 years old. He describes himself as loyal. He operates a transportation business, driving customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather which affect business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to service his motorcycle. He hopes to expand his business in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance service for his motorcycle

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin describes himself to be polite and honest. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area good for customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to increase his stock of fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will have an improved living standard.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to increase his stock

loans.name: Darwich

texts.en:
Darwich is a 23-year-old single Palestinian man who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has been working in transporting students and employees for three years to cover his needs and expenses.

Darwich is working hard to improve his life despite the hard living conditions in the camp. He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to buy a new engine for his car, which is his only source of income. Darwich hopes to open his own transportation company in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his car, which is his only source of income

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as responsible. Linet operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, flour, milk, toothpaste, and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. Linet describes her biggest business challenge as inflation of prices. 

Linet will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of washing soap, flour, sugar, bread, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life with her children. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, flour, sugar, bread, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself as determined. Elizabeth operates a retail business where she sells charcoal and also cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of charcoal.

Elizabeth will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and give them a good life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has two children. Anthony operates a retail business where he sells beauty products. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge as price fluctuations.

Anthony will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open more business branches. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He repaid his previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to construct a restaurant

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic location, and his primary customers are large-scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Her name is Pearly, 28, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Rico Boy, a tricycle driver. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs.

Pearly operates a tricycle unit. Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Cavite, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The townspeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes, and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of Php 700 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan which she will use for maintenance of her tricycle and to pay for a spare tire. It is important that her unit is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transport service is really a need in their area. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial aid that will be extended to her, for it will surely help in their daily sustenance.

Pearly dreams to be successful and be able to put up other business to give her future kids a decent life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a spare tire, gas, and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Kefaya

texts.en: Kefaya is married and the mother of five children. Because her husband is facing financial problems and not making enough money to pay for all of their children's needs, she decided to help him by opening a retail business where she sells clothes and blankets. She is working hard and has been involved in this business for one year. She works in her home, and most of her customers are regular buyers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of capital, and is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and products to sell. Her goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she and her family will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and products to sell.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a married woman with three children. She is 43 years old and lives in Baqaa. Raeda is a conservative woman and asked her son to take her place in the photo.
 
One of her children is Ibrahim. He is 22 years old and studying mechanical engineering. Ibrahim is studying this major because he feel that it will help him to show his creativity and ideas. Raeda feels that her son Ibrahim will be someone important in the future. She cannot wait to see him in the graduation dress.

Raeda asked for an education loan to pay her son`s semester fees and to buy his books.

loans.use: To pay her son`s semester fees and to buy his books

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a dedicated, determined and honest farmer. She is based in Kitale, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest maize growing regions, lending it the nickname of “maize region.” For the past three years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income is selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. 

Smiling, and bursting from happiness and excitement, Rebecca feels very content and motivated. With this loan, she may be able to start her own poultry business, which is a dream she has chased for many years. Because of different basic financial circumstances, she has not been able to achieve it. 

Rebecca passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up: “I have to do something for my family,” she has said. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance organization that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. She is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Rebecca will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: To pay for poultry to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 60-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He started ten years ago repairing electronics to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Ali is a hard worker who has a good reputation and is known in his region for his good service. He is always trying to develop his business. Ali is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary electronics spare parts to facilitate his work and satisfy his customers' needs. 

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy necessary electronics spare parts

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1979. She is living in a rural area. She is married. She has four children. Her husband is a builder. He works in foreign country. Nilufar is an attentive, kind, communicative, and friendly person.

For about five years, her husband sends money via money order. Besides that, they have additional income. Nilufar wants to make them a better standard of living. She decided to renovate her house. She is asking for financial support to renovate her house.

loans.use: to renovate and build her house.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en: Erastus is married and the father of one child. He describes himself as honest, and operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been in this business for five years, and works out of a very good location. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital, and has requested a Kes 40,000 loan to buy carpentry supplies. This is his sixth loan request from SMEP Microfinance Bank, and he successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy carpentry supplies.

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MERCEDES” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jimena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ganado, venta de mantas, venta de  comida, venta de ropa. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jimena es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al apoyar a su hermana en su negocio, posteriormente decide implementar el mismo de forma independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The non profit group Mercedes will start their tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Cascada. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive board of whom Jimena is the president. The businesses that the community association's members run are varied and include selling cattle, shawls, food and clothing.

This loan will benefit the small micro businesses that Jimena is a part of. She tells us that three years ago she joined Pro Mujer by invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At the moment Jimena runs a business selling shawls. She revealed that she started this business many years ago to help her sister with her business, after which she decided to start up her own business independently.

The loan Jimena is currently applying for is to increase her capital (by buying wool in bulk) which she will buy from the bulk vendors in the city of El Alto and then sell in her own point of sale. This line of work allows her to generate an income to help her family financially as she is married with one son.

When asked what she liked best about Pro Mujer, Jimena replied that she liked the training sessions that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan tiene 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento a su cultivo de arroz, con esto Hernan espera mejorar la calidad de su producto y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor arroz lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernan is 55 years old and lives with his spouse and their son in a rustic home that they own.  They live in the Pomahuaca district, which is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.  The locals work primarily in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Herman works in agriculture, specifically growing rice.  He has 30 years of experience in the field and he has many great personal and professional references in the area.  The loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer to properly care for his rice crops.  With this, Hernan hopes to improve the quality of his product and provide his customers with a better rice, which will increase his earnings and allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase manure and fertilizers to properly care for his rice crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient finances. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

Her business goal is to be a designer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a role model designer. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to enable her to open a new tailoring shop outlet.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa alquilada con su hija de 16 años de edad en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Péru. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de lavandería de ropa y limpieza de casa, estas actividades las realiza en el distrito de Pucará. Adicionalmente vende alimentos preparados como ceviche y papa rellena. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de materiales para implementar su negocio como baldes, tinas, detergentes, entre otros, con esto Maria Esther espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is a 49 year old single mother.  She lives with her 16 year old daughter in a rented home in the Pucará district, which is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.  Live in this district is very relaxed, and its people work primarily in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

She works providing housekeeping and laundry services in the Pucará district.  She also sells prepared meals such as ceviche and stuffed potatoes.  She has five years of experience in this business and she has great personal and professional references in the area.  The loan will be used to purchase supplies for her business such as buckets, tubs, detergents, etc.  With this, Maria Esther hopes to provide better service to her customers so that she can increase her earnings and in so doing, improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her business such as buckets, tubs, detergents, etc...

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
Jose Marcial tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, las actividades principales que se desarrollan son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 8 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con esto Jose Marcial espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Marcial is 33 years old, single and lives with his wife and their son in the district go Pucará, which is located in the Jaén province in the Catamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  Life in this region is relaxed, an the primary economic activities are agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Jose works growing coffee, which he has done for the past eight years.  He has a lot of experience in the business and he has great personal and professional references in the area.  This loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer to care for his crops.  With this, Jose Marcial hopes to produce a higher quality coffee for his customers, which will in turn have a positive impact on his earnings and allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase manure and fertilizer to care for his crops.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Carolyne, 29 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kaplamai, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Sataya

texts.en:
Sataya works hard to support her family. Sataya is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.
