She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc. Sataya has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Sataya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan 22 years old lives with her family in Mafraq. She is single.

Rawan wants to complete her education to find a job with responsibility, and to grow not just personally but professionally too, but her family faced financial problems so they could not pay her semester fees. Therefore she asked for an education loan to pay for her tuition and for the costs to get her degree.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Alerta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras (Shorly, Erna Alfred y Decilia) que se organizaron hace aproximadamente un año, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios de pulpería, incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Erna: Es integrante del grupo solidario Alerta, es  una mujer afable, tiene 68 años de edad, casada con un hijo mayor de edad. Desde hace 10 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo de madera, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: chiverías, granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, huevos, pan entre otros productos. Ella sueña con diversificar su negocio.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three enterprising women (Shorly, Erna Alfred and Decilia) who came together about a year ago with the idea of accessing a loan to improve their small grocery stores by increasing their merchandise and their income. This allows them to cover the basic household needs, afford their children an education and enlarge their businesses.

Erna is a member of the solidarity group Alerta. She is an affable woman of 68 years of age who is married with one adult child. 10 years ago she set up a small grocery store in her wooden house so she could generate her own income and contribute to the household costs. Erna is applying for a loan to buy yoghurt, staple grains, instant soup, eggs, bread and other products. Her dream is to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy yoghurt, staple grains, instant soup, eggs, bread and other products

loans.name: Isla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre luchador (Prudencia, Erika Roxana y José Roberto), de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres y hombres emprendedores que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de fresco, ropa; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace seis meses para gestionar préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Prudencia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer cordial, originaria de Waspam Rio Coco, llegó a vivir a Bilwi en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco en los años 80. Tiene 60 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, mejorar su calidad de vida y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 20 años estableció su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, en un tramo en el mercado municipal. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua: ropa interior, vestidos de niñas, camisas de hombres y mujeres, pantalones, short, faldas y en Masaya comprar calzado para venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela de la ciudad de Bilwi. Su sueño es diversificar su negocio con la venta de zapatos deportivos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of 3 tenacious members, including two women and a man (Prudence, Erika Roxana and José Roberto).  They are of the Miskito  ethnicity, and they are from the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality.  These are enterprising men and women who strive each day to make their small businesses grow.  They work selling beverages and clothing.  This group got together 6 months ago to arrange a group-guaranteed loan with Pana Pana.

Prudencia is the coordinator of the communal bank.  She is a friendly woman who is a native of Waspam Rio Coco.  She came to live in Bilwi during a period during the 1980s when the entire population of Rio Coco was evacuated.  She is 60 years old, and is the mother of 4 grown children who are independent.  With the goal of providing for her children, improving her quality of life, and having her own source of income, she launched her clothing and shoe sales business 20 years ago in a stall in the municipal market.  She is requesting a loan to buy the following items in Managua: underwear, children's clothing, shirts for men and women, pants, shorts, and skirts.  In Masaya, she will also purchase shoes to sell at affordable prices to her customers in the city of Bilwi.  Prudencia's dream is to diversify her business by adding the sale of sports shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Lillieth

texts.en: Lillieth is a hard-working single mother who has raised 6 children. She currently works long hours as a Hospice nursing assistant and takes pride in providing comfort to her patients.  Lillieth has not had air conditioning in her home since September of 2014, and hasn’t been able obtain financing through a bank due to her credit being damaged when she couldn’t afford to pay off a number of medical bills associated with a serious health condition that she endures. Lillieth would greatly benefit from a new high efficiency air conditioner and insulation that will help her save on energy bills and improve the conditions in her home to provide more comfort, especially given her health condition. Having a new air conditioner will also improve the safety of her home as she has been leaving her windows open at night to make sleeping in her own home bearable. Lillieth will use her KIVA loan to have a high efficiency air conditioner and insulation installed in her home.

loans.use: to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner and insulation for her home.

loans.name: Jesus Reyes

texts.es:
Jesus Reyes tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en casa de material rústico en el distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades que se realizan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Jesus Reyes espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus Reyes is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents in a home made of rustic materials in the district of Querocotillo. This district is located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru. The types of work that are carried out in this district include farming, cattle raising and commerce.

Jesus Reyes works in farming, specifically in coffee growing. He has been working in this area for the last 10 years and has both experience in this business and very good personal and employment references in the neighbourhood.

This loan will be used to purchase compost and fertiliser to satisfactorily maintain his coffee crops. With this loan Jesus Reyes hopes to offer his customers better quality coffee with which he will generate a higher income with the aim of improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertiliser to satisfactorily maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Tutsa 2 Group

texts.es:
PATRICIA. 
Es su segundo crédito con VisionFund en el cual recibirá la cantidad de $ 800 dolares. Con los mismos que tiene previsto ampliar su negocio de venta de combustibles en comunidades alejadas, colocando 2 sucursales para la venta de gasolina y gas licuado de petróleo para uso domestico.
Ella tiene 39 años y desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a esta labor , pudiendo darse cuenta de las necesidades que tiene la gente del sector.
Su esposo se dedica al trasporte de pasajeros en la via fluvial negocios con los que poco a poco apoyan a los gastos del hogar, salud, alimentación y educación de sus 4 hijos; su hija mayor estudia química en la universidad.
En 5 años espera tener un negocio más estable, con los respectivos permisos legales para la comercialización de estos productos. 
Se siente muy contenta de trabajar con VisionFund y agradece mucho el apoyo que se le brinda para poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
This is Patricia's second loan with VisionFund in which she will receive an amount of $800 dollars. With the same plans to expand her business of selling fuel in remote communities, she is placing two branches for the sale of gasoline and liquified petroleum gas for domestic use.

Patricia is 39 years old and for a long time has made her living with this work. She is able to pick up on the needs of people in the area and her husband works in passenger transportation on the river. With these businesses they support the household expenses, health, and food and education for their four children little by little. Their oldest daughter studies chemistry in university.

In 5 years she hopes to have a more stable business, with the respective legal permits to sell her products. She feels very happy to work with VisionFund and is very thankful for the support it gives her to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase and sell liquified petroleum gas for domestic use and gasoline

loans.name: Siprosa

texts.en: Siprosa is a widowed woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes. She hopes that in the future she will have increased profits. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the semester fees for her son

loans.name: Ingrid De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Ingrid es una joven conocida por su habilidad en los números y su ojo crítico, razón suficiente para decidir estudiar Contaduría pública y auditoria. Con tan solo 21 años de edad, está a punto de graduarse de la carrera que tanto la apasiona, pues ya está en su último año. Ella viene de padres luchadores, su mamá es enfermera y su papá es conductor, que con mucho esfuerzo la han apoyado en sus cuatro años en la universidad-
Ahora ya casi finalizando está etapa importante en su vida, Ingrid desea irse independizando de poco a poco, por lo que decidió solicitar un préstamo para para pagar su título y su seminario para culminar sus estudios. En sus planes está buscar un empleo donde pueda emplear todos sus conocimientos obtenidos durante sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a young woman who is known for her numerical ability and her critical eye, which was reason enough for her to decide to study public accounting and auditing. At just 21 years of age she is on the cusp of graduating from the course that she is so passionate about as this is her final year. Ingrid comes from tenacious parents: her mother is a nurse and her father is a driver and together with a lot of effort they have supported Ingrid throughout her four years of university. 

Now that she is almost finished this important stage of her life, Ingrid would like to become independent little by little, which is why she decided to take out a loan to pay for her qualification and a seminar to complete her studies. Her plan is to look for a job where she can employ the knowledge she has gained throughout her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her qualification and a seminar to complete her studies

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 24-year old married woman with one child. Because of her marriage, she postponed her university study for two years. 

Now that her child is two years old, she can complete her education. However, her husband cannot cover her education fees. Because she wants to achieve her dreams, Alaa has applied for an education loan to cover university fees. She dreams of becoming a productive woman and finding a good job to help her husband manage household expenses.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil lives with his wife and his son and bride. They live in the Füzuli region. His daughter is married and does not live with them. His son is a taxi driver at the same village. For 22 years already, they have been IDP ( Internally Displcated Persons) from Füzuli city. 

Adil has engaged in sheep breeding at their homestead yard  for many years. Adil and his wife prepare  dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt, etc.). Then he sells these products in the local bazaar and earns money. 

Also he periodically sells wool from the sheep. Today Adil needs 1300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). For this reason, he applied to Kiva's partner Komak for a loan. He is planning to buy enough hay for the sheep, vaccinations for them, etc.

He thanks Kiva and Komak for their help. In the future Adil wants to help his son to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy enough hay and vaccinations for his sheep

loans.name: 25 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de cereales secos, venta de pollo, venta de productos naturales, servicio de construcción. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años con un crédito básico, actualmente amplio su mercadería con el crédito que sacó en Pro Mujer. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará a pedido de la cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se identifica que esta ausente el cliente esta ausente, el mismo se retiro con premura a su domicilio.
texts.en: The Community Association 25 de Octubre will begin its eight cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center from Cascada. It has eight members and it is managed by a board of directors whose president is Mrs. Celia. The businesses handled by the members are diverse, among them: traditional skirt sales, blanket sales, food sale, dry cereals sales, poultry sales, natural products sales, construction services. This loan will benefit a group of small micro businesswomen of which Mrs. Celia is a member. She stated that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for the past two years, joining after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she sells blankets. She also mentioned that this business was started several years ago with a basic loan, having increased her inventory recently with a loan obtained from Pro Mujer. The loan she is asking for now is for an increase in capital (to purchase wool wholesale.) She will buy the wool from the wholesale women suppliers from the city of El Alto,  and after making them she will sell them based on custom orders. This type of work allows her to generate resources to help her family financially. She is married with four children. When asked what does she like about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the workshops offered by the institution. It was noted that she is missing in the picture, she had to go home quickly.

loans.use: To purchase wool wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover her semester fees and complete her education normally without delay

loans.name: Lisseth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Los ojos de Lisseth de denotan la felicidad que tiene de estar estudiando la carrera universitaria de sus sueños, Contaduría pública y auditoria. Desde adolescente ella siempre se dio la tardea por investigar sobre esta licenciatura, enamorándose cada vez más y haciendo de su experiencia en la universidad más sencilla. Ella ahora tiene 23 años y está casi culminando sus estudios en su cuarto año. 
Lisseth siempre ha contado con el apoyo económico y moral de su papá, quien trabaja como chequeador en una empresa privada. Ella está a punto en convertirse en una licenciada, por lo que no dejará que ningún obstáculo trunque sus sueños, de manera que solicita un préstamo para pagar el título y su curso de culminación de estudios. Cumpliendo con estos objetivos podrá finalizar su carrera y tener un documento que le facilite conseguir un trabajo acorde a sus estudios.
texts.en:
The eyes of Lisseth show the happiness that she feels in studying the major of her dreams at the university: public accounting and auditing. Since adolescence she has taken on the task of learning more about this field, enjoying it more each year and making her experience at the university easier. She now is 23 years old and is close to finishing her studies in her fourth year.

Lisseth has always counted on the economic and moral support of her father, who works as an inspector for a private company. She is almost ready to graduate and will not allow any obstacle to cut short her dreams and so she is requesting a loan to pay for her last course and her degree. Fulfilling these objectives, she will be able to complete her program of studies and have the document that will help her obtain a position in keeping with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees and her final course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees and graduate so perhaps she will find good work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family land

loans.name: Tinyade Group

texts.en:
Sofia is 35 years old and married with five children. Three of her children dropped out of school since she could not afford to pay for their school fees or provide them with school requirements. 

Sofia grows and sells maize to people surrounding her community. Although she runs this business, she does not get enough capital. Thus, she is requesting another loan in order to buy another piece of land and maize seeds so that she may increase her yield.

She plans to send her children back to school and hopes to build a better house for her children. Despite the challenges that she meets, Sofia is now able to provide some of her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds

loans.name: Chanity

texts.en:
Chanity is 29 years old and lives in Mundri, South  Sudan region of Sudan. 

She is married and the mother of two children.  A loan of 800 SSP helps her to expand the work of agriculture.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a poly tank and store water for his water vending business.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El señor marcos es un hombre dedicado a impartir clases de educación primaria del cual tiene 29 años de laborar en un colegio de la comunidad donde vive, es casado, con 3 personas a su cargo, este señor tiene la urgencia de mejorar su vivienda, tomando la decisión de visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar  financiamiento el que utilizara en la Compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y mano de obra, con los que realizara las mejora en la cocina y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Señor Marcos is a man who works teaching classes in primary education, in which he has 29 years of experience in working in a school in the community where he lives. He is married and is responsible for three people. This man has an urgent need to improve his home and decided to visit the offices of CEPRODEL to apply for financing that he will use in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks and iron and to pay for labor, with which he will make the improvements in the kitchen and in this way have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron and pay for labor

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 32-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin City. She lives with her husband and five kids in a simple house. Her husband works as a worker with a low and unstable income. Nadia has agricultural land where she plants fruits and vegetables. The whole family co-operate together in the work.

Nadia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family land. By taking this loan, Nadia will improve the land and increase the productivity.

Nadia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family land.

loans.name: Jesús Gilberto

texts.es:
Jesús es un joven proveniente de la calurosa ciudad de Piura, ubicada al norte del Perú. Junto a su familia emigraron a la ciudad de Lima, en busca de un futuro prometedor a base de esfuerzo y dedicación. Su padre es agricultor por lo que tiene trabajo de manera eventual, su madre es ama de casa, se dedica a la crianza de su hermano.
Jesús empezó a laborar desde muy pequeño (10 años) ayudando a su padre con la agricultura, quien le pagaba solo propinas. Él actualmente se encuentra estudiando el 3° Ciclo de Diseño Gráfico en SENATI. Carrera que le gusta mucho y siente que lo respaldaría económicamente para así apoyar a toda su familia.
Debido a la situación actual por la que atraviesan sus padres, él recurre a KIVA para solicitar el apoyo que necesita y así poder culminar su carrera de manera exitosa. De no haber tenido acceso para el presente crédito, lamentablemente tendría que dejar de estudiar para trabajar hasta reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita culminar sus estudios.
Jesús se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado de KIVA, ya que le permitirán cumplir con  sus objetivos profesionales y personales, pudiendo así ayudar a su familia siendo un excelente profesional.
texts.en: Jesús is a young man originally  from the warm city of Piura, located in northern Peru. Along with his family, they emigrated to the city of Lima, searching for a promising future based on effort and dedication. His father is a farmer, and he works as a temporary laborer. His mother is a homemaker dedicated to raising his brother.  Jesus began working at a young age (10 years old) helping his father in the farm, where he only earned tips. He is currently studying in the third cycle of Graphic Design at SENATI. He likes this field very much and he feels that this career will be a great economic resource to be able to help his family. Due to his parents current economic situation, he is coming to KIVA to ask for support and be able to finish his career successfully. Had he not been able to have access to this loan, he would unfortunately have had to withdraw to work until he had enough money saved to finish his studies. Jesus is very grateful for the support received from KIVA, because this will allow him to meet his personal and professional goals, thus being able to help his family by becoming an excellent professional.

loans.use: To continue his studies in Graphic Design at SENATI, and be able to have his own profitable business.

loans.name: Maria Eufronia

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hija mujer de 1 año de edad, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ una comunidad campesina que se caracteriza por ser un valle semi-tropical, dónde la venta de comida es abundante, variada y todo se acompaña con chicha (bebida fermentada de maíz), de clima cálido semi tropical.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza con su hija que es una bebé, viven en una casa propia sin terminar de construir, hecha de ladrillo y no cuenta con agua ni electricidad. Su casa está compuesta por 2 cuartos, no tiene vidrios en las ventanas, suele hacerse regalar agua de sus vecinos. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para proporcionar un futuro mejor a su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que lleva construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para proporcionar una vivienda segura a su hija.
texts.en:
Maria is a 32 year-old woman who is single and has a one year-old daughter.  She has a business selling food.  She is a good mother, and is enterprising, independent, responsible, and hardworking.  She does her business in the town of Sacaba.  This is a rural community that is known for being in a semi-tropical valley, where the sale of food is plentiful and varied, and everything is consumed with chicha (a drink made from fermented corn).  This area has a hot, semi-tropical climate.

Maria has a dark complexion, long braided black hair, dark eyes, and a short stature.  Her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in her area, and she also speaks Spanish to the general public.  She lives with her daughter, who is a baby, in her own home that is not completely built.  The home is made of brick, but has neither water nor electricity.  Her house has 2 rooms, but there is no glass in the windows, and she is usually given water by her neighbors.  

Maria's dream is to finish construction on her house.  She wants to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry to provide her family with a better future. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that she has been building her house.  

This is why Maria is requesting a loan to install potable water in her kitchen, bath, and laundry, so that she can provide her daughter with a safe home.

loans.use: to install potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Víctor Fidel

texts.es:
Víctor, es un joven estudiante que vive junto a sus padres y sus 6 hermanos (4 hombres y 3 mujeres). Su padre es agricultor y su madre no labora, quienes apoyan en el ingreso económico familiar son su padre y hermanos con sus trabajos eventuales.
Actualmente se encuentra cursando el 6° ciclo de la Carrera Mecánica de Producción, la cual le interesa muchísimo porque se encuentra en constante crecimiento, generando puestos de trabajo y así lo beneficiará económicamente. 
Él estuvo laborando desde los 17 años, para poder ayudar a sus padres y hermanos, pero debido a la actual situación económica por la que está atravesando su familia, Víctor busca el apoyo de KIVA para terminar exitosamente sus estudios, de no ser así, tendría que dejar de estudiar y trabajar hasta reunir el dinero necesario para culminar sus estudios.
Víctor se siente agradecido con KIVA por el apoyo brindado ya que le permitirá cumplir sus metas propuestas sin que se vean truncados por factores económicos, forjando así un futuro mejor para todas aquellas personas que creen que con la educación se logran muchísimas cosas.
texts.en:
Victor is a young student who lives with his parents and his six siblings ([there are] four brothers and three sisters). His father is a farmer, and his mother doesn't work. Those who support the family economic income are his father and siblings with their casual work.

He is now studying in the sixth semester of the program in production mechanics, which interests him very much because it is constantly growing and generating work positions, and thus it will benefit him economically.

He was working from the age of 17 to be able to help his parents and siblings, but due to the present economic situation that his family is going through, Victor is looking for support from Kiva in order to successfully complete his studies. Otherwise, he will have to leave school and work until he saves the necessary money to finish his studies.

Victor feels grateful to Kiva for the support offered, since it will allow him to complete his proposed goals without their being curtailed by economic factors, thus forging a better future for all those people who believe that with education many things are achieved.

loans.use: to pay for his final courses in production mechanics at SENATI and thus create his own business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad lives in Ajloun. He is studying nursing and would like to complete his degree and find a good job where he can apply all the knowledge he has learned in university. Now he is working, alongside his study, as a home nurse to help him cover his daily expenses.

Mohammad is very hard working and is doing all he can to become a successful professional man and be useful to society. His father faced financial problems so he could not help Mohammad in his tuition fees, therefore he applied for an education loan to pay the fees for his degree and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his degree and continue studying.

loans.name: Judith Jazmina

texts.es: La señora Judith  se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria con 3 años de laborar, es  casada con 2 hijos a su cargo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar la vivienda, por lo que tomo la decisión de visitar las oficinas de ceprodel, para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la  Compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y mano de obra, con los que realizara la construcción de cuarto y mejorara las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Señora Judith works as a primary teacher with three years of experience. She is married and has two children in her care. She now needs to improve her home, for which she decided to visit the offices of CEPRODEL to apply for financing that she will use in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks, and iron and to pay for labor, with which she will complete the construction of a room and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron and pay for labor

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in photo) is a 37-year-old widow who lives in the Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province. Sophea has one son. He has studied.
 
She has prepared hotel rooms for one year. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike to ride to her work. Presently, she goes to work by motor-taxi. She hopes that it will make her journey easier.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to ride to her work.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 46-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She appears in the photo. She lives with her husband and six children in a simple house. Her husband works as a construction worker with a low and unstable income. 

Mayson has an agricultural land which she plants with seasonal crops. The whole family cooperates together in the work.
Mayson took a USD loan form FATEN. This loan will help her to prepare the soil for the new season by plowing it and buying fertilizers. 

By taking this loan, Mayson will improve the land and increase the productivity.

loans.use: to prepare the soil for the new season by plowing it and buying fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 62 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra la fotografía para comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, Juan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 62 years old and has been working for several years in agriculture: he grows corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the sacks shown in the photo to sell in different markets near his home. He lives with his two children in his own home.
Juan is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, fungicides, and so on, and to be able to continue his work and have a greater income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, fungicides, etc.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 52-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin City. She lives with her husband and four children, two sons and two daughters, in a simple house. Her husband works as a construction worker with a low and unstable income. Nawal has agricultural land where she plants fruits and vegetables. The whole family co-operate together in the work.

Nawal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family land. By taking this loan, Nawal will improve the land and increase the productivity.

Nawal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family land.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 62 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo varón de 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Central’ un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima semitropical durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 14-24 grados centígrados.
Martha es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello gris corto, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su hijo que trabaja y estudia, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; pantalones, cinturones, poleras manga corta, bermudas, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día en un puesto de venta en la calle al aire libre. “mi trabajo comienza con la clasificación de la ropa, zapatos, complementos bolsos, cinturones, juguetes, etc., para ofrecer a mis clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Martha is a 62 year old divorced woman. She has an 18 year old son and her business is the sale of used clothing.She is a good mother, enterprising, optimistic, happy, responsible, hard working and has a good attitude. She carries out her business in the Central zone of the city, an area characterized by businesses of all kinds and which is home to universities, public offices and private businesses that exist side by side. [Cochabamba] has a semitropical climate all year, with temperatures that vary during the day from 14 to 24 degrees Centigrade.

Martha is short in stature, with tanned skin, short gray hair, and dark eyes. Her first language is Quechua and she speaks Spanish for general purposes and to carry out her business. She shares her life with her son who works and studies. They live in a rented house constructed of brick, with running water, electricity and sewer service.

Her business is the sale of used clothing, including items such as pants, belts, short sleeve shirts, shorts and others. She works every day of the week in a open air stand in the street. “My work begins with sorting the clothing, shoes, accessories, purses, belts, toys, etc., to offer to my clients,” she says. Her dream is to have a large business in order to improve the quality of life of her son. She plans to buy second hand clothing wholesale, in order to supply her clients during particular seasons. This is her third loan with the same institution in 18 years of work in the same activity.

For these reasons, Martha is requesting a loan to purchase used clothing at wholesale prices in order to supply her seasonal clients.

loans.use: purchase used clothing wholesale in order to supply her seasonal clients

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre casado de 38 años de edad tiene una bonita familia de 6 hijos, ellos viven en una comunidad de San Antonio Suchitepéquez. 
Francisco es un hombre que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, genera su economía, con el fin de darle lo necesario para su familia, él vive en un lugar caluroso donde se producen materia prima  tales como el hule, pues el trabajo de Francisco es picador de hule, él  extrae ese producto él trabaja en las fincas de su comunidad y fincas aledañas, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre ya que desde pequeño se familiarizo con esta actividad.

Francisco además de esta actividad, también se dedica al cultivo de maíz y con este complementa su ingreso, para sacar adelante a sus hijos, en esta segunda actividad cuando es  época de cosecha toda la familia se involucra a trabajar para no pagar jornales a otras personas. De esa manera Francisco ha podido sobrevivir. Francisco como todo papá busca la manera de cómo darles un mejor bienestar para sus hijos, Lo que él necesita ahora, es comprar materiales para hacer  algunos compartimientos de su casa y otros cuartos, porque sus hijos ya necesitan de privacidad y para tener un lugar ideal donde realizar sus tareas de la escuela, pues Francisco no tiene posibilidades para juntar el dinero, pues la solución que encontró es buscar un prestamo de mil quinientos quetzales para lograr esta aspiración.

El sueño de Francisco es ver su casa con  otra perspectiva y nuevos cuartos para que su familia viva en armonía y con sus ingresos pagara el prestamo poco a poco.
texts.en: Francisco is a married man aged 38 years old. He has a beautiful family comprised of 6 children, and they live in a community of San Antonio Suchitepequez. Francisco is a man who, with lots of effort and dedication, generates income to be able to give what is needed to his family. He lives in a warm location where they extract raw materials such as rubber. Francisco works as a rubber chopper, he extracts this product working in the farms around his community and adjacent farms. He learned this trade from his father at an early age, and familiarized himself with this activity. Besides this job, Francisco also grows corn, which helps complement his income and support his kids. In this second activity, when it is time to harvest the corn, all the family works together to avoid having to pay wages to other people. This way Francisco has been able to survive. Like every father, Francisco tries to find ways to provide for his children. What is needed now is to buy materials to build several room dividers in their house, because his children need privacy to have and ideal place to do homework. Francisco didn't have any way of saving this money, then the only solution he found was to look for a loan of 1,500 quetzals to be able to achieve this goal. Francisco's dream is to see his house with another perspective and new rooms, so that his family lives in harmony and he is able to pay off the loan little by little with his earnings.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Nitza Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Ser mujer implica ser multifacética, en un tiempo se es madre, en otro se es esposa, amiga, compañera y apoyo para poder fortalecer a la familia, así lo expresa  Nitza, una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y luchadora que apoya al sustento de su hogar con su pulpería.
Nitzel comenzó a  ofrecer joyería de plata en su casa y con el tiempo logró hacerse dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Las ganancias han servido para mejorar su hogar y poco a poco agrandarlo. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar granos basicos y productos de aseo del hogar y asi continuar ampliando y ofreciendo más productos; puesto que, planea vender ropa femenina y así seguir apoyando a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
To be a woman implies being multifaceted. At one time, she is a mother; at another time, she is a wife, a friend, and a support to be able to strengthen the family. This describes Nitza, a hard-working, entrepreneurial, and striving woman who supports the sustenance of her household with her grocery store.

Nitza began to offer silver jewelry in her home, and with time she managed to become the owner of a little grocery store. The earnings have served to improve her home and little by little to enlarge it. She is applying for the loan to buy basic grains and household cleaning products and thus continue expanding and offering more products, since she plans to sell women's clothing and thus continue supporting the economy of her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and household cleaning products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 5 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient finances. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be a regional supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards for her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Nahiba

texts.en:
Nahiba is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She works hard to support her family and improve their economy. Her husband is a master but his salary is not enough to cover the family's needs. Nahiba didn't attend school because her parents had limited financial resources. 

She keeps sheep. She raises them, fattens and then sells them or uses their wool in order to knit warm jackets, gloves, and blankets; she sells these too. Her mother-in-law helps her in this.

Nahiba has been a farmer for 13 years and has good skills. But her monthly income is only 170 AZN and this money doesn't cover big parts of the family's needs. Her livestock was weak last year and it's productivity has fallen. Now she has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy three new sheep and recover the productivity of her livestock.

loans.use: to buy three new sheep and recover the productivity of her livestock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es: Mariano de 56 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura cultiva maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego venderlos en los pueblos aledaños, vive con su esposa en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc.  y así seguir con sus siembras y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Mariano, who is 56 years old, has worked in agriculture for 10 years. He raises corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the graneries  that are shown in the photograph to later sell it in the surrounding towns. He lives with his wife in his own house. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc., and to thus continue with his plantings and have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Porfirio Andres

texts.es: Porfirio de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Porfirio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Porfirio, who is 54 years old, lives in his own house with his family group. He has raised corn and sorghum for a number of years. When his harvest is ready, he sells it in the surroundings of the zone where he lives. By now he has many regular customers. 

Porfirio is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc., so that, as the photograph shows, he will be able to continue with his plantings, since this is his only source of work, and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 46-year-old married father of three children and a man with special needs. He has worked in his cafe shop for four years to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Hasan is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. Today he is acquiring a loan from the Damej program from Al Majmoua which is specifically for people with special needs, to start a new business of selling scout clothes as a second source of income. This loan will increase Hasan's income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start a new business selling scout clothes.

loans.name: Rodema

texts.en:
Rodema is 38 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joey, a tricycle driver, and has three kids who are still at the elementary level in school. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their children's schooling. 

Rodema operates a tricycle and has a small general store. Her  husband drives the tricycle, which carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Cavite, the tricycle is a common means of transportation.   Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. They even use this transport from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan which she will use for maintenance and gas of her tricycle. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial aid that will be extended to her, for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and their children's education.  

Rodema dreams of being successful in her business so she can give her children the best education in order for them to have a better future. She prays for the safety of her husband and their passengers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: La señora Candida es una mujer preocupada por la salud de los demás, de profesión auxiliar de enfermería, labora en un centro de salud de la comunidad donde vive, con 27 años de laborar, es casada con 3 personas a su cargo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar el techo de su vivienda el que está en mal estado, por lo que visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizara en la Compra de zinc, perlin y mano de obra, con los que realizaría la obra y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Señora Candida is a woman who worries about the health of others. By profession, she is a nursing assistant. She works in a health center of the community where she lives. She has 27 years of work experience. She is married and is responsible for three people. She now needs to improve the roof of her home, which is in bad condition. For this reason, she visited CEPRODEL to apply for financing which she will use in the purchase of zinc sheets and purlins and to pay for labor, with which she will complete the work and in this way improve [her family's] living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and purlins and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 22 years old and lives in Nablus with his family. His main job is gypsum works; he makes them at his workshop and sells them to the clients. He started this more than two years ago. Mohammad is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this youth loan to buy gypsum shapes for his workshop, which will allow him to expand his work upon the customers' request. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy gypsum shapes for his workshop, which will allow him to expand his work upon the customers' request.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a dairy farm. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are large scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 58 years old, and from the Chiatura district in Georgia.  He has a 6-member family, and they don't have any significant income.  His family is considered part of the subsistence poor, living in poverty, and receiving social assistance from the local government.  Apart from this, they operate a small agricultural business.  In particular, they own a milk cow and sell cheese products at the local market, but the income is not enough to cover everyday costs, so Zurab decided to start an additional business.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to obtain a loan of 1,300 GEL.  With the received credit he will purchase sheep and will start trading lambs.  This will give him additional income and will enable him to improve the living conditions of his family. 

Zurab awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep in order to trade lambs.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en: Clarice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a highly-populated area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to prosper within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 31-year-old married mother of two children who has worked as a tutor for three years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Fatima is an ambitious lady and sacrificing mother who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Fatima hopes to stay capable of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal, who is a 20-year-old young man, has a great desire to make financial stability for his family and generate his own income. Vusal lives in a small village named Lambalo with his parents and sister. Nowadays, the family earns a living from small agricultural activity and generates approximately 300 GEL monthly. It is hardly enough for food for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Vusal requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Vusal plans to open a bakery in his house. He will purchase necessary equipment (stove and dishes) and will start baking traditional Georgian bread which will be sold in the village. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To open a traditional Georgian bakery and make his own business

loans.name: Matra Group

texts.en:
Matra is the same group which received the first loan from Kiva lenders. It consists of four women who are Elham, Zamzm, Naja, and Matra. They have completely repaid the first loan and applied for a new loan of 150,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Matra is the same leader of the first group who applied for a first loan to purchase incense, perfumes, and women's clothes to resell. She thanks Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan which helped her very much in enlarging her business. She finished the repayment of all the installments of the first loan and applied for a new loan of 50,000 YER from Kiva's lenders to enlarge her business through purchasing different types of incense, perfume and women's clothes. Matra hopes this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: To enlarge her business through purchasing different types of incense, perfume and women's clothes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she makes liquid soap to sell. Her business is located in a strategic location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her do farming. This is her second  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs to enable her to farm

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a strategic location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase women's clothes and incense to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheets, beams, tiles, cement, sand, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Manaen

texts.es: Manaen vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Manaen está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manaen lives in his own house with his wife and his three children. For many years, he has made a living in agriculture growing corn. When his harvest is ready, he sells it in the different markets that are near his house. Now he has many regular customers.

Manaen is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, herbicides, etc. and improve the plot shown in the photograph to be able to continue with his farming, now that it is his only source of work and in that way have a better income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, herbicides, etc. and improve the plot

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows tea. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more farm inputs.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows maize, tea  and other crops. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman. She has two children aged 9 years and 14 years. She describes herself to be jovial and ambitious. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area with lots of customers, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand her business. 

She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy furniture for the restaurant and increase sitting space. Her business goal is to open another restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future she will provide the best education for her children. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy furniture for the restaurant and increase sitting space

loans.name: Acqaline

texts.en:
Acqaline is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious and she operates a poultry farm where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. 

Her business is located in an area with high potential and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of chicken feed. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy 500 chickens. Her business goal is to have 2,000 chickens within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy 500 chickens.

loans.name: Latavra

texts.en:
Latavra is a 24-year-old married woman from Khashuri district. She lives with her husband and five-year old son. Latavra and her husband are unemployed at the moment. They have a minibus and decided to start a trading business to generate income, but they need money to purchase stock of vegetables to resell. 

The Start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL to purchase potatoes. Her husband will drive the minibus and they both will begin the trading business. This will give them a chance to generate income and cover everyday expenses of their family.

loans.use: to begin to trade potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a fertile location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Najeb

texts.en:
Najeb is an optimistic and very responsible person. He lives in Sana'a city, Yemen. He is a 34-year-old married man and a father of two children. 

Najeb always thinks about making a good future for his family, so three years ago he started his own business selling women's and men's shoes in a small store. The income from his business is very low because he doesn't have enough capital to purchase more goods in order to be able to attract a lot of customers, and most of the money he receives goes to cover some of the necessary expenses of his children. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 YER from Kiva's partner, AMB, in order to purchase a variety of types of new and stylish shoes to expand his business. Najeb hopes to open another branch beside the first.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of types of new and stylish shoes to attract more customers.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is 40 years. He lives in the Fuzuli region near the war zone with his family. His family are IDP(Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city for over 22 years. 

Ilham is married and has two children. One of the children is a 15-year-old boy who is in eighth grade, and the other child is 13 years old in sixth grade. His wife is a housewife and she helps Ilham in his work. 

Ilham is in the animal breeding business and loves his job. This is Ilham's second loan. The first loan he closed in time. He sells milk and milky products (yogurt, cheese and etc) which are made by Ilham and his wife. Now he wants to repair cow stalls. Therefore he needs a loan of 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

He is thankful to the KIVA organization and lenders for this loan. In the future he wants to help his children with their education.

loans.use: to repair cow stalls and increase his business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Elena es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
For the past 20 years, Elena has made her living by preparing and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home, and she has many customers.

Elena is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two children.

She is requesting this loan to purchase corn by the quintal [100 lb] and lime to be able to continue making tortillas and have a better income, so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal, and lime

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Doña Santos de 46 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, es viuda y vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 32 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, Doña Santos  solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
46-year-old Santos is a very hard-working and responsible person, who dedicates her whole self to her business. She is widowed and lives with her family in their home.

She has had a business selling fruits and vegetables for the past 32 years, located in the city market near her place of residence.

Santos is requesting a loan so she can buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale, in order to have better income and a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows coffee. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a married man. He has three children whose ages range from 1 year to 15 years. He describes himself to be good. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of feed. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy animal feed and another dairy cow. His business goal is to be able to process his own milk within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and another dairy cow

loans.name: Grupo Chuachinup Sector Centro Group

texts.es:
Pascuala es una mujer casada tiene 38 años, ella conforma una familia de 3 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos viven aparte y uno está bajo la responsabilidad de Pascuala, Ellos viven en una comunidad de Santo Tomás la Unión. 

Pascuala (la primera de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) es una mujer que ama a su familia y por eso ella lucha día tras día para generar su economía, ella desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, es una actividad que le encanta hacer ya que es vendible tanto en su comunidad como en otros lugares circunvecinos. 

Pascuala quiere mantener su negocio y de hecho incrementar un poco, por eso ella solicita un prestamo para comprar más mercadería y asi poder ofrecer diversidad de colores y estilos a su clientela. Pascuala con este negocio ha prosperado en la  vida, a través de este ejemplo con Pascuala se han integrado otras dos mujeres para que formen un grupo y sacar un prestamo grupal, Pascuala con mucha paciencia acepto esta propuesta, y de esa forma ella se siente útil a su comunidad. 
El sueño de estas mujeres es conseguir el prestamo, para que tengan más mercadería y también sueñan poder tener un local para la venta.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a 38-year-old married woman. She forms part of a family of three children, two of which live apart from her and one of which is under Pascuala's responsibility. They live in a community of Santo Tomás la Unión. 

Pascuala (the first from left to right in the photograph) is a woman who loves her family, and for that reason, she fights day after day to generate her income. For five years, she has made a living selling traditional clothing. It is work that she loves doing, now that it is sellable in her community as well as in other surrounding areas. 

Pascuala wants to maintain her business and in fact grow a bit. For that reason, she is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise and in that way be able to offer a variety of colors and styles to her clientele. Pascula, with this business, has prospered in life. Through this example, two other women have joined Pascuala to form a group and take out a group loan. Pascuala, with a lot of patience, accepted this offer, and in this way she feels useful to her community. 

The dream of these women is to get this loan, so that they can have more merchandise, and they also dream of having a store to sell it.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 42 года, замужем, есть 3 детей, старший сын -самостоятельный, живет отдельно, средний сын- студент, дочь- школьница. У Замиры среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова и 10 овец. Она арендует 5,0 Га земли, в собственности есть еще 1,0 Га, на земельной доле Замира выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 5 овец с целью их откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Zamira is 42 years old and she is married with three children.  Her eldest son lives on his own, her middle son is in college and her daughter is in school.  Zamira has a high school education and as the main source of income for her family, she has been raising livestock, which she started in 1995.  Thanks to her hard work, Zamira now has one cow and ten sheep on her farm.  She rents a .50-hectare plot of land and she has her own 1-hectare plot of land, on which she grows beans for resale.

Her monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of increasing her farm's output, Zamira has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and five sheep to fatten and resell.  She plans to use the income from the loan to further increase her head of livestock and she plans to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and five sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy juice, soda water, soft drinks, water, etc.

loans.name: Ena Maribel

texts.es: Ena tiene 34 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 4 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ena is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. For the past four years, Ena has had a small store located in her home. She has many clients because of her good prices, and because of the kindness she shows when making sales. She is requesting this loan to purchase more soaps, eggs, basic grains, softdrinks, sweets, sweet bread and more. This way she will be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items for her general store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
A su avanzada edad, Sonia siempre se mantiene activa, si no está  haciendo piñatas, está en la búsqueda de cosméticos y ropa femenina para ofrecer en su pequeño negocio. Sonia se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, amistosas y responsable. Además, es muy profesional en su negocio siempre está velando por la calidad de sus productos, pues, ya tiene once años ofreciéndolos y se enorgullece de la sólida reputación que ha alcanzado. 
El financiamiento solicitado, es para comprar mercadería: papeles, pegas, periódicos, maquillaje y demás cosas para surtir su negocio; así podrá ofrecer productos de la temporada de verano.  A la vez, diseñará más piñatas para cumplir con la mercadería por encargos.
texts.en:
At her advanced age, Sonia always stays active. If she is not making piñatas, she is in search of cosmetics and women's clothing to offer in her small store. Sonia is characterized as being entrepreneurial, friendly, and responsible. In addition, she is very professional; in her store she is always watching out for the quality of her products since she has been offering them for eleven years, and she takes pride in the solid reputation she has achieved. 

The requested financing is to buy merchandise: paper, glue, newspapers, makeup, and other things to stock her store; that way she will be able to offer products of the summer season. At the same time, she will design more piñatas to fulfill merchandise orders.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: paper, glue, newspapers, makeup, and more items to stock her store.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
La venta de ropa de segunda mano, cada día se convierte en una alternativa ante la necesidad de vestimenta y la pobreza de los nicaragüenses. Gloria consiente que este negocio es viable se animó a poner una pequeña tienda de esta, para apoyar a la economía de su hogar, Inició con sus propios recursos y poco a poco pudo adquirir mercadería y ganarse a su clientela. 
Gloria solicita el financiamiento para comprar más pacas de ropa y así atraer más clientes con la variedad que ofrece en su negocio.  Todo este esfuerzo es por el bienestar de sus dos hijos y el crecimiento personal que le genera al ser independiente. Espera, poner una sala de belleza a largo plazo, pues ella es estilista profesional.
texts.en:
The sale of second-hand clothing is becoming more of an option every day because of the need for clothing and the poverty of the Nicaraguans. Gloria agrees that this business is viable. She was motivated to set up her used clothing shop in order to support her household finances. She started with her own resources, and little by little, she was able to acquire merchandise and build her clientele.

Gloria is requesting financing in order to buy more bundles of clothing so that she can attract more customers with the variety that she offers in her shop. All this effort is for the wellbeing of her children and the personal growth that she gets from being independent. Her long-term hope is to set up a beauty salon, as she is a professional stylist.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothing

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious and she operates a farm where she keeps rabbits and pigs. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. 

Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more rabbits and renovate her rabbit shed. 

Her business goal is to be a major supplier of rabbits within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family's financial needs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits and renovate her rabbit shed.

loans.name: Edelmira Ermaina

texts.es: Edelmira: Es una joven de 25 años de edad, jovial y luchadora, soltera. Debido a que con su salario como enfermera no le alcanza para reparar su vivienda de tambo y madera, está solicitando su primer financiamiento, para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en:
Edelmira: She is a 25-year-old woman, cheerful and a fighter, unmarried. Since her salary as a nurse is not enough to repair her wooden stilt house, she is asking for her first loan, to improve the conditions of her home and have a more respectable and secure home for her family. With her loan, she wants to buy construction materials: wood, metal roofing, nails, and cover costs of labor. 

Her dream is to eventually have a concrete (cement) house, because it has more durability.

loans.use: To repair her wooden stilt house

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 8 to 18 years old. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells newspapers. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of newspapers. He hopes that in the future, he will live a comfortable life with his family. This is his 10th loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of newspapers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a shaving machine and renovate the shop. His business goal is to have more barber shops within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine and renovate the shop

loans.name: Harun

texts.en: Harun is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, flour, washing soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a highly populated area. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier and he will improve the living standards of his family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Phylis
