texts.en: Phylis is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soap, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

Tabitha will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have increased income. 

This is Tabitha's second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob, a youthful 27-year-old father, is a wise farmer who is respected by his neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Jacob is happily married and is blessed with three lovely children. For the past five years, he has been involved in mixed farming and he grows maize and vegetables. He also has dairy cows. Jacob has been able to provide nutritious food for his family. He earns a profit selling a variety of food crops, but he is faced with a challenge of delivering the produce to the market in a timely manner. This challenge has not made him give up and he states, “I have to do something for my family.“ Jacob joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring smallholder farmers like Jacob. He is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Jacob is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting his produce to the market has been a challenge. He has suffered many losses of perishable products (e.g. milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) that require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Jacob to achieve his dream and reach his goals. Accessing a financial solution for smallholder farmers in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Jacob feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, that help smallholder farmers to gain respect and equality among their large scale farmer counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Jacob will never suffer losses due to a delay in delivering produce to the market. He will increase his sales volume because he will be able to transport more goods to the market. His income will increase. Jacob is a man who is making a change for himself and for others in the community because he intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Jacob will use the loan to improve his living conditions and assure his children of uninterrupted education and a secure future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike to deliver his products to the market

loans.name: Gachigi

texts.en: Gachigi is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Centro Group

texts.es:
En 1959 fue derribado el último fuerte de batalla ubicado a dos cuadras donde se formó el grupo llamado “Centro” el cual debe su nombre a la ubicación del domicilio donde se realizan las reuniones. La zona donde se encuentra la comunidad es  una de las máximas productoras de caña de azúcar. Las integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:

Eugenia –Panadería 
María –Antojitos 
Felipa – Ropa De Segunda 
Nisha –Calzado, Perfumes Por Catalogo Y Comida
Estela -Ropa
Lorena -Ropa Y Perfumes
Pragedes -Renta De Cuartos

Doña Prágedes ha dedicado 30 años de su vida al servicio de renta de cuartos. La gente llama a su negocio "La vecindad” por todas las personas que allí habitan. Pensar a futuro es lo que hizo Prágedes en un inicio. Al enviudar y tener a sus hijos pequeños, sabía que no podía salir a trabajar y descuidarlos, entonces comenzó el negocio que prevalece hasta ahora. Con las ganancias obtenidas ha solventado los gastos de su hogar, logró pagar la educación de sus hijos y brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Actualmente, sus ganancias las utiliza principalmente para dar mantenimiento a los cuartos y que sus inquilinos se sientan cómodos en su hogar. Dos hijos de Prágedes aún viven en el mismo terreno que ella y a pesar de que tienen sus propias actividades económicas, también la apoyan a pintar los cuartos y barrer el patio, además de cuidar de ella. Anteriormente, los chicos eran su fuente de inspiración, pero hoy en día ella se ha convertido en la inspiración de sus hijos quienes la admiran por todo lo que ha alcanzado.

Para seguir mejorando, Prágedes necesita comprar pintura y 4 chapas para cambiar las dañadas y de esta manera seguir brindando un buen servicio. Además, "La vecindad”, como le llaman los inquilinos continua creciendo y pronto habrá un nuevo cuarto. "Conservar el patrimonio para mis hijos y nietos ha sido y será mi mayor reto". Hace 30 años cuando Prágedes pensaba a futuro su propósito era llegar a la vejez y ser capaz de generar su propio ingreso y ahora tiene el medio ideal para hacerlo.

*En la imagen: las integrantes del grupo "Centro” están sentadas en la banca que se encuentra en la entrada de los cuartos de doña Pragedes quien viste blusa negra con puntos de colores y falda color vino.
texts.en:
In 1959 the last battle fort was torn down two blocks away from the location where the communal bank "Centro" holds its meetings.  The area is one of the major sugar cane producers.

The members of the group are:

Eugenia - Bakery 
María - Snacks 
Felipa - Used clothing
Nisha - Shoes, perfumes by catalogue and food. 
Estela - Clothing
Lorena - Clothing and perfumes
Pragedes - Room rental

Pragedes has worked for 30 years renting rooms.  People call her business "La vecindad" (the neighborhood) because of all the people who live there.  Pragedes had a vision for the future when she started.  Left a widow with four small children, she knew she could not go out to work and leave them alone.  So she started a business that is still operating today.  With her earnings she has been able to cover household expenses, pay for her children's education and give them a good quality of life.  

Now she mainly uses her earnings for room maintenance and making her guests comfortable.  Two of her children still live on the same land but they have their own businesses.  They help out by painting the rooms and sweeping the patio, and also care for her.  Before, it was her childen who were her inspiration but now she has become theirs because of their admiration for all she has accomplished.

In order to continue improving, Pragedes needs to buy paint and four metal sheets to change damaged ones.  This will allow her to continue providing a good service.  And, "La vecindad" as it is called by its guests, continues growing and will soon have a fourth room.  "To preserve my children's and grandchildren's heritage has been and will be my greatest challenge."  It was 30 years ago that Pragedes thought about her future goal of reaching old age and being able to generate her own income, and now she has the ideal means to do so.

*In the photo the members of the "Centro" group are seated on a bench outside the rooms rented by Pragedes.  She is wearing a black print blouse and burgundy skirt.

loans.use: To buy paint and change metal sheeting.

loans.name: Juana Domitila

texts.es: Juana de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, la clienta es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado municipal que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 20 años, Juana solicita un préstamo para poder , ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia
texts.en:
Juana, 62, lives in her own home with her daughter.  She is a very hard worker who dedicates all her time to her business in an effort to get ahead.  She has a fruit and vegetable stand located in the municipal market near where she has lived for 20 years.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, wholesale, so she can give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables, wholesale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, apples, tomatoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and other items

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has two children with ages ranging from three years to eight years old. He describes himself to be a risk taker. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman and has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 20 years. 

Beatrice describes herself to be jovial. She operates a farm where she grows tea and other crops. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area with good rainfall and her primary customers are tea factories. Beatrice describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will give her children the best education. 

This is Beatrice's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman and has five children with ages ranging from 8 years to 17 years. She operates a retail shop where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

Beth will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman and has two children. She describes herself to be jovial and committed. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with good rainfall and her primary customers are milk factories and individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

Agnes will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to have at least six cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will give her children best education. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Klaudio

texts.en:
Klaudio is a hardworking 50-year-old married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with four children. He has been operating a mini depot since 2006 and farming for income generation. He hopes to educate his children in spite of competition affecting his returns on capital. 

Klaudio is asking for a loan to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Hokumkhan

texts.en: Hokumkhan is married and has two children. He is 48 years old. Hokumkhan’s son is in the ninth grade in school. He is athletic and in the future, wants to be a famous judo fighter. Hokumkhan’s daughter is in the sixth grade. His wife is a housewife. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the occupied zone of Fuzuli city. Now Hokumkhan’s family is living in Fuzuli region. This is Hokumkhan's second loan; his first loan he closed on time. Now he changed his business to a butcher shop. He is selling chickens, cows and sheep meat. Today he needs a loan to buy more meats to sell. He has applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He says he is thankful to Kiva and all of the lenders for help. In the future, he wants to repair his work place.

loans.use: to buy more meat to increase his business. In the future he wants to repair his work place

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea and has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Esther will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Lidia Catalina

texts.es:
Lidia esta agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito por haberle facilitado un financiamiento, con el que pudo comprar mercadería para su pequeña tienda de artículos plásticos. Ese crédito fue de gran ayuda para ella, pues pudo agregar nuevos productos como bolsas de libra y cuchillos plásticos, ella tiene el apoyo de su hijo que la ayuda con las cuotas a saldar. 
El nuevo crédito lo solicita para surtir sus productos con platos, vasos, servilletas, chimbombas etc., esto le ayudará a incrementar las ventas y en consiguiente obtendrá más ingresos. Además podrá cubrir la demanda que surge por los productos plásticos que ofrece. Lidia a sus 66 años, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que quiere volverse auto sostenible y tiene planes para agrandar su negocio a futuro.
texts.en:
Lidia is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for providing her with a loan. She was able to use it to buy merchandise for her small plastic goods shop. The loan was a great help to her as she was able to offer new products such as pound bags and plastic knives. Lidia has the support of her son who helps her with the accounts.

This new loan will be used to stock up on plates, cups, napkins, and other items. This will help Lidia to increase sales and, as a result, earn a higher income. In addition, she will be able to cover the demand for plastic goods. At 66 years of age, Lidia is a plucky and hard-working woman who wants to support herself. She has plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock up on plates, cups, napkins, and other items.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man and has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, and has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

Philip will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of milk. His business goal is to own a dairy farm within five years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to the highest level. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of milk to re-sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to own a big grocery shop within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells basins, shoes, brushes and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are of all types, and she describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Mary will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, shoes, and other items. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of basins, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer casada de 61 años de edad, ella vive en la comunidad de la Ladrillera, en San Pablo Jocopilas.  Rosario es una señora ya mayor de edad, pero le encanta trabajar ya que eso la mantienen ocupada y eso le hace feliz a ella. 
Rosario esta es la segunda vez que está solicitando un prestamo en ADICLA, el primer prestamo  que obtuvo le sirvió de gran ayuda, ya que con eso pudo comprar sus materiales  de construcción y avanzo parte de la remodelación de su casa porque anteriormente no tenía buenas condiciones  los ambientes, con los nuevos ambientes y con este primer avance; ella logro instalar una su pequeña tienda. Ahora Rosario necesita un nuevo prestamo de cinco mil quetzales para seguir con los trabajos de remodelación hasta ver su casa totalmente nueva tal como ella lo ha soñado. 
Rosario manifiesta que está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le están dando a través de los préstamos, ya que de esa manera está logrando sus sueños, el anhelo de ella ahora es ver su tienda cada día más grande porque es otra fuente de ingreso más para Rosario.
texts.en:
Rosario, 61, is married and lives in the community of Ladrillera in San Pablo Jocopilas.  Despite her age she loves to work to stay busy, which makes her happy.

Rosario is requesting her second loan through ADICLA.  The first one she had was very helpful and allowed her to buy construction materials to start part of the renovation of her house which was in bad condition.  Along with the first stage of remodeling she was able to set up a small store.

The 5,000 GTQ loan Rosario needs now is to finish the remodeling process.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support, allowing her to accomplish her dreams.  Now her goal is to expand her store since it is a source of extra income for Rosario.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is 23 years old and is from Rustavi city. She lives with her parents and sister. Nowadays, the family's only source of income is from her father's work as a private driver. 

Darejan had been working as a stylist at the local private salon, where she had been generating a small income. She left the job to open her own small salon in her house and serve her clients herself. Darejan will get the opportunity to generate more income from having her own business and not having to depend on the other owners' shares. 

All of the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions. After several unsuccessful attempts, Darejan applied for credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting poor people to start or re-start businesses. With the amount received Darejan plans to purchase all the tools and furniture she needs and also repair the room where she will serve clients. She also has her own loyal costumers and so the loan will be a great help to this motivated woman and her family. Darejan awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to open her own small beauty salon and generate income herself.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: Darío: Es un señor luchador de 52 años de edad, originario de Puerto Cabezas, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos: Dos son mayores de edad e independientes y dos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Su esposa es comerciante, vende ropa usada. El estableció una pequeña tienda de ropa y calzado, desde hace 20 años, en un tramo que alquila en el mercado municipal, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 500 (Quinientos Córdobas Netos). Está solicitando financiamiento para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y calzado que comprará en Managua y Masaya; esto le permitirá vender a precios favorable a sus clientela en Bilwi y también incrementar sus ingresos.  Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto y alquilar cuartos.
texts.en:
Darío, 52, is a hard worker from Puerto Cabezas.  He is married and has four children: two independent adults and two adolescents in high school.  His wife is a merchant and sells used clothing.  He established a small clothing and shoe store 20 years ago in a location he rents from the municipal market.  He pays C$ 500 (500 Cordobas) every month.

The loan he is requesting is to buy clothing and shoes in Managua and Masaya.  This will allow him to give his customers in Bilwi better prices which will increase business.  His dream is to build a concrete house and rent out rooms.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and shoes in Managua and Masaya.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy brick, zinc, cement, sand and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Olivia Isabel

texts.es: Olivia Isabel: es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 16 años de edad, estudia su secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como pescador. Ella  cuenta con una experiencia de 7 años de ser docente de primaria. Desde  hace 16 años habitan en una casa construida de tambo y madera, que actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para cambiar madera rústica, madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa de concreto que tenga mejores condiciones para su hija y sobre todo mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Olivia Isabel is a friendly woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 30 years old, married and has a 16-year-old daughter who is in high school. Olivia’s husband is a fisherman. Olivia has seven years’ experience as a primary school teacher. For 16 years the family has lived in a house built with wood and metal sheeting. However, the house is currently in need of repairs and so Olivia is applying for a loan in order to replace old wood, brushed wood, wooden posts and nails, and to pay labourers. Olivia and her husband dream of having a house built with concrete where they can offer their daughter better living conditions and better security.

loans.use: to replace old wood, brushed wood, wooden posts and nails, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to construct a stall for her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 28-year-old married father of two children. 

A year ago Hasan opened a mobile phone shop to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his beloved family. Hasan is an ambitious man who worked hard in this short period of time to attract customers and gain a good reputation among his region. He is trying desperately to develop his business, thus he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new collection of mobile phones and accessories to satisfy his customers' needs.

Hasan hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is an agriculturalist who also fattens cattle in the rural western part of Uganda. The venture has helped him to sustain his family and also meet their needs including paying tuition fees. Due to hard work, Julius' business has grown to a level of self sustenance. 

Julius needs money to buy more cows that he will feed on fodder for about three months and then sell. He thanks UGAFODE for the flexibility in repayment terms, especially allowing him to pay quarterly as he is assured of sales and profits in that time frame. He is hard working and encourages fellow farmers to reach out to microfinance institutions for financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jemina

texts.en:
Jemina is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. She gets their daily sustenance from her store earnings. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use as additional capital for her second business which is buying and selling cars. She buys slightly used second hand cars from individuals who want to replace their cars and she looks for buyers who are interested to buy. She is encouraged by a good outcome of her new business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Jemina hopes for her businesses to grow and flourish and to someday open an auto shop. She prays for good health and long life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy second hand cars to re-sell.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman and has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, cabbages and potatoes. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. 

Linet will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of onions and cabbages. Her business goal is to be a major supplier of vegetables within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of onions and cabbages.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy town and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather which affect business. 

Dorine will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman, and has four children with ages ranging from 14 years to 32 years. 

Julia describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells artworks. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of artworks. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. 

This is Julia's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of artworks to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 36-year-old single lady who opened her clothes shop a year ago to cover her needs and expenses. She is an ambitious lady who is working hard and trying her best to attract more customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collections of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' special needs, which will help her gain a good reputation among her customers.

Linda hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collections of winter clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with two children. He describes himself to be strong . He operates a butchery and has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

Peter will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. He hopes that in the future he will open a restaurant. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 49 years old. She lives with her pensioner mother in Kobuleti district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and nut-trees. Irine is very hardworking woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. She sells the harvested products locally at a good price. 

Irine is a tailor, but she does not have a sewing machine. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 550 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a sewing machine and will get orders to sew clothes and generate additional income.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Takondwa Group

texts.en:
Alinafe previously took a loan from MLF. She used the loan to expand her business by purchasing different commodities for her shop. This helped her to increase her returns, and she is now able to pay school and medical bills for her children. She greatly thanks Kiva for helping her to improve her family's living standards

Alinafe is now planning to diversify her businesses, as this will help her to have different sources of funds. As such she would like to obtain another loan in order to buy bales of second hand clothes. She decided on this business since its profitable and it's also highly demanded in her area. She plans on sending her children to university and hopes to move in the city in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Jacinta

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, tiene un  hijo de seis años, y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Mutualista’ de la ciudad de Santa Cruzr, de clima soleado, humedo con una temperatura ambiente entre 21 y 35 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez trigueña, cabello color castaño, habla español por el comercio. su vida la comparte junto a su hijito, Viven en un departamento alquilado que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, huevos, galletas, leche, refrescos, agua, detergentes, etc. el negocio está ubicado en la avenida principal y por el lugar no existen otros negocios de este tipo, su negocio es muy conocido porque es bastante completo; “es la única tienda por la zona así que tengo mucha clientela porque surto con productos de temporada…”. Su sueño es tener una casa propia en la ciudad, y desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de una congeladora de alimentos para almacenar refrescos ya que es época de calor. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora para tener los refrescos frios.
texts.en:
Carmen, aged 31, is single and has a six year old child. She has a neighborhood store selling staple food goods.

She is a good mother, and is responsible and hard working. Her store is in the Mutualista area of Santa Cruz, where the climate is sunny and humid, and the temperature is between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Carmen has a dark complexion and brown hair, and she speaks Spanish at work. She lives with her young child in a rented apartment which is supplied with running water, electricity and a sewage system. In her store she sells staple foods such as: bread, sugar, eggs, cookies, milk, soft drinks, water detergents etc. The store is situated on the main street, where there are no other similar stores. 

Her business is well known because of the wide range of goods: "It is the only store in the area so I have many customers, because I offer seasonal products...". Her dream is to own her own house in the city, and she wishes to expand her store by buying a freezer to store soft drinks now that the weather is hotter. This is her first loan with the institution in the two years that she has had her store.

This is why Carmen is requesting a loan to buy a freezer to store soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo  De Crédito San Agustín Km 20.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 9 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el cuerpo de Ing. del ejército.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para contribuir con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una pequeña granja donde cría pollos, compra los pollos pequeños en un local en la ciudad y  los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses hasta que estén listos y con buen peso, luego los vende a vecinos y conocidos del lugar o también vende a comerciantes que pasan por la zona, lleva más de 5 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganar sus ingresos sin salir de su casa.
Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar pollos, alimentos  y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 3 ciclos y está muy a gusto con la institución ya que le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
In the city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, rich and varied gastronomy and the warmth of its people, every 15 days the members of the communal bank "San Agustin Km 20" get together.

This is where Rosa, 28, lives.  She has a common-law husband and three children, ages 10, 9 and 3.  The two eldest attend school.  Her husband works in the engineering corps of the military.

Rosa is a woman who likes to work to contribute to the household expenses.  She has a small farm where she raises chickens.  She buys chicks in the city and keeps them four two or three months until they are big enough to sell to neighbors and friends in the area.  She also sells to merchants traveling through the area.  For over five years she has been in business earning an income from home.

This loan will be used to buy chickens, feed and medicine for their optimum development.  Rosa has been in the group for three cycles and she likes how the institution has helped her.  Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed and medicine.

loans.name: Euda Haide

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Euda, tiene 72 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos mayores de  edad, dos viven con ellos. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Euda con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la preparación y venta de bocadillos que los fabrica bajo pedidos,  ella tres  a cuatro veces por semana entrega sus productos a sus clientes, también prepara comida para fiestas y recepciones que por lo general lo realiza una vez por semana. Lleva  más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank "La Estancia" meets in Estancilla in the Tosagua Canton.  The location is known for being very dynamic and most of the local people work in agriculture and raising animals, due to the vast vegetation.

This is where Euda, 72, lives.  She is married and has eight adult children.  Two still live at home and her husband is retired.

In order to earn her own income and help the household get ahead, Euda makes and sells sandwiches on an order basis.  Four or five times a week she delivers the orders to her customers.  She also prepares food for parties and receptions, about once a week.  For over 20 years she has been in business.

The loan will be used to buy the groceries she needs to prepare the food.  She has been a member of the communal bank since it began and she likes it because of how helpful the loans are.  Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: America Yahoska

texts.es:
Con mucha lucha y esfuerzo, America Yahoska una joven de 28 años de edad, estudiante de ingeniería en ciencias agrarias y madre soltera de un niño de 7 años, ha sabido sacar a flote su negocio; ella comenzó hace 2 años como vendedora ambulante, ahora tienen una pequeña pulpería en la cual oferta diversos productos para el hogar. 

America solicita el crédito porque quiere invertir  más en mercadería para su negocio y comprar: arroz, azúcar, jabón, productos lácteos y verduras; y de esta manera ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias. Las metas de esta joven entusiasta llegar a establecer otra pulpería en la comunidad donde nació. Los planes futuros son convertir su negocio en miscelánea.
texts.en:
Through much struggle and effort, America Yahoska has known how to keep her business afloat.  She is 28 years old, a student of agrarian science engineering and the single mother of a seven-year-old son.  Two years ago she started working as a street vendor and now she has a small grocery store where she sells different home products.

America is requesting a loan because she wants to buy goods such as rice, sugar, soap, dairy products and vegetables.  This is so she can offer a wider variety to customers and earn more profit.

The goals of this enthusiastic young lady include opening another grocery store in the community where she was born.  Her plans for the future are to convert the business into a variety shop.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, soap, dairy products and vegetables.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Labrar la tierra para obtener una buena cosecha es lo que impulsa a Félix a seguir adelante y así ver los frutos de su labor. Gracias a Kiva y Mi Crédito Félix pudo, mediante sus créditos, comprar insumos para la siembra del frijol (insecticidas, granos), así mismo, pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva su producto. Ahora Félix solicita un nuevo crédito  para pagar, una vez más, el alquiler de la tierra donde cosecha la parcela de frijol y de esta forma seguir luchando día a día.
texts.en:
Working the land for a good harvest is what motivates Felix to get ahead and see the fruits of his labor.  Thanks to Kiva and Mi Crédito Felix had access to loans to buy supplies to plant beans (insecticides, grains) and also pay rent for the land where he grows his crop.

Now Felix is requesting a new loan to pay the land rental again for his bean crop so he can continue his daily work.

loans.use: To pay rent for the land where he grows beans.

loans.name: Dina Marlene

texts.es:
Dina, de 42 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y está casada.

Dina, tiene un pequeño taller de sastrería junto a su esposo, ellos elaboran uniformes escolares de las escuelas aledañas a su lugar de residencia.- También, desde hace 2 años Dina, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, los cual vende con amigas y vecinas.

Está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar productos de medicina natural, de esta manera espera obtener ingresos mayores. 

La metas u objetivos de Dina, son hacer crecer su pequeño taller, para confeccionar mayor cantidad de uniformes y que su negocio sea rentable en el tiempo y con los ingresos que reciba, asegurar la alimentación y educación de sus dos pequeños hijos a quienes ama incondicionalmente.
texts.en:
Dina, 42, is married and has two children.  She runs a small sewing shop together with her husband and they make school uniforms for schools near where they live.  For two years Dina also has been selling beauty products to friends and neighbors.

She is requesting a loan to buy natural medicines to earn extra income.  Her goal is to expand her sewing shop and make more uniforms so the business will be profitable in the future.  With the income she wants to guarantee food on the table and an education for her two young children, who she loves unconditionally.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her home.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: La señora María se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria en un instituto de localidad donde vive, del cual tiene 22 años de laborar, tiene una relación estable con 4 personas a su cargo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para mejorar la vivienda,  por eso visito ceprodel para formalizarlo el que utilizaría en la Compra de perlin, zinc, clavos y mano de obra, con los que mejoraría el techo de su vivienda el que está en mal estado y de esa manera mejorar el techo y crear mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a secondary school teacher in a high school local to where she lives. She has been working there for 22 years. She is in a stable relationship, with four dependents. 

She currently needs to requesting funding to improve her home, which is why she visited Ceprodel to formalize a loan. This will be used to buy purlins, zinc, nails and labor, so that she can improve the roof of her home, which is currently in a poor state. Improving the roof will create better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy purlins, zinc, nails and labor.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel: Es un señor cordial y luchador, pertenece a la etnia miskita, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 65 años edad, casado con 11 hijos: 10 son mayores de edad e independientes y la menor de 14 años de edad, estudia su segundo año de secundaria. Su esposa es ama de casa. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha construido su vivienda de concreto, sin embargo requiere de algunas mejoras, para brindarle mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Solicita financiamiento para reparar el cerco de su vivienda y comprar: malla, postes de madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería con el propósito que la atienda su esposa y contar con otra fuente de ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Daniel is a cordial man who is a fighter. He belongs to the Miskita ethnicity and is from Puerto Cabezas. He is 65 years old, married and has 11 children. Ten of them are grown and independent and the youngest, who is 14, is in the second year of high school. His wife is a housewife. With a lot of hard work, little by little he has built his house from concrete. Nonetheless, he needs to do some improvements to offer his family more security and comfort. He is asking for a loan to repair the fence around his house and buy: mesh, wooden posts, nails and to cover the costs of labor. His dream is to open a store so his wife can work there and have a source of income to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to repair the fence around his house and buy mesh, wooden posts, nails, and cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Moises Antonio

texts.es: Hay personas que consideran los números como una verdadera pesadilla, sin embargo, para otros no lo son. Este es el caso de Moises, un joven de 22 años, amante de los números que tiene grandes deseos de superación. Él es estudiante de  la carrera de “Contabilidad Pública y Auditoria” y cursa su último año. Moises solicita el crédito ya que con el podrá pagar el curso de su titulación en la universidad, para de esta forma, poder seguir con su desarrollo profesional y realizar sus sueños. Las metas de este joven carismático son graduarse de su carrera y obtener un empleo, así mismo, entre sus planes está llegar a tener su propia empresa de consultoría contable.
texts.en: There are people who consider numbers to be a true nightmare. Nonetheless, for others that is not the case. That is how it is for Moises, a 22 year old. He loves numbers and really wants to get ahead. He studies “Public Accounting and Auditing” and he is in the last year. Moises is asking for a loan to pay for his graduation course. This way, he can continue with his professional development and make his dreams come true. The young charismatic man's goals are to graduate and get a job, In addition, he also plans on having his own accounting office.

loans.use: to pay for his graduation course at his university.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es: Brenda: Es una mujer jovial, pertenece a la etnia miskita, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de 4 hijos: Tres son mayores de edad y el menor de 17 años de edad, estudia su secundaria. Desde hace más de 25 años habita en una vivienda de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, solicita financiamiento para iniciar a construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto y comprar: cemento, hierro, bloques, madera, zincs, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: Brenda is a jovial woman. She belongs to the Miskita ethnicity. She is from Puerto Cabezas, single mother of 4 children. Three of them are grown and the youngest, who is 17, is in high school. For more than 25 years, she has lived in a wooden house. In order to improve her family's standard of living, she is asking for a loan to start to build her house little by little from concrete and buy: cement, iron, blocks, wood, zinc sheeting, nails, and to cover the cost of labor. She dreams of offering her family a more secure house in good condition,

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, blocks, wood, zinc sheeting, nails, and to cover the costs of labor.

loans.name: Albertina Francisca

texts.es:
Albertina es una mujer casada de 47 años de edad, ella tiene dos hijas pero ya están casadas, ella y su esposo viven en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.

Albertina para apoyar a su esposo en la generación de su economía ella cuenta con una pequeña venta de comida, con esta actividad lleva aproximadamente  6 años, de esta manera ella ha logrado alcanzar sus objetivos siempre en beneficio de su familia. Pues para este año Albertina  quiere alcanzar realizar un nuevo proyecto mas que es la remodelación de su cocina, ella se da cuenta que  es un espacio  que se  utiliza todos los días por lo que  debe más placentero. 
 Pues para este proyecto ella solicita un prestamo de dos mil quetzales y así poco a poco empezara con este trabajo y con los ingresos que genera su negocio restringirá algunos gastos para pagar el prestamo. 

Albertina quiere más adelante instalar una tienda de abarrotería  para que tenga otros ingresos y seguir prosperando en la vida.
texts.en:
Albertina, 47, is a married woman. She has two daughters who are married. She lives with her husband in the community of Suchitepéquez.

In order to help her husband with the home expenses, Albertina sells food. She has been doing it for six years, and has managed to achieve her goals, which has been beneficial for her family. This year, Albertina has a new project, which is to remodel her kitchen. She realized that this is a space she uses every day, which is why it has to be more comfortable.

For this project, she needs a loan of 2,000 quetzales [GTQ]. She will advance with this project step by step, and will save some of her income in order to pay the installments. Albertina would like to open a grocery store in the future in order to receive an additional income and continue making headway.

loans.use: to remodel her kitchen.

loans.name: Mario Esteban

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre soltero de 41años de edad y padre de 2 hijos de las edades de 18 y 3 años.
Continua con su negocio que consiste en la confección de buzos deportivos para niños, compra la tela diseña los moldes y una vez terminadas los ofrece a la venta en lugares comerciales; “ le fue bien con el anterior crédito que lo uso en la compra de una máquina de coser”, comenta Mario, su hijo estudia ya en la universidad y ya no puede ayudarlo en el trabajo, así que Mario contrato una persona para que le ayuden y se siente feliz por ello ya que genera mano de obra.
Es por esos motivos que Mario solicita un préstamo en esta ocasión para para la compra de tela e hilos por mayor para incrementar sus producción ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha demanda
texts.en:
Mario is a 41-year-old single man. He has two children, aged 18 and 3. He continues making sport sweaters for children. He buys the fabrics and designs the molds. Once they are ready, he sells them to stores. Mario says that the previous loan was useful for him, since he could buy a sewing machine.

Mario’s son goes to the university and thus cannot help him at work, so he had to hire an assistant. This makes him happy anyway, since he is creating job opportunities.

This is why Mario is requesting a loan this time to buy fabrics and threads in bulk in order to increase his production, thinking of the increased demand during this time of the year.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads in bulk.

loans.name: Grupo Agricola Caserio Xexac 4 Group

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 32 años, él es casado tiene dos hijos uno de 4 años y el otro de 2 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad llamada caserío Xexac. 

Víctor (el primero de izquierda a derecha en la foto) realiza una actividad muy  sencilla pero él se siente útil a su  comunidad, pues esta actividad lo aprendió de sus padres desde temprana edad, pues Víctor ahora para generar su economía se dedica a la venta de bananos, él selecciono esta actividad ya que la zona donde él vive se produce mucho banano. Víctor además de ser vendedor de bananos, el también siembra, porque  en el lugar donde  se presta para realizar esta actividad 
Pues para que Víctor puede tener una buena cosecha, es necesario darle mantenimiento a la siembra, es por eso que él solicita un prestamo para que pueda comprar todo el insumo necesario; este prestamo que Víctor solicita será un prestamo grupal,  ya que han  analizado que los créditos grupales son aprobados con más facilidad y lo que manifiesta Víctor es que cuando el prestamo es en grupo nos animamos cada miembro en llevar al día nuestros pagos. 

Las aspiraciones de Víctor es que con las ganancias, él pueda comprar más terrenos, para que sus hijos tengan donde cultivar más plantaciones de banano y no hacer desaparecer esta actividad.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 32 year old man. He is married and has two children, aged 4 and 2. His family lives in a community called Caserío Xexac. 

Víctor (the first from the left in the photo) does a very simple activity, but he feels useful in his community. He learned this activity from his parents at an early age. To generate his income, Víctor now sells bananas. He chose this activity because in the area where he lives they produce a lot of bananas. In addition to selling bananas, Víctor also grows them because where he lives they grow well. In order for Víctor to have a good harvest, it is necessary to do maintenance on the crop. That is why he is asking for a loan so that he can buy all the materials he needs. The loan Víctor is asking for will be a group loan, because he has analyzed the group loan and they are approved more easily and what Víctor says that when the loan is in a group, each member is more enthusiastic about making the payments on time. 

With the profits, Víctor plans on buying more land so that his children will have a place to grow more bananas and not lose this activity.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his banana plantation.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind. She is always looking for activities that can improve the family income. 

She bought a sewing machine and trained on it until she became a professional. She started to make clothes and some products to sell and that helped her to cover some of the household expenses.

She is 35 years old and all her batteries are charged to take on the new challenges that life has prepared for her.
 
She is requesting financial help to buy more fabrics and yarns so that she can invest in setting up her business and attracting clients, and in this way create a positive impact on her family’s earnings. 

Her dream is to have a big tailoring business that provides a good income and creates jobs.

loans.use: To buy more of fabrics and yarns so that she can invest in setting up her business.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is 34 year old, married, and he has three children, all of whom are going to school. He is an honest İDP (internally displaced person) living in the Bilasuvar region.

He has been running his farm for many years and generating income for his family. 

He is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in his community and sells bull calves to the butchers. He has a few cows, and he produces a little bit of milk two times a day from them. He provides door-to-door milk sales to his customers and takes money on a monthly basis. 

He found that he can produce more milk from buffalo instead of cows, so he decided to buy buffalo. But the price of a buffalo is more than that of a cow, and he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a buffalo.

Therefore, Rashad  has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Aqroinvest CU, so that he can buy one buffalo for producing more milk to sell.

Rashad wants to keep buffalo instead of cows to grow his business and wants to maintain his cowshed because he does not have a proper place for his cattle either. He hopes that he would be able to buy a buffalo and would be able to generate maximum income.

loans.use: to buy one buffalo for producing more milk to sell.

loans.name: Elsever

texts.en:
Elsever is 33 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. His family is from Fizuli city and now he lives in the Fizuli region. For 22 years Elsever’s family has been IDP (internally displaced people) from their native land. 

Elsever is a taxi driver, transporting passengers between Fizuli and Baku. His car's motor is broken, and therefore he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the car's motor and increase his business,.

Elsever is thankful to Komak and Kiva for help. In the future he wants to paint his car and get married.

loans.use: to repair his car's motor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Unidad Group

texts.es:
En un lugar del estado de Veracruz, 8 personas escucharon hablar de la oportunidad de crecimiento que brinda VisionFund México al otorgar préstamos para mejorar sus negocios, gracias a la evidencia de otros grupos de la misma comunidad ellos se han convertido en clientes:

Luciana -Zapatos 
Carlos - Panadería 
Claudia,  María, Francisco - Pan 
Luisa –Medicina Naturista 
Nelsa -Tacos
Josefina -Ropa

Cerca del río, a unos cuantos metros antes de llegar al cerro se encuentra la panadería más antigua de la comunidad, donde la unidad se deja fácilmente ver ya que varios miembros de una familia se dedican a la elaboración de pan. 

Don Carlos aprendió el arte de hacer pan desde hace 30 años cuando trabajaba para otra persona, con el sueldo percibido solventaba los gastos de su familia pero su intención era ahorrar todo lo posible y por algún tiempo también trabajó en el campo cortando café. Finalmente hace 20 años, Don Carlos logró hacer su sueño realidad y estableció su propia panadería donde hoy en día trabajan su esposa, su hermana, su suegra y su hijo menor quien tiene 22 años. Además dos integrantes de su grupo de préstamo trabajan para él ayudando a distribuir el pan en comunidades más alejadas. “La panadería la inicié en la parte trasera de la casa donde construí un horno de piedra en el cual se sigue cociendo el pan. La leña le otorga un sabor único y me garantiza la estabilidad de mi panadería”. En la casa de Carlos, se hornea pan dos veces al día para tener lista toda la cantidad de piezas que se vende en un día.

Las ganancias del negocio han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia que logró remodelar su casa de madera. La esposa de Carlos comentó que decidieron mantener la casa de madera para no olvidar quiénes son y de donde vienen.

El préstamo será de utilidad para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar y colorante para incrementar la producción del pan.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la panadería de don Carlos quien viste playera verde.
texts.en:
Somewhere in the Veracruz state, eight people heard about the opportunities to grow that VisionFund Mexico was offering, by giving out loans for business improvement. Thanks to the good things other local groups have told them, they have also become clients:

Luciana – Shoes
Carlos – Bakery
Claudia, María, Francisco – Bread
Luisa – Naturopathic medicine
Nelsa –Tacos
Josefina – Clothes

The oldest bakery in the community is by the river, before reaching the hill. Here, it is easy to see how closely the family members work making bread.

Carlos learned the art of making bread thirty years ago, while working for someone else. He covered the home expenses with his salary, but his intention was to save as much as possible. He also worked in the countryside, picking coffee. Finally, twenty years ago Carlos could make his dream come true and opened his own bakery, where he works with his wife, his sister, his mother-in-law, and his youngest child, who is 22. In addition, two members of this group work with him and help him to distribute the bread to more distant communities.

 “I opened the bakery in the back of my house. I built a stone oven, where we still bake bread. The unique flavor is given by the firewood we use, and guarantees my bakery’s stability.” Bread is baked two times a day at Carlos’s, in order to have all the bread that is sold every day.

With the profits they receive, they have been able to improve their living conditions: they could remodel their wooden house. Carlos’s wife says that they wanted to keep the original wood in order to remember their origin.

This loan will be of great help to buy flour, butter, sugar, and coloring, and increase their bread production.

* The picture was taken in Carlos’s bakery. He is wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, sugar and coloring.

loans.name: Said

texts.es: Said, se encuentra dedicada a las ventas mediante guías especializadas de productos por catálogos, a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; esta emprendedora joven de 28 años de edad,  inicialmente vendía productos por intermedio de una amiga quien adicionaba a su pedido los artículos que Said lograba vender, de este modo ella logro incorporarse a una empresa de éste mismo formato en el año 2014. Ella es habitante del municipio de Galapa  y sus principales clientes son los habitantes del sector, quienes encuentran a la mano todo tipo de calzado, ropa para toda la familia y sabanas, además les ofrece facilidad de pago. Said ha mantenido una excelente relación comercial con sus proveedores, quienes le ofrecen la mercancía a crédito, sin embargo al realizar las compras de contado, obtiene descuentos y puede ofrecer tentadores precio a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de sabanas, ropa y calzado. Esta inversión promete incrementar las ventas y el número de clientes que actualmente atiende.  Said es madre de un hijo de un año de edad, a quien desea brindarle una buena educación, su hijo es su principal motivación para continuar trabajando con mucho compromiso y dedicación, su meta a futuro es lograr comprar su casa e incrementar el número de clientes.
texts.en: Said works selling products via specialized catalogs. With them, she promotes the items she sells. This 28 year old entrepreneur first started selling through a friend who would add items that Said was able to sell to her orders. In this way, she was able to start a business with the same format in 2014. She is a resident of the town of Galapa and her main customers are the area residents who find all types of shoes, clothing for their families and sheets at hand, in addition to the ease of payment she offers them. Said has kept an excellent business relationship with her suppliers, who offer her the merchandise on credit. Nonetheless, when she pays for the items up front, she gets discounts and can offer tempting prices to her customers. Right now, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in buying sheets, clothing and shoes. This investment promises to increase her sales and the number of customers that she has now. Said is the mother of a one year old son and she wants to offer him a good education. Her son is her main motivation to keep working with a lot of dedication and commitment. Her goal for the future is to be able to buy a house and increase the number of customers she has.

loans.use: to invest in buying sheets, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is 47 years old. 

He started a phone and phone accessories shop in 2010 to boost his income from architecture work. He wishes to grow his business despite a lot of competition that brings about irregularities in his earnings. 

John is honest and is requesting a loan to buy phones and accessories for selling.

loans.use: to buy phones and accessories for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new poly tank to replace her old one, which has developed a fault.

loans.name: Chafika

texts.en:
Chafika is a 54-year-old married mother of four children. She established her current convenience store two years ago to support her beloved husband in making their living and covering their increasing expenses. 

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with more requested products to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Chafika hopes to expand her business more in the future to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with more requested products to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Rayiimsoom Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est le représentant du groupe RAYIMSOOM. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Il a 12 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est vendeur de pièces détachées et aussi mécanicien depuis 06 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Il  veut s’acheter 10 pédales à vélo, 10 clés, 20 chaines à vélo.
Monsieur veut épargner ses bénéfices. Il ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mr Yacouba is the representative of the group RAYIMSOOM; He is well. He is married and the father of 7 children between the ages of 27 and 7 months. Three of his children attend school. Overall, he is responsible for 12 people.
For the past six years, Yacouba has been selling parts and acting as a mechanic. He stocks up in the surrounding markets. He hopes to purchase 10 bicycle pedals, 10 keys and 10 bicycle chains. He plans to save his profits. He hopes to increase his activity and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: purchase 10 bicycle pedals, 10 keys and 20 bicycle chains.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a married woman with seven children. Her husband retired from the army and now he is working as a driver.
 
Her eldest son bought four goats to start his business and increase the family`s income. He wanted to help his parents and to help his siblings in their education. 

That was his dream. But he could not achieve it, because he was dead before two years. That was a big shock for his family, especially his mother. 
Two years after her son's death, she decided to complete his dream, and perhaps that will help increase the incomes. 

She applied for a loan to buy more goats and supplies for the farm to expand her son`s business and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: To buy more goats and supplies for the farm to expand her son`s business and achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy, 42, is a smallholder farmer residing in Kericho, an agricultural town in the North Rift region of Kenya. He is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. 

Back in 2009, Sammy practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was doing only half an acre of maize crop per season and some dairy farming. The returns were so meager that he could barely fend for survival. He kept doing maize farming for years without turning a profit until 2013, when he switched to tomato farming and there was light at the end of the tunnel for Sammy. 

Today, Sammy is a fully-fledged entrepreneur. He has been provided with technical guidance, training programs and exposure visits. He has already serviced other asset-based loans fully from Juhudi Kilimo. Through the loans, he has acquired high-quality dairy cows, farm supplies and poultry.
 
To capitalize more on returns from the booming tomato farming, Sammy is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to build a greenhouse. Unlike his competition, Sammy conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high-quality produce. By doing this, he has created a name for himself and a demand for his produce. 

Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Sammy’s goal, which is to expand the greenhouse house. In the future, he is also planning to introduce zero grazing methods, intensify his maize farming, and start value addition.

All that Sammy waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a green house.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año y una hija de 3 años, y trabaja como transportista.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, constante, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’; un área rural caracterizada por mantenerse como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, hasta en los distritos urbanos. Maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo se producen. También tienen granjas de pollos e incluso se trabaja en la apicultura. De clima semi-tropical durante todo el año.
Nelson es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la peluquería, y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia en obra gruesa que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Él se dedica a trabajar como transportista, comenzó como ayudante de camión hasta que adquirió experiencia y se independizó. Durante casi toda su vida viene construyendo su casa, poco a poco y ladrillo a ladrillo; logró construir dos habitaciones una cocina, un baño y lavandería, el siguiente paso es la instalación de agua potable, actualmente recoge agua de un pozo manualmente con un balde atado a una cuerda. Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa, y desea realizar una inversión en la instalación de agua potable para su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia una vida segura. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que trabaja independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Nelson solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para y brindarle un hogar seguro a su familia.
texts.en: Nelson is a 24 year old man. He lives with his domestic partner, a 1 year old son and a 3 year old daughter. He works as a truck driver. He is enterprising, decisive, constant. strong, responsible and very hardworking. He works in the community of Sacaba, a rural area known for being the breadbasket of the city because of its production of cereals, vegetables and fruits, even in the urban districts. Corn, wheat, barley, vegetables, strawberry, bananas, papayas, oranges, peaches, and even tumbo (banana passionfruit) plants are produced. There are also chicken farms and bee-keeping businesses. The weather is semi tropical during the whole year. Nelson is dark skinned, and has short black hair. He is of medium height. His native language is Quechua which is spoken in the community. He also speaks Spanish because of general culture and because of his job. He shares his life with his partner who works as a hairdresser, and with his children who do not attend school yet. They live in their own house which is unfinished, and has electricity and well water. He works as a truck driver. He started as the assistant for a truck driver until he got experience and became independent. During almost his whole life he has been building his house little by little, brick by brick. He was able to build two rooms, a kitchen, a bathroom and a laundry room. The next step is to install drinking water. Currently, he collects water from a well using a bucket tied to a string. His dream is to see his house construction ready. He wants to use the loan to install drinking water for his kitchen, bathroom and laundry room to give his family a safe life. This is his first loan cycle with the institution since it is a year that he has been working independently. For this reason Nelson is requesting a loan to install drinking water in his kitchen, bathroom and laundry room in order to offer his family a safe home.

loans.use: to install drinking water in his kitchen, a bathroom and a laundry room in order to offer his family a safe home.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest.

Peris operates a poultry and dairy farm where she sells poultry and milk. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more poultry chicks.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a big poultry business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to  buy more poultry chicks.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single young man living in Irbid. He works in a mall where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for him. Mohammad is also a university student. He studies accounting. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job.

Mohammad took an education loan. This loan will help him to pay the University installments for this semester.

By taking this loan, he will be able to complete his studies faster and improve himself.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and be able to complete his studies faster and improve himself.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Takeo province’s Bati district, Chanthol is 30 years old and married. Chanthol and her husband are farmers who grow rice as their main business to support the family. They supplement their family’s income by working as garment workers. Having been in the business for 12 years, they are able to make daily earnings of 26,000 KHR and manage to save about 4,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Chanthol with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now applying for a loan of 6,000,000 KHR, she is going to use this loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting to work. She hopes to reduce her expenses on motor-taxis so as to better her living’s condition.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 23-year-old single man from Mafraq city. He tried to work in addition to his studies but he could not find a suitable job, He is a student majoring in Management Information Systems. He wants to complete his studies and find a good job.

Omar has 11 siblings. This causes financial problems for his family, and his father cannot cover the education expenses in addition to the household expense.

Therefore,Omar applied for an education loan. This loan will help him to pay his university installments for this semester and buy the necessary books.

loans.use: to pay his university installments for this semester and buy the necessary books.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition for the semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy educational resources for her children and to pay for their registration.

loans.name: Mariclara

texts.es: Mariclara es una emprendedora mujer de 49 años de edad, residente en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, en el año 2009 decidió iniciar su negocio de almacén misceláneo y confecciones de ropa desde su casa, como una alternativa para generar ingresos y apoyar a su cónyuge con los gastos del hogar, así mismo poder ofrecerles una educación de calidad y un mejor bienestar a sus sus hijas de 25 y 23 años y a su hijo de 24 años de edad. Ella ofrece en su almacén artículos de papelería, insumos de modistería, cosméticos, esmaltes, perfumes, cremas corporales, productos para el aseo personal e incluso exhibe sus propios diseños de ropa.  Sus principales clientes son amigos y referidos a quienes les ofrece de sus servicios y productos todos los días, sus ventas son generadas de contado, de este mismo modo sus compras las realizan de contado a distribuidores y comerciantes de la ciudad.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá  en la compra de útiles y papelería en general para aprovechar la demanda por la temporada escolar.  Esta inversión es muy importante para mejorar el surtido del negocio y con ello incrementar las ventas. Mariclara desea continuar trabajando comprometida para ayudarles a sus hijos con sus estudios profesionales, así mismo desea continuar creciendo en sus negocios para ello planea a largo plazo comprar otras máquinas para su taller de confecciones.
texts.en:
Mariclara is an enterprising 49 year old, resident of a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla. In the year 2009 she started her business which is a miscellaneous store and making clothing from her house as an alternative for generating income and support her husband with the household expenses. Thus she can offer quality education and better well being to her25 and 23 year old daughters and her 24 year old son.

She sells paper products, sewing supplies, cosmetics, enamels, perfume, body creams, personal use products and even exhibits her own sewing designs. Her main clients are friends and people refereed to her to whom she offers her services and products every day. Her sales are mainly in cash . And in this way her she makes her purchases in cash from wholesalers and businesses in the city.

Currently she is applying for her first loan from KIva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in buying school supplies and paper products to take advantage of the demand for the school season. This investment is very important to improve the stock of her business and doing this increase her sales.

Mariclara wants to continue working having promised to help her children with their professional studies. And she wants to continue expanding her business and to do this she plans to buy other machines for her sewing workshop.

loans.use: to invest in school supplies and paper products in general to take advantage of demand for the school year.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 54-year-old widowed woman from the village of Ateni. She lives alone and has a small income from an agricultural activity. In particular, she cultivates a plot of land where she grows apples and cherries, and sells them seasonally at the local market. 

She started trading clothes last year. She is satisfied with this business and now needs another 600 GEL to increase the turnover.

Nana requested a loan of 600 GEL and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which enables rural people to start or re-start businesses. With the requested money, she plans to purchase more clothing and expand her business. This will help Nana to get more orders and profit. 

She has enough motivation to lead this business in a lucrative way. Nana awaits your kindness.
