loans.use: to purchase more clothes and expand her trading business

loans.name: Arzykan

texts.ru: Арзыкан 34 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Арзыкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Арзыкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 30 овец и 6 коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 20,000 сом -25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Арзыкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Арзыкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Arzykan is 34, married, and the mother of four children. She has a high school education and raises livestock as the main source of income for her family. She started fourteen years ago when she bought livestock for 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she currently has 30 sheep and six cows. Her monthly income is between 20,000-25,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her farm, Arzykan applied for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows and increase her number of livestock. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Mirian Ondina

texts.es: Mirian, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en relación de unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos, y reside en un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Mirian lleva 6 años de dedicarse a vender ropa de forma ambulante, vende camisas, blusas, jeans, ropa de cama, cortinas, y también zapatos por pedidos. Además tiene la administración de una cafetería de la escuela. Ha obtenido varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el séptimo ciclo que es por 15,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio de cafetería con productos como churros, galletas, insumos para venta de comidas, refrescos y dulces. Tiene como meta seguir creciendo con el negocio y mantenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en: Mirian is 34 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she has 2 children. She lives in a sector of the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Mirian has 6 years of experience working as a mobile vendor selling clothing. She sells shirts, blouses, jeans, bed linens, curtains, and also shoes by special order. She also manages a school cafeteria. She has obtained various loans, and currently she is requesting her seventh loan cycle, for 15,000 lempiras, to stock her cafeteria business with products such as churros, cookies, soft drinks, sweets, and supplies for selling meals. Her goal is to continue growing with her business and to keep it well-stocked.

loans.use: to stock her cafeteria business with products such as churros, cookies, soft drinks, sweets, and supplies for selling meals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase amount of new goods and items to strengthen her clothes, incense and perfume business.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en:
Anelia is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. Anelia is engaged in manicure and pedicure services. She also earns a living through hairstyling. She has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is her source of living. 

Anelia is asking for a loan to buy materials like nail polish, nail cutter, acetone, polish remover, brush, hair coloring and scissors among others. This loan will enable her to cater for more customers thus augmenting her income. In the future, Anelia has hopes of making her business more profitable. She also wants to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy materials like nail polish, nail cutter, acetone, polish remover, brush, hair coloring and scissors among others

loans.name: Los Cocos Group

texts.es:
Oculto por cañales, a orillas del cerro y sobre la carretera principal se encuentra el barrio donde se formó un grupo llamado Los Cocos nombre que eligieron por las características del fruto que está en alto, es de gran utilidad y del gusto de muchos. 

El grupo está integrado por 7 mujeres trabajadoras, comprometidas consigo mismas y con su familia por quienes día a día realizan sus actividades de la mejor manera probable. Ellas y sus actividades son:

María -Calzado Por Catalogo 
Carolina, Isabel - Ropa
Teresa - Pollo
Laura -Dulces
Marcelina -Carne De Puerco 
Petra -Abarrotes 

Doña Petra es una gran mujer, es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 4 son menores de edad. La situación económica, el incremento de los gastos y la falta de empleo para personas sin estudios fue lo que la motivó a iniciar una actividad, por ello desde hace ya 4 años abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su hogar, lo que además le permite pasar suficiente tiempo con su familia. "Lo mejor de mi tienda es que obtengo ingresos con los cuales apoyo a mi esposo con los gastos y juntos brindamos una mejor calidad de vida”.

Un poco triste, Petra comentó que hace dos años los ingresos en su tienda se vieron afectados pues en la contra esquina de su casa abrieron otro establecimiento igual. Ella pensó que sería el fin de su negocio, pero se dio cuenta que su buen trato a las personas podría hacer la diferencia y siguió recibiendo a sus clientes de la mejor manera. Para mantener un buen número de productos, Petra necesita invertir en azúcar, arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, café, leche, queso, galletas y detergente.

“Me invitaron al grupo y no lo pensé, sé que el préstamo otorgado me beneficiará incrementando la mercancía y las ganancias lo cual significa un gran cambio, gracias a cada uno de los que hacen posible el préstamo.”

*La fotografía fue tomada en una de las calles del barrio. A lo lejos se observan los árboles y el cerro que dan color e identidad al lugar. Doña Petra viste una blusa rosa, falda vino y suéter gris.
texts.en:
Hidden behind cane plants, at the base of the hill and along the main highway lies the neighborhood where the group called "Los Cocos" ["The Coconuts"] was formed. The members chose the name because of the characteristics of this fruit: it is high up, it is extremely useful, and many people enjoy it. 

The group is made up of 7 hard-working women who are committed to themselves and their families, for whom they work day after day to the best of their abilities. The members and their activities are: 

María - shoes by catalog
Carolina, Isabel - clothing
Teresa - chicken
Laura - sweets
Marcelina - pork  
Petra - groceries

Petra is an outstanding woman, the mother of 6 children, of whom 4 are minors. Her economic situation, rising expenses, and the lack of jobs for people without higher education were the factors that motivated her to start a business. Because of this, four years ago she opened a small grocery store, which is located in her home. In addition, it lets her spend enough time with her family. "The best thing about my store is that I obtain income with which I help my husband with the expenses, and together we provide a better quality of life." 

A little sadly, Petra comments that for the past two years her income from the store has been affected by the opening of a similar store on the corner across from her house. She thought that this would be the end of her business, but she noticed that her excellent customer service could make the difference, and she continued welcoming customers in the same way. To maintain a good stock of products, Petra needs to invest in sugar, rice, beans, oil, soups, coffee, milk, cheese, cookies and detergent. 

“They invited me to the group and I didn't think twice about it. I know that the loan provided will benefit me, expanding my merchandise and my profits, which will mean a great opportunity. Thank you to each one of those who have made this loan possible." 

*The photo was taken in one of the streets of the neighborhood. In the background one can see the trees and the hill which give color and identity to this place. Petra is wearing a pink blouse, dark red skirt and gray sweater.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, soups, coffee, milk, cheese, cookies and detergent to stock her store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old married man who has worked in his auto repair shop for four years to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He is an ambitious man and hard worker who has a good reputation among his customers.

Today, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through buying necessary car wheels which will facilitate his business and provide his customers' with better quick service.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to develop his business through buying necessary car wheels.

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del estado de Veracruz donde la actividad principal es la producción de caña, se consolidó un grupo de personas para solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México para mejorar cad auno de sus negocios:

Dianey,  María De Jesús -Calzado
Alicia -Oro Laminado
Ana -Artesanías 
María -Ropa
Guadalupe -Abarrotes
María De La Luz,  Agustina -Comida
Natividad,  Alicia -Antojitos
Yanet -Cosméticos
Policarpio - Refrescos 

Doña Agustina es una mujer de carácter fuerte, desde hace 30 años se ha dedicado a vender comida, inició con un local de lámina donde el gusto por la cocina comenzó a rendir frutos. La idea de hacer un negocio surgió a partir de la comida que enviaba a su esposo que trabajaba y quien a veces compartía el almuerzo con sus compañeros que siempre elogiaban los alimentos. 

Agustina se siente feliz de poder ayudara a su esposo gracias a su ingreso. Asimismo ha podido construir un pequeño restaurante donde ahora brinda servicio de lunes a domingo hasta las 8 pm y que da empleo a tres personas más. El nuevo préstamo que solicita a VisionFund México quiere emplearlo para comprar más mesas y sillas y cambiar las que ya están deterioradas. 

Los clientes potenciales de doña Agustina son los obreros, los traileros y los que acarrean la caña a la fábrica de azúcar de la región. "No sé qué será de mí el día que deje de vender y de pasar tiempo en el negocio que me ha dado tanto". A Agustina le gustaría que su hija de continuidad al negocio que está construyendo como patrimonio para ella. 

Agustina agradece la confianza brindada a través del préstamo y la productividad que ha obtenido con este apoyo.

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa donde se reunirá el grupo para cada uno de sus pagos. Doña Agustina viste falda color rosa y blusa negra con rosa y blanco, la fotografía fue tomada de noche pues durante el día cada uno de los integrantes se encuentra ocupado con sus actividades.
texts.en:
In a community in the state of Veracruz where the main business is the production of sugar a group of people got together to request a loan from Vision Fund Mexico to improves each of their businesses.

Dianey, María De Jesús - Footwear
Alicia - Gold laminate
Ana - Handicrafts
María - Clothing
Guadalupe - groceries
María De La Luz, Agustina - Food
Natividad, Alicia - Snacks
Yanet - Cosmetics
Policarpio - Soft drinks

Agustina is a woman of strong character. For 30 years she has been selling food. She started in a laminated stall where her love for food started to pay dividends. The idea to open a business came from her making food for her husband to take to work. He sometimes shared his meal with his workmates who always praised the food.

Agustina feels proud of being able to help her husband thanks to her income. Thus she has been able to construct a small restaurant where she offers service from Monday to Sunday until 8 pm and where she employs 3 people. This new loan that she has requested from VisionFund México she wants to use buying more chairs and tables to replace the ones that are in poor condition.

The possible clients for Agustina are the workers the drivers and those that transport the sugar to the mills in the region. "I don't know what would happen to me the day I stop selling and spending my time in the business that has given me so much." Agustina would like her daughter to continue the business that she is building as an inheritance.

Agustina is grateful for the confidence offered with the loan and the productivity that she has obtained from this support. The photograph was taken in front of the house where the group meets for it's payments. Agustina is wearing a pink skirt and a black blouses with pink and white on it. The photo was taken at night as during the day all the members are busy at work.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 30-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda, with two children. He used the previous loan to buy more sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell. 

Simon has been operating a retail shop, selling produce, and farming since 2009 to fight poverty. Simon hopes for his business growth since he is hardworking despite the challenges of competition. 

He is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a humble and hard-working farmer who has the energy and pluck that distinguish the men and women of the countryside. He is a man with an enterprising mind who since he was small learned all the activities in the fields like crops and raising animals.

Today, this humble man sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. He is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge he has on farming, he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. Dairy farming is close to his heart and every day he wakes up to milk his cow and that makes him very proud. 

Although he makes profits through milk selling, he lacks a chaff cutter. He is requesting a loan to buy a chaff cutter. Through the loan, he will be able to buy a chaff cutter which is a mechanical device used in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage for better feeding of the cow. The chaff cutter also prevents the animals from rejecting any part of the food. Being a small scale farmer and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Peter feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising people like him.  Peter believes that through this loan his living conditions will change.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic location and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 42 years old, is married with three children. She is a rural farmer but has also been selling women's clothes for about a year. This activity constitutes an additional source of income for her family. Her husband helps her to run the business, especially the shopping bit. 

Her store has a turnover of 250,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings). At the moment, Mary makes a monthly income of about 350,000 UGX from her activity. 

In order to further grow her business, she has turned to UGAFODE Microfinance for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX, which will be used to increase her inventory and also meet her customers' needs. 

Mary is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her activity. She is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He is a farmer and earns additional income from selling produce like rice. He hopes to expand his coffee plantation and out-compete all the traders around his area. His vision is hindered by bad weather that affects the produce from his farm.

He needs a loan to buy more fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise them and resell them.

loans.name: Grupo Agrícola Caserio Xexac 4 Group

texts.es:
María es una señora de 35 años, ella es casada tiene un hijo de 8 años, él estudia en la escuelita de su comunidad, esta pequeña familia vive en una comunidad llamado Xexac. 

María (La primera de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) es una  mujer muy trabajadora, le encanta esta actividad que heredo de sus padres y ella se siente útil a su  comunidad, María ahora para generar sus ingresos económicos,  se dedica a la venta de bananos, ella  selecciono esta actividad ya en el lugar donde María vive se produce mucho banano. María además de ser vendedora de bananos, ella también siembra y cosecha bananos  porque el  lugar  donde ella proviene es cálido  y es conocido como  la tierra de  las frutas.  
 
Pues para que María puede tener buenas cosechas, es necesario darle mantenimiento a la siembra, es por eso que ella solicita un prestamo para que pueda comprar insumos  y pagar la mano de obra necesario,  este prestamo que María solicita será un prestamo grupal, la ventaja es que  todos apoyan en buscar la garantía y María concluye que los prestamos grupales es una forma de buscar el bien común 
La aspiración de María es que con las ganancias pueda comprar más semillas y seguir ampliando las plantaciones de banano.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, married, and has an 8 year old son that studies in the small school in their community.  This small family lives in a community named Xexac.

Maria (the first from left to right in this picture) is a very hardworking woman and she loves the activity that she inherited from her parents and she feels useful in her community. In order to generate earnings, Maria now dedicates herself to the sale of bananas.  She selected this activity because where she lives produces many bananas.  In addition to selling bananas, she also plants and harvests bananas because the place she comes from is warm and is known as the land of the fruits.  

In order for Maria to have a good harvest, it's necessary to provide maintenance to the seeds.  It's for this reason she requests a loan so that she can buy supplies and pay the necessary labor costs.  This loan that Maria requests will be a group loan.  The advantage is that everyone supports each other in seeking security.  Maria concludes that group loans are a form of seeking the common good.  

Maria's aspiration is that with her earnings she can buy more seeds and continue increasing her banana plantations.

loans.use: maintain their banana cultivation.

loans.name: Valerian

texts.en:
Valerian is a 32-year-old married man from the village Kvirike. He has a wife, three children and parents who get an age pension from the local government. In addition to this income, the family has a small agricultural activity. However, they use the products only for feeding the family.

As the existing income is not enough for a seven-member family, and Valerian can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, he applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva permitting the rural poor to start or restart businesses. 

He plans to install gas equipment that will have lower costs and will work on a bus line. He will serve local people and will generate significant income for his family's welfare. 

Valerian and his family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be really grateful, as their financial condition will significantly increase from the regards of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to install gas in his mini-bus and work on a bus line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her first- and second-hand clothing shop.

loans.name: Los Trapiches Group

texts.es:
Más que un grupo, los integrantes de Los Trapiches se consideran una familia aunque no todos compartan un lazo sanguíneo. El conocerse por más de 20 años y ser buenos vecinos los ha llevado a integrarse en un grupo para solicitar préstamos en VisionFund México con los cuales han mejorado poco a poco con sus negocios y con las ganancias pueden ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Los integrantes y sus actividades son:

Hortencia, Diana - Ropa 
Claudia - Pan
Petra, Rocio, Gabina - Calzado
Alberto - Albañilería
Guadalupe - Cosméticos 

Recorrer las calles de la comunidad, visitar a sus clientes y entregar sus pedidos de cosméticos mientras sus hijos están en la escuela, es lo que hace Guadalupe desde hace 3 años. La actividad comenzó gracias a la recomendación de una de sus amigas quien le presentó a la encargada de ventas de la compañía de la zona. Este es el primer préstamo que Guadalupe solicita y empleará el dinero principalmente para comprar perfumes. 

Lupe, como mejor la conocen en la comunidad, utiliza sus ganancias para comprar más productos y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que hay 6 integrantes en su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es que la empresa siempre las motiva y reconoce por sus esfuerzos, ella ya ha obtenido varios premios por alcanzar sus metas de venta.

“Mientras más invierto más gano. Gracias al grupo por invitarme a formar parte de su familia y a quienes hacen posible que nos den préstamos a personas trabajadoras como nosotros”

*En la imagen: los integrantes reunidos en el patio de la casa de Alberto. Guadalupe tiene en brazos a su hijo más pequeño.
texts.en:
More than a group, the members of the "Los Trapiches" communal bank consider each other family, even though they aren't blood related.  Knowing each other for more than twenty years and being good neighbors brought them together to request loans from VisionFund México.  With the loans, they have improved their businesses little by little, and with their earnings they are able to offer their families better qualities of life.  The communal bank members are their businesses are:

Hortencia, Diana - Clothing 
Claudia - Bread
Petra, Rocio, Gabina - Footwear
Alberto - Bricklaying
Guadalupe - Cosmetics 

For the last three years, while her children are in school, Guadalupe has been traveling all around the streets of her community visiting her customers and delivering their cosmetic orders.  She started her business with the recommendation of one of her friends, who introduced her to the company employee in charge of deliveries in their area.  This is the first loan that Guadalupe has requested, and she will use the money primarily to purchase perfumes. 

Lupe, as she is known in her community, uses her earnings to purchase more products to sell and to help her husband with the household expenses, as there are six people in her family.  What she likes most about her business is that the company motivates them and recognizes their efforts.  She has earned various prizes for meeting her sales goals. 

“The more I invest, the more I earn.  I am grateful to the communal bank for inviting me to be a part of their family.  I am also grateful to those who make the loan available to hard-working people like us.”

*In the above photo, the communal bank members are pictured in Alberto's patio. Guadalupe is carrying her youngest son in her arms.

loans.use: to purchase perfume.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 28-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. Fishing is their main source of income.

Aida is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. A loan will help them improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Aida hopes to make their fishing business a success.  Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Jhonfre

texts.es:
Jhonfre es un alegre, carismático personaje de 29 años de edad, su personalidad atrae muchos clientes pues tiene esa chispa que encanta a las personas, se dedica al negocio de venta de comidas rápidas como papas a la francesa, hamburguesas, salchichas, chorizos, entre otros.
Es padre de una pequeña de 12 años de edad y sueña con poder ser suficiente para que ella estudie y tenga lo suficiente para formarse en la vida.
En su negocio se ve como un empresario rodeado de empleados y mucho trabajo que le permita mejorar sus ventas, tener más clientes, mayores ingresos y en pocas palabras mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Jhonfre solicita un crédito para la compra de sillas, mesas,  y un congelador, la razón es que quiere brindarles un espacio amigable para que consuman sus alimentos y el refrigerador para almacenar bebidas e insumos que necesitan refigeración.
texts.en:
Jhonfre is a cheerful, charismatic 29 year old.  His personality attracts many clients.  He has a spark that charms people.  He dedicates himself to the sale of fast food such as french fries, hamburgers, hot dogs, sausages, and other things.

He is father to a 12 year old girl and he dreams to be able to support her so that she can study and have everything she needs to grow in life.  In his business he sees himself as an entrepreneur surrounded by employees and a lot of work that permits him to increase his sales, have more clients, better earnings, and in a few words, improve his quality of life.

Jhonfre requests a loan to buy chairs, tables, and a freezer.  The reason for this request is that he hopes to provide a friendly atmosphere to his customers who consume food and the refrigerator to store drinks and supplies that need refrigeration.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, and a freezer.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 45 years old, married, and has been blessed with a beautiful family. He is a farmer from Kiamuthambi village, situated in the central province of Kenya. He is dedicated to his work and only thinks about going forward and delivering good products. He knows that many people consume his products, and because of this, he is determined that his products are pure and of good quality.

Patrick lives on a small piece of land where he keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops, which he has been doing for 10 years. His primary sources of income are milk and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs.  Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases.

Patrick joined Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Patrick requested a loan, which he will use to expand his horticulture farm. This loan will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output.

The additional income from the expansion will go toward his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, children are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With this loan, Patrick's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their future.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Doña Susana, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al sector Naco, Santa Barbara cerca de Cofradía y le acompaña uno de sus hijos. Ella trabajó por varios años en una maquila para obtener  ingresos, pero hace 10 años decidió poner su propio negocio y estableció una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, manteca, productos de aseo, churros, refrescos, condimentos etc.  Con el fin de mantener productos para la venta a decidido solicitar un prestamo por 10,000 Lempiras, con los cuales comprara granos básicos, refrescos, churros, carnes, lácteos para tener siempre que ofrecer a sus clientes y poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. En el futuro ella piensa tener su negocio amplio y más surtido.
texts.en: Susana is 55 years old, a single mom, and has three children.  She resides in a village that pertains to the Naco Sector, Santa Barbara close to Cofradía and one of her sons lives with her.  She worked for many years in sewing assembly in order to make money, but 10 years ago she decided to start her own store.  She established a small grocery store where she sells grains, butter, toiletries, traditional baked goods, sodas, spices, etc.  With the goal of maintaining her store, she has decided to request a loan of 10,000 Lempiras, with which she will buy grains, sodas, traditional baked goods, meats and dairy so that she will always be able to offer these items to her clients and so she can be able to increase her sales and earnings.  In the future she hopes to amplify her business and have more assortment.

loans.use: to purchase grains, sodas, traditional baked goods, meats, dairy and other items to sell.

loans.name: Chuisequec Group

texts.en:
The beautiful agricultural town of Concepcion rests in a valley between the hills overlooking the incredible Lake Atitlan. The cobbled streets of Concepcion are lined with expertly planted fields of onions, beans, carrots, cabbage, corn and chamomile. Families work together harvesting and preparing vegetables and fruits that are shipped and sold all over the western half of the country. Nine hardworking women of Concepcion make up the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chuisequec.” 

“Chuisequec” is applying for their second KIVA funded group loan, after a successful loan period in 2014. With the harvest season underway for many of the regions crops and replanting season rapidly approaching, these small loans are very important for the livelihoods of the women and their families. Irma, a twenty-one-year-old mother of two children, is one of the youngest members of the group.  Irma is applying for her second loan with Friendship Bridge to maintain and grow her business selling fruits. Irma buys fresh, locally grown fruits from small farmers in Concepcion, and travels daily to the capital, over three hours away to sell delicious watermelon, mango, pineapple and oranges. With this loan, Irma will have the ability to buy more fruit and expand her daily inventory to compete with other venders. Irma works extremely hard to improve and grow her business and subsequently the quality of life of her two young children. Irma hopes that as she gains more knowledge about managing a small business, through the monthly educational training led by her Friendship Bridge loan officer, and experience from her daily fruit sales, she will be able to create a more profitable business. As her children grow older she hopes to support them through school, in order to give them the opportunity to receive a full education. 
Thanks to KIVA investors, Irma will have the chance to continue to grow as an entrepreneur and work towards the goal of improving the quality of life of her family. Thank you KIVA investors for your continued support of Irma and the rest of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chuisequec.”

loans.use: To buy fresh watermelon, pineapple, mango and oranges.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 36-year-old married mother with of child, who has been selling vinyl plastic table covers and clothes for seven years. She helps her husband in making their living and covering expenses. She sells her products at home to neighbors, relatives and friends.
 
Linda is working hard to develop her business, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes to satisfy her customers' needs on both Valentine's and Mother's Day. 

Linda hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes for both Valentine's and Mother's Day

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. 

Arsenia has operated her store for more than 13 years now.  She is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, bread and biscuits, rice, toiletries, soap and detergents among others. Arsenia believes that a loan will help her improve her inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Arsenia hopes of making her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, bread and biscuits, rice, toiletries, soap and detergents among others

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 51 years old, single and lives in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. To earn a living, Merly has worked as a day care worker in their tutorial school. Merly wants to repair her house for a decent and comfortable living. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase plywood, nails, sticks and nipa thatch for her house. Merly is an active member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, sticks and nipa thatch for her house

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ella es Fanny es una mujer muy trabajadora, demasiado humilde que vive en un hogar, construido entre latas, madera, y cartón, es madre de 3 hijos y separada de su esposo, no cuenta con ayuda, a sus 61 solo cuenta con su negocio de venta de alimentos que realiza desde la cocina de su casa, aprendió sola y adopto esta medida por pura necesidad económica. 
Sus mayores preocupaciones son la inseguridad en el sitio de trabajo y la falta de capital, pero sin embargo ella sigue en pie con su actividad pues gracias a esta puede disfrutas de una alimentación.
Fanny solicita que le ayuden prestándole un pequeño monto de capital para tener capital de trabajo que invertirá en la compra de insumos, utensilios y madera para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Fanny is a hardworking woman.  She is poor and lives in a home built of cans, wood and carton.  She is a mother of three children and separated from her husband.  She doesn't receive any help.  At 61 years old she relies only on her food business that she makes from the kitchen in her home.  She taught herself and adopted this method out of pure economic necessity.

Her biggest worries are the insecurity in the workplace and the lack of capital, however she continues to work and as a result of her efforts she is able to eat.

Fanny requests this loan for a small amount of capital so she can invert it into the purchase of supplies, utensils and wood in order to make her foods.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, utensils and wood to prepare her foods.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is hardworking and industrious father, He is a fisherman. His catch is sold to the public market and he earns a meager income. This is how he supports his family with seven children and their education. He became a member of PMPC and appreciates the various programs and services that the co-op offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent and comfortable house, for which he applied for a loan of PHP45,000 to purchase bags of cement, sand and gravel to renovate and expand his house with the help and support of his children, who have their own jobs. Samuel was thankful, when all his financing needs were supported by Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, sand and gravel to renovate and expand his house

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is a client of Kubo Financiero (Kiva's partner). He is 27 years old, married, and the father of two. He has been in business for thirteen years. He works with his father and brother in the family business manufacturing and selling many varieties of socks for babies. The family recently bought machinery that will enable them to handle bigger production loads. Ivan is asking for a loan to buy the materials needed to manufacture more socks using the new machinery. Thanks to the effort he puts into his job, Ivan has been able to buy a car, make his business larger, and provide a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To purchase material for manufacturing socks

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: Dionesio, a widower, makes a good living on his coconut farm in Burgos, Aloran in the Philippines. This is his means of supporting his family. Dionesio has been able to provide his children a good education. Dionesio pawned his 2-hectare cocoland when his children entered college to pay for college fees. Now, he wishes to pay for the acquisition of his pawned cocoland with a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (Kiva's partner). Dionesio has high hopes that he will have a high yield on his farm next quarter.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of his pawned cocoland

loans.name: Richard Kwasi

texts.en:
Richard is a third year student at Radford University College, and he is pursuing a Bachelor of Science program, hoping to become a physician assistant in the future. “The loan facility is to help pay for my school fees."
 
He chose this career path because it is a noble profession. The completion of his education is going to help him support his younger siblings and the entire family financially.  A friend of his who is a medical officer in the army inspires him a lot because of his level of professionalism.

He sees himself as a medical specialist in the near future and the only way to achieve that is through education. The pursuit of his education would also give him the needed skills to realize his dreams and work as a professional.

Without the support of this loan, there would have been no other means of completing his education.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy water and a poly tank to store water to sell during periods of water shortages

loans.name: Emelia Naa Chicher

texts.en:
Emelia is a third year student at the Radford University College, pursuing a Bachelor of Science program to become a Physician Assistant. The loan facility is to help pay for her school fees. The completion of her studies would enable her to deliver better service to the sick and save lives. This skill would also help reduce the mortality rate in the country.

Specialists in the various health centers inspire her, most especially seeing them save lives and treat people from their infirmities. In the next five to ten years she would be practicing her profession in one of the private or government health facilities.

But for this loan, she would be withdrawn from school by the school authorities and would have to solicit for funds or work until she gets enough funds to further her education, or stop schooling in its entirety.

“Students in my community are struggling with payment of their tuition fees, but with the help from investors, payment of our tuition fees becomes more flexible to see us through to the end,” she added.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo a sus 39 años de edad propietario de un hermoso campo de flores, que es su actividad principal la cual exporta y vende a moneda extranjera, es una actividad de mucho cuidado, amor, y paciencia. 
Uno de los puntos en contra de esta actividad es el alto costo de los insumos para mantener estos cultivos, pues tiene muchos depredadores, parásitos, clima muchos factores en contra que pueden afectar los cultivos. 
El trabajo de Leonardo es entregar a su proveedor un producto excelente, desparasitado, fresco y hermoso.
Para lograr este trabajo necesita de muchos insumos y en épocas de cosechas no cuenta con mucho capital, por eso quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar abonos, para abonar valga la redundancia todo sus cultivos.
texts.en:
At 39 years of age Leonardo is owner of a beautiful field of flowers.  This is his primary activity which he exports and sells in foreign currency.  It's an activity that requires much care, love, and patience.

One of the points working against him is the high cost of supplies to maintain the crops because they have many predators and parasites.  The weather is also a factor.  There are many factors that can affect the crops.

Leonardo's work is to give the provider an excellent product that is dewormed, fresh, and beautiful.  In order to obtain this he needs many supplies and in harvest season he does not have much capital, therefore he requests this loan to purchase compost to fertilize his crops.

loans.use: to purchase compost to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Grupo Agricola Las Palmas Guineales Group

texts.es:
Manuela es destacada en su comunidad como una mujer amable  y responsable, ella tiene 38 años tiene 4 hijos dos de ellos son profesionales, uno trabaja fuera de la comunidad y la última está estudiando, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Guineales. 

Manuela (la primera de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) es muy disciplinada en su  trabajo, es una mujer que es muy introvertida pero ha logrado superación en la vida, pues ella realiza varias actividades para la generación de su economía, ella cultiva café y banano, es tejedora y  también se dedica al bordado de güipiles, son varias las actividades que ella realiza ella dice que es afortunada. 

Con los ingresos  ella ha alcanzado cubrir otras necesidades en beneficio de su familia, como por ejemplo el empezar a construir su casa y apoyar a sus hijos en la educación, pues Manuela se siente feliz porque va logrando prosperidad con su familia.  Pues esta vez Manuela necesita de un  prestamo que le servirá para el mantenimiento del cultivo de café, ya que tiene que comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra en los trabajos del café para que pueda dar buena cosecha. 
Manuela para este prestamo lo hará grupal ya el crédito grupal es accesible en ADICLA porque tienen un  programa agrícola y el pago se realiza al vencimiento del crédito, esto viene a favorecer a nosotros los agricultores. 
Los sueños de Manuela es terminar de construir su casa y comprar más lotes de terreno para seguir sembrando café.
texts.en: Manuela (on the far left in the photograph) is well-known in her community for being such a pleasant and responsible individual. She is 38 years old and has 4 children: 2 of whom are working professionally, one more works outside of their community and her youngest is still studying. She and her family live in a community in Guineales. Manuela is very disciplined in her work and is a shy lady who has managed to overcome life's difficulties. She is involved in various activities which allow her to generate an income: she grows coffee and bananas, she works with textiles and she embroiders güipiles, traditional Guatemalan ladies' blouses. She believes that she is very lucky to have such a range of activities. Manuela uses her income to pay for her family's needs, such as starting a project to build their own home and supporting her children while they are at school and, consequently, she is happy because her and her family are beginning to prosper. This time, Manuela needs a loan to help her to maintain her coffee plants as she has to buy supplies and pay labour costs so that she can reap a good coffee harvest. Manuela will be applying for this loan as part of her communal bank group as ADICLA permits group loans due to their farming program, and the repayments will be made once the loan has been used; this is a favourable arrangement for farmers. Manuela's dream is to finish building her home and to buy more plots of land so that she can contintue to grow coffee.

loans.use: to maintain her coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 16-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita lives in Sindangan, Philippines. She is married and has five beautiful children. To earn a living, Nenita manages her rice farm and raises hogs. Since she has been doing this for many years, she is a master at her job. Nenita joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to access insurance and credit. She is hardworking and determined to pursue her goals in order to sustain her needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm. She also plans to purchase additional piglets, animal feed, and vitamins. This will greatly help her boost her income. Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of land to expand her rice farming activities and venture into the rice-retailing business. She deeply wishes to see all her children finish their studies and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm and to pay for additional piglets, animal feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Efinita

texts.en:
Efinita is from Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old and is single. Efinita is earning a living in her snack vending business. To generate more income, Efinita decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. 

Consequently, she requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for the snacks that she sells. She also accepts orders for additional earnings. 

Someday, she hopes to extend help and support to her nephews and nieces in their education, for them to earn a degree in college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for the snacks that she sells

loans.name: Narcissa

texts.en:
Narcissa makes good earning on her farm in Oroquieta. This is the primary means of their income, supporting their needs.

She wants to increase her farm yield, so Narcissa approached Paglaum to loan her an amount to purchase fertilizer and compost for the fruit-bearing trees on her farm.

She has high hopes that she will have good produce next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for her fruit-bearing trees on her farm.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: Crispina is earning an income from cropping her coconut farm in Banisilon, Aloran in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her needs. She has been widowed for 12 years. Now, she wishes to plant bananas of a good variety on the coconut farm for additional farm yield. However, Crispina is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP in order to pay for the labor to plant the banana seedlings. Crispina has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality crop yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to plant banana seedlings

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is a Mexican dairy farmer; she produces cheese from her cows' milk, which she sells in her community. She also cultivates alfalfa to feed her cows, but used to apply expensive and unsustainable chemical fertilizers to sustain the production.

As she starts using her biodigester, she will be able to close the natural cycle on her farm and become more self-sufficient, while protecting the environment. Indeed, by inputting her cows' manure in the biodigester, the bacteria will produce a nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer that she will in turn apply on her field to nourish the soils and increase her crops' yield in a natural way.

In addition, the biodigester also produces biogas, which will be directly connected to the cookstove and boiler in the house, making fossil fuel-based LP gas irrelevant. As Evelia displaces these expensive external inputs and her productivity increases, she will save money she plans to reinvest in the expansion of her cheese production. She would like to buy more cows and a large boiler to become more efficient in the production process. As she continues to save money, her goal is to be able to send all her children to university.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 12-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa owns cows and a few hogs. She dedicates herself to producing cheese from her cows' milk, and also cultivates corn to produce their forage.

She used to pile up her animals' waste outside her farm, where it was emitting greenhouse gases and contaminating underground water sources, while also attracting flies and generating bad smells. She realized she was contaminating her direct environment, and decided to invest in a biodigester to treat her animals' manure and take advantage of it to produce her own biogas and organic fertilizer.

Her own production of renewable energy and biofertilizer will allow her to displace LP gas and chemical fertilizers while protecting the environment. She will also eliminate wood from her household, as she will cook and heat water using biogas, and therefore no longer inhale the toxic smoke while she is cooking, leading to important health benefits.

With her savings, Maria Luisa plans to buy more cows to increase her cheese production, as well as a milking machine.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 12-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a small Mexican farmer. He owns hogs and poultry and cultivates corn as well as kidney beans. However, the operating expenses, such as LP gas and chemical fertilizer, place a significant financial burden on his activities. This is why he is complementing his income from the farm by working in a store in his community.

By investing in a biodigester, he will be able to significantly reduce these expenses, since he will transform his animals' manure into a productive resource to produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer, allowing him to displace LP gas and chemical fertilizer. The yield of his crops will increase as he applies the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer on his soils, while he will cook with biogas instead of wood fuel and biogas.

In addition to the economic benefits, his farm will become more sustainable, as the untreated waste will not emit greenhouse gases any more, nor contaminate underground water sources. Fossil fuels will become irrelevant for the production of food and overall activities on the farm.

With his savings, Alberto plans to buy more animals. He is particularly interested in buying calves to diversify his livestock.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.en:
Fredy is 39 years old. He is divorced and has one son whom he supports. He lives in his parents’ house and has a printing workshop in which he produces advertising materials for different clients.

He is asking for a loan because he needs to buy supplies to deliver a contract for a local politician who is running a campaign.

Fredy says that he started the business in 1995, almost twenty years ago. His brother taught him, and then they decided to join forces. His biggest accomplishment is working in something that he enjoys very much.

loans.use: to buy supplies to deliver a contract for a local political campaign.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose was fortunate to receive the needed capital when he joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in 2009. He is married and lives in Pines, Oroquieta. 

Jose knew this would be his last opportunity to get back on his feet when he failed after his first business went bad. PMPC came to Jose's rescue by lending him money when he badly needed it. 

Now, Jose has availed himself of another loan for this quarter's cropping. He borrowed an amount to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicide, to maximize his farm production and be able to generate more income. 

Jose perseveres and always believes he can reach his goals to abundantly provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Jonis

texts.en:
Jonis is 31 years old and married. The family lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. 

For the past two years, Jonis has been a farmer. He earns PHP 3,500 each month and is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). 

Jonis is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan to purchase fertilizer. 

In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Samdankhorol

texts.en:
Mr. Samdankhorol, 49 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2009. His wife teaches at kindergarten. Their sons study at the university. 

Samdankhorol is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy a bed and closet for an upcoming national festival. Every person in Mongolia buys something new for the national holiday as a means of welcoming in the new year. 

The borrower used his previous loan to buy a natural gas car in order to provide a job for his son.

loans.use: to buy a closet and bed.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, a widow, is 53 years old. She resides in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, in the Philippines. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative on August 31, 2010 in order to access the cooperative's programs and services. 

Recently, Melanie has requested her 4th loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP as additional working capital for her business. She plans to buy a variety of commodities which will be used to make food products to sell in her local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities to make food products to sell.

loans.name: Rose May

texts.en:
Rose May is from Aloran, in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. 

Rose May makes it a point to have good land preparation, to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently applied a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to pay for holing and planting more cassava seedlings on her land. 

She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply cassava in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for holing and planting more cassava seedlings on her land.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason has broad experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring, and harvesting, as well as earning income from his harvests. 

Jason is a widow and has supported his children doing this type of work. As a farmer, Jason has nurtured his membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has maintained a good repayment record. He knows he can always turn to the Cooperative for his financial needs. 

Recently, Jason applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and rice seed that will grow healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yield seedlings. 

Someday, Jason hopes to purchase another parcel of agricultural land to cultivate which will potentially earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed that will grow healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yield seedlings.

loans.name: Bemarie

texts.en: Bemarie signed up as a member of PMPC to obtain the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital made available to a small-time borrower like her. Bemarie was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with more basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with more basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vulcanizing and personal products retail businesses. Judith is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra works hard to support her family. Alejandra is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Alejandra requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, flour, fish, and spices for her business.

Alejandra has been in this business for 26 years now and earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, flour, fish, and spices for her food-vending business

loans.name: Bonita

texts.en:
Bonita is a 30-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Bonita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Bonita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Bonita has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is a 38-year-old single mother of five children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Chita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Chita requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Chita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 27 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 6 años, y una hija de 8 años y su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio.
Ella es emprendedora, trabajadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio que está ubicado en la zona ‘villa nueva candelaria’ de la ciudad, un área residencial de calle de arena, dónde no existe transporte publico y se debe entrar caminando, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-10 grados centígrados.
Elena es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla mayormente en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza.  Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como ayudante de chofer interdepartamental y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas domiciliario. Su actividad principal es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, refrescos, etc., también tiene una congeladora donde guarda carne, su labor la realiza durante toda la semana y durante todo el día. “vendo toda clases de alimentos de primera necesidad, ahora amplié mi negocio y vendo carne también…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un mini-mercado en su propio domicilio. Ella desea realizar una ampliación en su tienda comprando una sierra cortadora de carne para cortar con precisión. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de una sierra cortadora de carne para establecerse como carnicería.
texts.en:
Elena is a 27-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons, aged 10 and 6, and an 8-year-old daughter. Her business is operating a neighborhood store. 

She is enterprising, hard-working, reliable and responsible. She operates her business in her home, which is located in the Villa Nueva Candelaria neighborhood of the city. It is a residential area with streets of sand, where there is no public transportation and one has to enter the neighborhood on foot. The area has a cold and dry climate, with temperatures that vary between 0 and 10 degrees Centigrade during the day. 

Elena has brown skin and long black braided hair, and she is short in stature. Her native language is Aymará, which is the majority language in the place where she lives. She also speaks Spanish because of the overall culture and because of the trade she carries out. She shares her life with her husband, who works as an assistant long-distance driver, and with her children, who are in school. They live in a house of their own built of brick, with a roof of metal sheeting. The house has water, electricity, sewer and gas services. 

Elena's main work is a neighborhood store offering basic staple foods such as bread, sugar, rice, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. She also has a freezer where she keeps meat. She works all day, every day of the week. "I sell all kinds of basic staple foods, and now I have expanded my business and I also sell meat," she reports. Her dream is to have a mini-market in her own home. She wants to carry out an expansion of her store, buying a meat cutting saw so she can cut with precision. This is her first loan cycle in the two years that she has been carrying out this activity. 

For this reason, Elena is requesting a loan to buy a meat cutting saw in order to establish a butcher shop in her store.

loans.use: to buy a meat cutting saw to establish a butcher shop in her store.

loans.name: Michinie

texts.en: Michinie, 33, is single. She is living with her parents in Siquijor, Philippines. Michinie is managing her eatery business which has been doing well supporting her family's needs and helping to pay for her siblings' education. She has local customers and also accepts catering jobs for added income. Recently, she took out a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Ma. Tita

texts.en:
Ma. Tita is a 56-year-old widow with seven children, three still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Tita has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Ma. Tita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Tita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 43 years old and a widowed mother of four children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ailyn has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Ailyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like pants, blouses, school uniforms and other clothing.

Ailyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ailyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like pants, blouses, school uniforms and other clothing.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 39-year-old married mother of nine children, seven currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emily has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Emily has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a married mother of 3 children. She is 42 years old, and 2 of her children are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Lita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Milda

texts.en:
Milda is a 59-year-old married mother of nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Milda has a poultry business in the Philippines. Milda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Milda has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 37 years old and married with three children who are all in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenelyn has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 56 years old and a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nora has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Nora has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is is 45 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Esmeralda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fish to sell.

Esmeralda has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Maribel has been in this business for five years now and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre de 49 años de edad, soltero, con una hija mujer de 17 años, y su negocio es la producción de rompecabezas para niños.
El es emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ una área caracterizada por la feria los días jueves y domingos, donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser la ropa hasta un tractor para sembrar la tierra. De clima frío (4-12 grados centígrados) y rayos solares muy fuertes que pueden quemar la piel, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Hugo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que se estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la fabricación de rompecabezas. Labor que aprendió desde muy joven como ayudante de carpintero para luego independizarse; El proceso que llevan en el trabajo de confección de rompecabezas se realizan distintos procesos como: enviar a imprimir el motivo, troquelar el contorno, encuadernación y se embolsa. “nuestros rompecabezas son ideales para ser utilizados en jardines infantiles, son una alternativa económica, entretenida y de ayuda para fomentar la imaginación de los niños…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su taller y contratar operarios para administrar una empresa, Él desea realizar la compra por mayor de madera venesta para fabricar rompecabezas. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Hugo solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera venesta por mayor para fabricar rompecabezas para niños.
texts.en:
Hugo is an enterprising, single 49 year old man with a 17 year old daughter. His business is making jigsaw puzzles for kids. He's entrepreneurial, independent, dependable, responsible and hard-working. He runs his business in the "16 de Julio" area, an area known for its fairs on Thursdays and Sundays, where you can find anything from sewing needles to tractors for planting. The climate is cold (4-12 degrees centigrade) and has intense sunlight that can cause sunburns, with an average elevation of 3800 meters above sea level. 

Hugo has a dark complexion, short black hair, is short, his native language is Aymara and he speaks Spanish because of the overall culture and the business that he's involved in. He lives with his daughter who's attending school, and they reside in the family home that's made out of bricks and has potable water, electricity, and gas. His business is the production of jigsaw puzzles, a job that he learned as a carpenter's assistant and he then began working independently. The jigsaw production process is done in several stages, such as: sending the design to the printer, punching the outline, framing, and packaging. He states that "Our jigsaws are ideal for use in kindergartens, they're an alternative that's affordable, entertaining, and helpful for stimulating children's imagination". His dream is to expand his workshop and hire operators to manage the company. He wants to purchase plywood wholesale to make jigsaw puzzles. This is the fourth loan series he has engaged in with the institution in the 9 years that he has worked in this sector.

These are the reasons that Hugo is applying for a loan to purchase plywood wholesale to make jigsaw puzzles for kids.

loans.use: To purchase plywood wholesale to make jigsaw puzzles for kids.

loans.name: Allena

texts.en:
Allena is 55 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Allena is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Allena has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of 4 children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

Rosalinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling food and fattening pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. 

Rosalinda is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rosalinda hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 51 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a driver, and they have 4 children. One of their children is a high school student, another is working, while the rest are currently not attending school. She manages her household while also operating her business, which augments their income and helps support and meet their daily personal household needs.

Sonia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store selling fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are food and essential household items. She earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and her local community. She earns a minimum net income of 700 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, Sonia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy items such as canned goods, instant noodles, soda, and other groceries. She is positive that this loan will help boost her income as she expands her business. She thanks God and you in advance for both a good turnout of her business and the financial help that will be given her. She is sure it will help in their daily sustenance.

Sonia aims to maintain and grow her business so she will be able to have a better life. She prays for good health and love in her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married mother of 4 children. She is 46 years old, and 3 of her children are still in school. 

Regina is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Regina has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Regina would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Nasirdin

texts.ru: Насирдин, 55 лет, есть 2 детей. У него средне-специальное образование, работает мастером по вождению в автошколе, с 2005 года в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Насирдина, на данный момент в его хозяйстве имеется 5 коров, 18 овец. Для животных заготовлены сено и корма, на лето отгоняют на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насирдин обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nasirdin is 55 years old and has two children. He has a specialized secondary education and works as a foreman in a driving school. Since 2005, as an additionaly source of income for his family, he has been raising livestock and crops, having begun with 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to his hard work, Nasirdin currently has on his homestead five cows and 18 sheep. For the animals, he has prepared hay and feed and in the summer he will drive them to pasture. Monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing his business, Nasirdin applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep. He plans to invest income from the loan in further expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to increase his livestock headcount.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 41 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. Merlie works very hard to provide for them.

Merlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional inventory of groceries to sell.

Merlie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Merlie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of groceries to sell

loans.name: Pepitas De Cobre 27 Group

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 64 años de edad, casada sin hijos, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortas y pasteles.
Ella es independiente, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘1ro de Mayo’ un lugar caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población y del comercio en todas las áreas, sitio que agrupa a diferentes culturas y etnias del altiplano. Se encuentra a una altitud de 4.070 metros sobre el nivel del mar lo que la hace la segunda ciudad más alta del mundo. 
Blanca es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie la primera de la derecha, usa chamarra color beige y chompa negra). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se encarga del comercio, sus hijos son independientes y no viven con ellos, ella con su esposo viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas natural. La necesidad de expandir su negocio la impulsó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero, servicio de transporte, confección de polleras, tienda de videos, venta de salteñas, venta de vajillas y venta de celulares, para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortas y postres, negocio que comenzó desde su casa, haciendo una mínima inversión con la venta de alfajores, queques de vainilla y tortas de chocolates que llevan insumos fáciles de encontrar en el mercado, a medida que recuperaba su capital, invertía en la oferta de postres para el público. “a quién no le gusta una torta de chocolate o un queque de vainilla?, se puede comer a toda hora y lugar…” comenta. Su sueño es ahorrar para poder viajar a otros lugares alejados, ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de harina e insumos necesarios para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Blanca solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina y otros ingredientes por mayor para hornear variedades de tortas y queques.
texts.en:
