Blanca  is a 64 year old woman who's married, childless, and her business is baking and selling pastries and cakes. She's independent, generous, understanding, patient, responsible, and hard-working. She does her work in the "1ro de Mayo" area, a place known for the constant growth of its population and commerce in every sector. It's a location that brings together different cultures and ethnicities from the mountain plateaus. It's elevation is 4,070 meters above sea level, which makes it the city with the second highest elevation in the world. 

Blanca has a dark complexion, long black hair that she ties, dark eyes, and her native language is Aymara but she speaks spanish because of the overall culture and because of the business she's involved in (in the picture she's standing in the first spot on the right side, wearing a beige jacket and a black sweater). She lives with her husband who runs the business, her children are independent and don't live with them, and the house she lives in with her husband is built out of brick, with a corrugated iron roof, and has potable water, electricity, sewage service, and natural gas. 

The need to expand her business drove her to form a group of people that own businesses like selling quilts, making leather wallets, transportation services, making skirts, a video store, selling meat pies, selling silverware, and selling cell phones, to apply for a loan. Her business is baking and selling pastries and desserts, a business that she launched at home with a minimal investment by selling sandwich cookies, vanilla cakes, and chocolate pastries with ingredients that are easy to find in the market. As she made back her capital, she invested it in desserts for sale to her customers. She says, "Who doesn't like a chocolate pastry or a vanilla cake? You can eat one at any time and in any place."

Her dream is to save up to travel to far away places, she wants to purchase flour wholesale and the necessary ingredients for her business. This is the first loan she's applied for with this institution in the 18 years that she's been in this line of work. These are the reasons Blanca's requesting a loan to purchase flour and other ingredients wholesale to bake a variety of pastries and cakes.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients wholesale to bake a variety of pastries and cakes.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa, is 29-years-old, married, and blessed with three children. 

She buys animals and sells them in different villages in her town.  She has been doing this for almost eight years and earns a net income of 5,000 PHP weekly. Her net income in this business is usually spent on her family's daily expenses.

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase buffaloes and cows to sell. 

She's hoping this will improve the business and generate more income for savings.

loans.use: to purchase buffaloes and cows to sell

loans.name: Dwighta

texts.en:
Dwighta sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has improved her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and business expense.

She is very positive that she could improve her business even more, if you will lend her an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will be used to purchase additional inventory of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers are likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

Dwighta hopes to have a more stable source of income. She dreams of being successful both in life and in business. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old, married, and has seven children. Four of her children are in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marites requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock to raise.

Marites has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Angie works hard to support her family.

She has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Angie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of gasoline to sell.

Angie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулкайыр 42 года, замужем, есть 3 детей дошкольного и школьного возраста. У Гулкайыр  средне-специальное образование, она работала бухгалтером, занималась торговлей, на сегодняшний день в качестве основного источника дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря целеустремленности, трудолюбию и нацеленности на результат Гулкайыр и ее супруга, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 3 бычка, 4 лошади и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулкайыр обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 2 лошадей для откорма и перепродажи на скотном рынке. Она намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Гулкайыр планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulkaiyr is 42 years old, married, and has three children of preschool and school age. Gulkaiyr has a specialized secondary education. She worked as an accountant, engaged in trade, and currently as a main source of income is engaged in agriculture. Thanks to her dedication, hard work and focus on results, Gulkaiyr and her husband today have two cows, three steers, four horses, and 20 sheep. Monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing his homestead, Gulkaiyr applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase two horses for fattening and resale at the livestock market. She intends to increase his livestock count that will certainly lead to an increase in the capital of the family. Gulkaiyr plans to invest income from the loan in business development.

loans.use: to purchase two horses for fattening and resale in the livestock market.

loans.name: Maigul

texts.ru: Майгуль 39 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Майгуль - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 1993 году с 5,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию, Майгуль на сегодняшний день имеет 3 коровы, 50 овец. Также на земельной доли, мерою 1,0 Га она ежегодно выращивает арбузы, дыни, хлопок для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет до 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майгуль обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки семян и минеральных удобрений, что позволит ей выращивать экологически чистые овощи, увеличить прибыль от их продажи и расширить свое хозяйство, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и позволит накопить на свадьбу ее дочери.
texts.en:
Maigul is 39 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Maigul has a specialized secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she raises crops and livestock, having begun in 1993 with 5,000 som (KGS), Thanks to her determination and hard work, Maigul today has three cows and 50 sheep. Also, on a plot of land measuring 1.0 hectares, she grows annually melons, watermelons, and cotton for sale. Monthly aggregate income amounts to 30,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her business, Maigul applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers, that will allow her to grow organic vegetables, increase profits from their sale, and expanding her homestead, which will certainly lead to an increase in the family's capital and allow her to save for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds of cotton, melons, and watermelons in order to grow organic products.

loans.name: Soknov's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum village of Kampong Cham province, Soknov is a 34 year-old married woman with two children, whom are her dependents. Her main incomes are from rice farming and being a paid worker for 16 years. With the two jobs, she can earn 44,200 KHR. Her family can save 26,100 KHR daily after their expenses. 

This is the second time that Soknov has become a member of Kiva’a partner, VisionFund. She has completed repaying her previous loan with success. 

In a group of two, with the total amount of 1,100,000 KHR, she is a leader whose loan portion is 800,000 KHR. For Soknov, her entire loan portion will be spent on purchasing rice seeds and potash. 

Since the previous loan enabled her family to acquire daily equipment and tools to use, she is hoping that the new loan can help her children to continue their studies.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and potash

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей, все дети школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Гулайым - среднее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и воспитывать детей. Поэтому с 1989 года Гулайым занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. На арендованном земельном наделе мерою 1,00 ГА Гулайым и ее муж выращивают рис для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулайым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Гулайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет дать достойное воспитание детям.
texts.en: Gulayim is 47 years old and married. She and her husband are bringing up six children, all of preschool and school age. Gulayim has received secondary education. It is very hard to find employment in her village, yet she must support her family and raise her children. This is why Gulayim has been engaged in farm work since 1989. At present she has two cows. She also leases a land plot of 1.0 ha, where she and her husband grow rice for sale. Their monthly revenue is 15,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Gulayim has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to increase her livestock. Gulayim plans to invest her revenues in an additional livestock increase. She wants to make sure her children receive a proper education.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle to increase her herd.

loans.name: Laiim's Group

texts.en:
A resident at a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Lai Im is a 45 year-old married woman with three children. Among the three, one of her children is still dependent on her, although he already has a job.  She has been farming corn for the last 27 years to support her family. 

Currently, farming corn enables her to earn about 74,400 KHR daily and she can manage to save about 40,000 KHR each day. The most important challenge she is facing is the low price of corn. 

Lai Im is a new member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She, with the other three members, are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Lai Im will use her portion to buy fertilizers and corn seeds. She is hoping that by expanding the business she will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 43 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Liza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Liza has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Liza aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 29 years old, married, and has three children.  With two children in school, Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  With two children in school, Shirley works very hard to provide for them.

Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Shirley has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, diapers, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Amelyn

texts.en:
Amelyn is 33 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Amelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Amelyn requested a 9,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Amelyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 35-years-old, married, and has two children. With one child in school, Arlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Arlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, condiments, etc.

Arlyn has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 24 года, не замужем, детей нет. Нургул в качестве основного дохода занимается торговлей продуктами питания, стартовав в 2010 году, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Нургул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть товар в обороте на сумму 70,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Нургул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для закупки продуктов питания для расширения ассортимента в магазине. Нургул намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет направить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Nurgul is 24 years old, is not married and does not have children. As a main source of income, Nurgul is involved in selling groceries, having begun in 2010. Thanks to her persistence, determination, and hard work, Nurgul currently has goods in circulation amounting to 70,000 som (KGS). Monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

Nurgul applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase food products for expanding the assortment in her store. Nurgul intends to epand her business, which certainly will increase her family's capital. She wants to use profits from the loan in purchasing furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy products for retail sale in order to increase the assortment in her shop.

loans.name: Kyzzhibek

texts.ru: Кызжибек, 38 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. У Кызжибек среднее образование, с 2008 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 3,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве у Кызжибек есть 5 коров, 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,2 Га она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сомов (KGS). Также Кызжибек с супругом делают седла для лошадей на заказ. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кызжибек обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Кредитные средства помогут приобрести корм и сохранить при этом поголовье скота.  Данные мероприятия позволят инвестировать в ее бизнес и накопить на строительство дополнительного сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Kyzzhibek is 38 years old, married, and is raising four children. Kyzzhibek has a secondary education. In 2008, she became involved with agriculture. As a starting source of capital, she had all of 3,000 som (KGS). Today on her homestead Kyzzhibek has five cows and ten sheep. On a plot of land measuring 1.2 hectares, she grows barley. Monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). Also, Kyzzhibek and her husband make saddles for horses on order.

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kyzzhibek applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock feed. The loan amount will help to acquire feed and to maintain her livestock count. These measures will allow her to invest in her business and to save for construction of an additional barn for livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed to maintain her herd and have good offspring.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Hai is a 62-year-old married mother of seven children living in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum of Kampong Cham province.  To secure the needs of her entire household, she grows rice crops as the primary source of income, which earns her about 10 USD per day 

Hai’s group is made up of two members. She has successfully been with VisionFund for three cycles and she is applying for another loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer. 

The past loans have given her the opportunity to buy necessary equipment and tools, and with the new loan she is hoping to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: St Charles Bird Workshop

texts.en:
Bernard has been cutting metal to turn it into beautiful works of art for years. His workshop is located on a tourist location and is specialized in providing metal drums and wire brushes to many artisans there. 

Bernard was influenced by a great artisan in metal cutting in Haiti. In 1999, he opened his own small shop and, later on, his handcrafts became well appreciated. His first exposition was made within his first year of operation. Since then, the shop has been a business that attracts patrons’ attention through its commitment to cultural events.

Recently, Bernard has experienced shortages due to the lack of working capital in order to help his customers honor more international orders. That is why he turns to Zafen to find a loan to take his shop to the next level.

loans.use: to buy metal drums, wire brushes, paints, and sandpaper to increase production.

loans.name: Chhai's Group

texts.en:
Married with two children, Chai, a 28 year-old woman, is living in Tbaung Khmum village of Kampong Cham province with her family. With her children being too young to attend school, she has a heavy burden to bear because she has to take care of them and at the same time, she has to work. In order to support her family, Chia has been planning cassava and some other vegetables, while being a paid worker when needed, for nine years. Those jobs enable her to earn 26,600 KHR daily and she is able to save 17,700 KHR a day after the expenses. 

Chai is a leader of a group of three women that is applying for a loan in a total amount of 2,500,000 KHR  from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Chai, whose loan portion is 1,200,000, will use her loan portion to buy necessary equipment to support her vegetable planting and use some part of it to buy a water pump. She hopes that she can earn more income from her business so that she can keep improving her lifestyle gradually.

loans.use: by tools and a water pump

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
Tom is a 38-year-old married woman and has a child whom is under her guardianship. Her residence is at Thbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. Although her daughter has a job as a tailor, Tom still needs to help earn income to add to the family's budget. She has been farming rice for 20 years now, and with that she can earn approximately 27,800 KHR a day.

This is the second time that she is working with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund in order to obtain 500,00 KHR loan to do rice farming. She is the leader of a group of two. 

She intends to use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer. By seeing the improvements in her life after the first loan, she is hoping that the second loan can further help improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Salma Bibi

texts.en:
Salma Bibi is a 28-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a simple house-wife and her husband has been running a photography business for the past ten years.  He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the overall household.

Salma Bibi's husband needs to buy different types of photography accessories to maintain his equipment, but due to insufficient financial resources he is not in a position to buy these accessories. Therefore, Salma Bibi wants to help her husband by requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan her husband can buy all the necessary items relevant to his business and enable himself to earn a better income by providing better services.

loans.use: to buy accessories needed for maintainence of her husband's  photography equipment

loans.name: Shazia Sarwar

texts.en:
Shazia Sarwar is a 30-year-old women with two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband manages the entire family and has had a milk business for 13 years. He will need a loan to  increase his business.  Shazia Sarwar requests the loan from Kiva BRAC Pakistan.

The loan will help Shazia Sarwar's husband with the maintenance cost easily and provide better service, and a profitable income. 
Shazia Sarwar  is grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to increase her husband's milk.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 49-years-old, married, and blessed with two children. 

He owns and has managed a corn farm in their village for almost thirty years, and during the last harvest season earned an amount of 150,000 PHP.  With this income, he started a retail store to generate additional income. 

Due to inadequate capital in his business, he would like to avail a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, insecticides, and herbicides for his farm. 

He's hoping that his crop will become more productive and fruitful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, insecticides, and herbicides for his farm

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is happy to serve her regular customers by sproviding grocery items in their village. Maribel sells biscuits, coffee, milk, sugar, and canned goods. Sometimes she cooks and sell glutinous cakes when someone asks a favor for an occasion. 

Maribel wants to see her son become a professional someday. She and her husband do their best  to provide a good  living for their child. Maribel is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy beverages, noodles, toothpaste, and shampoo.

 Maribel believes that by having the loan she will extend the products she selsl. She will invest her income to their farm and for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy beverages, noodles, toothpaste, and shampoo.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 57-year-old rice farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has five children. Avelina has been in the business for more than 20 years  Avelina has supported her husband in their farming business. 

She requets a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.  A loan will enable Avelina and her husband to improve the productivity of their farm and augmenting their yield and income. 

Avelina hopes to expand their farming business in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for several years now. Fishing is a very lucrative business in their place. Bernadette is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights.  A loan will be a great help for them in improving their fishing business and augmenting their income. In the future, Bernadette hopes to make their fishing venture more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Manuela works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Manuela is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Manuela has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old, married, and has four children. With two children in school, Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Lourdes has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working, 58-year-old entrepreneur. 

Rosita has had a tailoring business for 15 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional material.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material.

loans.name: Katweimukye Farmers Kaisobakara Group

texts.en:
Joseph is an honest 43-year-old Ugandan married man, who has 5 children.  He earns extra income from farming, timber, and produce selling. 

Joseph desires to improve his standards of living with a growing business, but he is challenged by high license fees from the government on timber dealers and competition from similar businesses limiting his capital growth. However, he is getting credit to buy timber and maize for selling. 

He is a member of Katweimukye Farmers Kaisobakara where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and timber for selling

loans.name: Solemia

texts.en:
Solemia is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Solemia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Solemia has been in this business for 20 years now. 

In the future, Solemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, canned goods and groceries

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 45 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Zosima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to by additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, and groceries. She has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Zosima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 40 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Carmencita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmencita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carmencita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft-drinks, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future Carmencita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with three children.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Asia Kahtoon

texts.en:
Asia Kahtoon is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 10 years. He is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Asia Kahtoon's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities like rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items to sell in his business. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above merchandise.

Therefore, Asia Kahtoon has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and will help him to earn a much more profitable income with which to manage his household and business.

Asia Kahtoon is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase groceries to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Sajida Bibi

texts.en:
Sajida bibi  is a responsible mother with six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing milk for many years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family.  Due to insufficient finances, he is unable to increase his business. Therefore Sajida bibi has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will help Sajida bibi's husband to afford the maintenance cost and provide better services to earn more income. Sajida bibi  also plans to save money with the profits to meet her family's future needs.

Sajida bibi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to increase her husband's milk business.

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in Kampong Cham province, Sokheng, age 42, is a married woman with three children that are still her dependents. She has been a rice farmer for 22 years and in addition to that she also raises pigs. 

Sokheng’s group is made up of three women, with Sokheng as the leader. She has been a member of VisionFund, which is Kiva’s partner, for the past two cycles, and has a successful repayment record.  This is her third loan.

She is requesting a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy herbicides, pesticides, potash, and a water pump. 

The previous loans have improved her family's living conditions noticeably and she hopes that the new loan will help provide her children the education they need.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, potash, and a water pump

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Con el crédito que Gloria obtuvo para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café la producción del aromático grano mejoro de gran manera ya que fue asistido con mucha diligencia y en el tiempo adecuado. Ella compro fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos, foliares, entre otros con los que protegió y mejoro la producción pagando así mismo la mano de obra para la recolección del grano con el que tuvo excelentes ganancias al momento de su venta y ayudo a captar más ingresos para su familia y hogar para salir adelante. Gracias al apoyo económico brindado su situación económica mejoro mucho, salió de algunos de sus compromisos y logro cancelar el crédito por lo cual está muy agradecida. Ella espera que en esta nueva oportunidad sea nuevamente apoyada de la misma forma que con su primer crédito pues en esta nueva temporada quiere pagar la mano de obra para limpiar de maleza y hojas secas que están caídas en la propiedad, aplicar abono, fertilizar la planta y esperar que esta cosecha sea mejor que la anterior de manera que cada cosecha sea mejor en cada año.
texts.en:
The production of the aromatic grain improved a lot thanks to the loan Gloria got to help her with her coffee crop. She was able to take care of it, diligently and on time. 

She purchased fertilizers, organic compost, and leaf fertilizer among others, which she used to protect and improve the production. She was also able to pay for the labor to collect the grain which helped her get excellent profits when it was sold. It also contributed to get a better income for her family and her household.

Thanks to the financial aid, her situation improved a lot. She was able to paid off some debt, and able to pay off the loan. She is thankful for this.

She hopes this time she gets the same help as last time. This season she wants to pay for the labor to clean up the weeds and dry leaves in the property. She'll apply the compost, the fertilizer to the plant, and she hopes this harvest will be better than the previous one. She wishes the harvest to improve every year.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the labor to help her with the coffee crop.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат 47 лет, замужем, дети взрослые, все, кроме младшего сына проживают отдельно. У Салтанат - средне-специальное образование. По характеру она очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. На протяжении 14 лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 1 бычок, 15 овец, также Салтанат обрабатывает 0,9 ГА собственной земельной доли. В основном выращивает фасоль, реализуя ее оптовым покупателям. Также Салтанат на ежедневной основе реализует молоко местным жителям, совокупная ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец и 2 дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить объемы реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на строительство кошары.
texts.en:
Saltanat is 47 years old and married. Her children are grown and all of them, except the youngest son, live on their own. Saltanat has a specialized secondary education. By character, she is very responsible, sociable, and cheerful. For the last 14 years, she has been raising crops and livestock. Thanks to her hard work, Saltanat currently has on her homestead: two cows, one steer, and 15 sheep, and also Saltanat works 0.9 hectares of her own land. She mainly grows beans, selling them to wholesalers. Saltanat also sells milk every day to local residents. Total monthly income amounts to about 25,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase ten sheep and two diary cows, which will allow her to increase sales of organic milk. Saltanat plans to invest profits from the loan in further developing her business and wants to save money for building sheep barns.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows, in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales, and ten sheep to invest in her business.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 36-year-old married mother of five children, who has been working in agriculture business and preparing Mouneh (preserves) since 1996. Zeinab specializes in planting highly requested medical and cooking herbs, since she proved to have a very good talent in this field.

Few years ago, Zeinab opened her own grocery store to support her family in covering their increasing living needs with a daily income business. Both businesses are going on fine, but due to increasing living needs, Zeinab can't save necessary cash to develop them more.

Thus, for this reason she is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special offer products, in addition to pasting floor tiles in her store to make it a better looking place.

This is Zeinab's third loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Through her previous loans, Zeinab was able to improve and increase her business production, through buying special seeds and seedlings to increase her family's income.

Zeinab will work hard to develop her grocery store more in the future, either through moving to a wider place or through making attractive decorations.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special offer products, in addition to pasting floor tiles in her store to make it a better looking place.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela is a 63-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children. For more than 10 years , Carmela has operated her sari-sari or retail store in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She sells various goods from detergents to food items to her customers.  Carmela is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, toiletries and detergents, bread and biscuits, toilet paper, cooking oil, condiments and other items.  This will help her improve her stock, allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store. Carmela dreams of improving her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, toiletries and detergents, bread and biscuits, toilet paper, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Alaysa

texts.en:
Alysa is grateful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for the franchise agreement and maintenance of her tricycle. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her earnings will definitely help her to sustain daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the good outcome of her transport business and the financial help that will be given her.

Alysa dreams of adding more tricycle units to grow her business. She prays for the safety of her passengers and good health for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Edenilda

texts.en: Edenilda is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Getafe, Bohol. Edenilda makes a living through her hog raising business. Her husband operates their motorcycle to transport passenger. Edenilda is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to pay for the repair of the motorcycle. A loan will help Edenilda and her husband improve their way of living. Edenilda wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and to pay for the repair of a motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Her name is Ma. Gina, 48, and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Diosdado, an air condition technician, and has children.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. She works to augment their income in order to meet their daily personal and household needs, and for their children's education.

Ma. Gina operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people have their own computers. People go an Internet Café either for their business, school requirements, and business documents. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in rentals every day.

To help her improve her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase a new PC and a printer. Her income from her Internet Shop is a big help for her family’s basic needs and for the schooling of her children.

Ma. Gina aims to increase her business and wants to save money to send her children to the best schools. She prays for her family's good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional Personal Computer and a printer for her Internet Shop

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is a 59-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Linda has an ice cream business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

Ma. Linda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 22 years old and married and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rina has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is married and works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns income from transporting motorcycle passengers. Phoebe is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Phoebe has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, is 28 years old and has one child in school.

Margie has an electronic mobile phone reloading retailer business in the Philippines. Margie requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase electronic reloads to sell.

Margie has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase electronic mobile phone reloads to sell.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.ru: Каныкей 26 лет, не замужем, живет с родителями. У Каныкей среднее образование, она трудолюбивая, целеустремленная и разносторонне развитая личность. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Каныкей занимается полеводством. Начав в 2008 году, сегодня в есть 1,48 Га земельной доли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Дополнительно она предоставляет услуги общественного питания. Прибыль Каныкей около 30,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи экологически чистой фасоли. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каныкей обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры, семян фасоли. Доходы Каныкей планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kanykei is 26 years old, is not married and lives with her parents. Kanykei has a secondary education. She is hardworking, determined, and has a diversely developed personality. As an additional source of income for her family, Kanykei raises crops. Having begun in 2008, today she has 1.48 hectares of land, where she grows haricot beans for sale. Additionally, she offers catering services. Kanykei's profits are about 30,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of organic beans.

With the aim of further developing her business, Kanykei applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase nitrates and bean seeds. Kanykei plans to invest the profits in further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy nitrates and haricot bean seeds to grow organic haricot beans for sale.

loans.name: Ainiza

texts.ru: Айниза успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Айнизы на сегодняшний день есть 1 корова, 1 бычок, 5 овец. На своем участке она по-прежнему выращивает картофель и люцерну. Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочной продукции, картофеля и скота составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айниза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку экологически чистого картофеля у односельчан для перепродажи на рынке и овец для увеличения поголовья скота.  Доходы от кредита Айниза планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ainiza successfully repaid her loan and she is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with financing. On her homestead, Ainiza currently has one cow, one steer, and five sheep. On her own plot, she still grows potatoes and alfalfa. Monthly income from selling milk and dairy products, potatoes, and livestock amounts to 20,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Ainiza applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase organic potatoes from villagers for resale at the market and sheep for increasing her livestock count. Ainiza plans to invest profits from the loan in further developing her business and in home repairs.

loans.use: to buy organic potatoes for resale and some sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 55 years old and a widow with six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ofelia has been raising pigs for 11 years and earns additional income from gasoline retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with three children. At 51 year old, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Victoria has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Victoria has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rosela is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosela has been farming sugarcane for ten years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna Mae is 36 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Anna Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, egg, noodles and other groceries.

In the future Anna Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 58 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Shehnaz Begum

texts.en:
Shehnaz Begum is a 43-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 1 son. 

Her son has been running a general store for the past two years.  He is the sole income earner in his family, and is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Shehnaz Begum's son wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items for his business, but due to financial constraints he is not in a position to buy all the above products. Therefore, Shehnaz Begum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy all these products, and also help him to earn maximum profits to support his household and business. 

Shehnaz Begum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items for her son's business

loans.name: Heri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet Heri, one of Ruma's agents who has been a member of Ruma for almost a year. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma his business has improved very much. He feels that he can give good contributions to his community through his small business.

Heri lives in West Bogor, West Java. He lives there with his wife and his children. He owns a stall where he provides mobile payment services to his community. He also sells some things like keychains and stickers.

As the business grows, Heri needs to get a working capital loan from Ruma. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Heri improve his business, and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services.

In the photo, Heri is standing in his own small stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 51, married, and blessed with four children. 

He has managed a corn farm in his village for almost seven years and during the last harvest season earned an amount of 60,000 PHP.
 
His net income from this business is usually spent on school allowances for his children. 

Due to insufficient capital, he would like to avail a loan amount of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertlizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm. 

He's hoping that his business will continue to become more productive and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fertlizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is a farmer from Getafe, Bohol. She is married and has six children. 

Emeliana helps her husband in tilling their farm. She is a very hardworking woman. This has been their source of income for more than 20 years now. 

Emeliana is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. This loan will enable Edenilda to improve the harvest from the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and food items to the people in her area. Erlinda has operated her store for almost 20 years now.  

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bread and biscuits, rice, toiletries, soap and detergents, among other items. Erlinda believes that a loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Erlinda hopes of making her business more sustainable and profitable. She also wants to save money to pay for her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 33 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school.  Shirley works very hard to provide for them.

Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Shirley has been in this business for 1 year now. 

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maria Magdalina

texts.en:
Maria Magdalina is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Maria Magdalina is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Maria Magdalina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria Magdalina has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Maria Magdalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 41 years old, married, and has six children. Five of her children are in school.  

She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Marites has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Marites requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marites has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Estrelleta

texts.en:
Estrelleta is 50 years old, married, and has six children,  four of which are in school.

Estrelleta is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. 

Estrelleta requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Estrelleta has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estrelleta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Noralie

texts.en:
Noralie is 56 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Noralie has a gasoline retail business in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more gasoline to sell.

Noralie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Francisco is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Francisco has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from rice vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Rona

texts.en:
Maria Rona is 46 years old and married with six children.  With three children in school, Maria Rona works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Rona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Maria Rona has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft-drinks, spices and other groceries. 

In the future, Maria Rona would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of which are in school.  Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack foods, eggs, noodles, and spices. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet Asep, one of Ruma's agents who has been with Ruma for a year and a half. Asep lives in Bogor, West Java, located about 1 hour and 30 minutes' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and daughter. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma his business has improved very much. He also thinks that Ruma’s service is really good. 

Asep owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services. As the business grows, Asep needs a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services for his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Asep improve his business and, accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. In the photo, Asep is shown standing in front of his own small stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Mom, a mother and a wife, is 47 years old. She has three children and two of them are still dependent on her. To support her family, Mom has been doing rice farming for 29 years, and apart from farming, she is also a paid worker. The current daily income of her family is 19,400 KHR.

Mom and her fellow group member are new members with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking a loan of 1,800,000 KHR. Mom, who is the leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers as well as rice seeds for her farm. She is hoping that she can provide education to all of her children with the profit from the rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is a resident of Koh Sotin District in Kampong Cham Province. She is a 35-year-old married woman with three dependent children.

Kunthea has been selling palm sugar and growing corn for 17 years to earn income for her family. These two kinds of work have been providing her family about 10 USD per day, but she can manage to save about 6 USD each day after daily expenses.

Kunthea’s group consists of two members. She has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for one cycle already, and she has successfully repaid the loan. With the first loan, her family's living conditions improved slightly.

Currently, Kunthea’s group is applying for a loan from VisionFund. Kunthea, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and corn seeds as well as to hire workers to harvest the corn and for pumping water to use in the field.

Her purpose is to improve her family's corn business. She is hoping that the corn business will help to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds and to hire workers

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Nazia Bibi

texts.en:
Nazia Bibi is a 42-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. 

Her husband has been running a general store for past 18 years, He is the only income earner and is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Nazia Bibi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities and other consumer items for his business, but due to financial constraints he is not in a position to buy these products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Nazia Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities, and also help him to increase his income to manage his household and business. 

Nazia Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase consumer items for her husband's business

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 25, 22 y 17 años, y su negocios es la zapatería.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, de buen trato, sociable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un lugar que reúne una vez al año cerca a mil artesanos en la denominada feria de ‘la Alasita’ dónde se oferta todo tipo de bienes en miniatura con el fin de que esa miniatura se materialice y se haga realidad. De clima cálido tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados aproximadamente durante todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijo menor que estudia en la escuela, sus hijos mayores son independientes, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de transporte, confección de carteras de cuero, venta de salteñas, tejido a máquina, servicio técnico de equipos, venta de muebles, venta de edredones y confección de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos de cholita (mujer tradicional, usa sombrero, manta y pollera). Empezó su trabajo como costurera de zapatos, posteriormente se especializó en zapatos de cholita, sus creaciones son originales, elabora zapatos a pedido y para grupos folclóricos de baile. Los pedidos que tiene los entrega por mayor. “cada año existe una variedad de modelos, la gran mayoría están trabajados en tela, se los confecciona en tres meses aproximadamente, porque para la fiesta de el Gran Poder, los bailarines son muy exigentes con sus calzados…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su taller. Ella desea realizar la compra de material de confección de zapatos por mayor, como; suelas, telas y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 10 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de confección de zapatos por mayor para preparar sus pedidos para la fiesta del gran poder.
texts.en:
Maria is a 46 year old woman, lives with her partner, and has 3 children aged 25, 22, and 17 years. Her business is a shoe shop. She is enterprising, independent, knowledgeable in business, sociable, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is done in the south of the city, a place that once a year gathers together about 1000 artisans in a fair called the "Alasita" where all kinds of miniature goods are offered with the purpose of this miniature version materializing and becoming reality. The climate is warm, tropical, and very humid with a constant temperature of 30 degrees Celsius all year.

Maria has a dark complexion, short height, and short black hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish for culture and for the commerce she is engaged in (She is seated in the center of the photo). Her life is shared with her partner who makes a living in construction and with her younger son who studies in school. Her older children are independent and live in their own house made of brick with a corrugated iron roof. They have drinkable water, electricity, and sewage.

Her desires to excel have led her to lead a bank of people with business such as: transport services, making leather wallets, sale of empanadas, machine knitting, technical service of equipment, sale of furniture, sale of quilts and making of skirts. They are asking for a loan to improve their businesses.

Her business is the fabrication of shoes, specifically in the "cholita" tradition (traditional woman, wearing a hat, blanket, and skirt). She started her work in the sewing of shoes, later specializing in the "cholita" shoes. Her creations are original, making shoes to order, for folk dance groups and orders that have a bulk delivery. "Each year there is a variety of shoe models, the vast majority are worked in cloth. I make them in approximately three months, because for the "Fiesta de el Gran Poder" the dancers are very picky about their footwear...", she says.

Her dream is to expand her workshop. She wants to purchase wholesale materials for making shoes, such as soles, fabric, and other items. This is her first loan with this institution in the 10 years that she has been developing this activity independently. 

It is for these reasons that Maria is asking for a loan to purchase wholesale materials for making shoes to prepare her orders for "La Fiesta del Gran Poder".

loans.use: to purchase wholesale materials for making shoes to prepare her orders for "La Fiesta del Gran Poder"

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham Province, Sreypov is 36 years old and married. She has two children and both of them are dependents and still studying. In order to help her family's financial situation, she has been selling bamboo and has been a paid worker for the last 18 years. Each day, she can earn around 15 USD.  

Sreypov and her fellow group member are new members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As a leader, she is applying for a 1,700,000 KHR loan to buy more bamboo for resale. By expanding her business, she expects to help improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 54 years old, married, and has nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Flora has a food vending business in the Philippines. Flora requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Flora has been in this business for 10 years. 

Flora would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business which will allow her to continue making sales and financially benefit her family.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a food vendor from Talibon, Bohol. She is 41 years old, married and has three children. Fe sells home cooked foods to the people in her area. She has been earning an income through this business for more than 11 years now. 

Fe is requesting to take a loan to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, rice and soft drinks. Fe believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. Fe dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful that she was granted a PHP 19,000 loan, which she used to buy grocery items to sell at her small general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 19,000 loan, which she will use to fund her second business, a food stall. She will use the loan to buy the fresh meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings that she needs to cook dishes to sell at her food stall. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. 

Erlinda dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship group* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the ingredients she needs to cook meals for her food stall.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. Flora is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Flora requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Flora has been in this business for 10 years now.

Flora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maybelle

texts.en:
Maybelle is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Maybelle is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle.

Maybelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Tazeem

texts.en:
Tazeem is the responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation by driving a taxi for ten years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Tazeem's husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more frequent maintenance expenses on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to perform maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Tazeem has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Tazeem's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities in order to earn profitable income. Tazeem  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in future.

Tazeem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento LAS ROSAS compuesta por nueve integrantes todas mujeres,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.

Rossemary es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos dos varones  de 13 y 8 años, una mujer de 7 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Chasquipampa que se encuentra a 5 kilómetros del centro de la ciudad de La Paz, a 3.200 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Rossemary es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (parada la usa polera blanca y chompa negra la que está abrazando a su hijo ). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Plato paceño (carne de res, habas verdes, choclos y queso), Fricase de cerdo (sopa de cerdo con chuño, mote y papas), Sopa de Quinua (quinua y carne), Oficio que aprendió desde muy niña cuando le ayudaba a su mamá. “me gusta cocinar y que mis clientes sean fieles…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande donde pueda vender comida con comodidad. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor, como; carnes, fideos, arroz, papa, chuño y otros, para cocinar durante las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank group, Las Rosas, is made up of nine women members. They work in a variety of areas, including produce, juice, clothing, cosmetics, and food sales. They are seeking this loan to grow their businesses. 

Rossemary, age 40, is married and has three children, two boys ages 13 and 8, and one girl, age 7. Her livelihood is selling traditional food items. She is a good mother who is happy, optimistic, good-natured, responsible, and committed to her work. Her business is in the Chasquipampa district, which is located 5 kilometers from the center of La Paz, at 3,200 meters above sea level. 

Rossemary has dark skin, long black braided hair, and is short in stature. She speaks Spanish for general purposes in public and in her business. She shares her life with her children, who attend school and live with her in a rented house that is equipped with running water, electricity, and full plumbing. Her business is selling traditional foods, like the Plato Paceño (beef, green beans, corn, and cheese), Fricase de Cerdo (a pork-based soup with potatoes and hominy), and Quinoa Soup (quinoa and meat). She learned to cook from her mother starting at a very young age and says that she likes to cook and see her customers come back again and again. 

Her dream is to have a big restaurant where she can offer her food in a comfortable setting. She wants to make an investment in her business by buying key ingredients in bulk, including: meats, noodles, rice, potatoes, and others. This is her second loan with the group, and she has been running this business for 13 years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 60-year-old widow and a mother of two grown children, and is from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for several years now. Fishing is a very lucrative business in her area. 

Imelda is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. A loan will be a great help for her in improving her  fishing business, thus improving her income. In the future, Imelda hopes to make her fishing business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights.

loans.name: Ilusión Los Lobos Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo Ilusión los Lobos son personas muy alegres y comprometidas con su familia. Avelina es la representante del grupo, la eligieron porque es un buen líder y muy responsable.
