Ella tiene 44 años de edad y está casada con el señor Francisco desde hace 28 años quien se dedica a la construcción de casas, juntos formaron una familia con seis hijos de los cuales ya sólo dos se encuentran estudiando.

Desde hace 10 años Doña Avelina decidió apoyar a Don Francisco con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos y con un pequeño ahorro compró sus primeros cerditos. Las ganancias fueron mejor de lo esperado y no dejó de invertir en los animales. Más tarde escuchó hablar de VisionFund México y comenzó a solicitar préstamos para incrementar el capital a invertir. Tiempo después Avelina también comenzó a criar borregos. Esta vez, con su préstamo Avelina quiere comprar cuatro cerdos pequeños.

Con sus ganancias, ha conseguido hacer mejoras a su vivienda como la construcción de un segundo piso. “Antes nuestras vidas eran muy complicadas porque mi casa solo era de madera y algunas laminas, si queríamos salir de paseo teníamos que caminar varios kilómetros para encontrar transporte”. Pero ahora la familia disfruta de una casa de losa y su propio auto para salir gracias al apoyo de las ganancias obtenidas de la venta de sus animales, pero aún faltan cosas por hacer, muy emocionada y sonriendo comentó “Mi sueño es poder terminar de colar mi casa de dos pisos, que mis hijos, esposo y yo tengamos una mejor calidad de vida”

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Margarita quien invertirá en semillas de papa; Antonia, Rosa y Rogelio, inverirán en borregos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la comunidad donde viven los integrantes con los borregos de Doña Avelina ella es quien viste la playera blanca*
texts.en:
The members of the Ilusión los Lobos group are very happy people who are committed to their families. Avelina is the representative of the group. She was chosen because she is a good leader and very responsible. She is 44 years old and has been married to Francisco, a house builder, for 28 years. Together they created a family of six children of whom only two are still studying.

10 years ago Avelina decided to support Francisco with the household costs and their children's education so with a small amount of savings she bought her first piglets. Her earnings were more than she expected and she continued investing in animals. Later she heard talk of VisionFund Mexico and she began to request loans to increase her invested capital. Some time later Avelina began to raise lambs. This time around Avelina would like to buy four piglets.

With her earnings, Avelina has been able to make home improvements such as building a second floor. "Before our lives were more complicated because my house was only made of wood and some iron sheeting and if we wanted to go out we had to walk for kilometres to get to public transport", she says. Now her family are able to enjoy a concrete house and their own car to go out in thanks to the financial assistance of the earnings obtained by selling her animals. However, there are still things to do. Excited and smiling, Avelina says "my dream is to finish concreting the two floors of my house and that my children, husband and myself have a better quality of life".

The other group members are Margarita, who will invest in potato seeds, and Antonia, Rosa and Rogelio, who will invest in lambs.

* The photograph was taken in the community where the members live and features Avelina's lambs. Avelina can be seen in the white T-shirt.

loans.use: to buy four piglets

location.town: Ilusion Los Lobos, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es:
El cantón se llama así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso, el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete. Aquí  cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Jacinto.
En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3  años. El marido es mecánico, viven en casa propia.
Doña Erika es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudarle a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar, ella realiza los créditos para que él  utilice el crédito para invertirlo en su trabajo, él tiene una mecánica automotriz en la cual realiza los trabajos de mantenimiento  y reparación de todo tipo de vehículo, para la reparación de los vehículos tiene que invertir en repuestos y muchas veces los autos reparados no son retirados en seguida y por lo tanto los pagos no son puntuales, el trabaja  8 horas diarias, la mecánica está en su casa.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la mecánica como llaves, pinzas, destornilladores, gatas hidráulicas, entre otras. Nuestra amiga es socia hace un año y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos que son rápidos, apoyo oportuno y la buena organización de la Fundación. Sus sueños es tener la mejor mecánica.
texts.en:
Our canton was named for the Virgen del Carmen.  The area's rich flora and fauna are a major source of income for local people and the canton is known for Barraganete plantains.  The San Jacinto community bank meets here twice a month.  Our member, Sra. Erika, 22, is married and has two children, 6- and 3-years old.  Her husband is a mechanic.  The family owns the house where they live.
Doña Erika is applying for a loan that she will use to support the family's auto-repair business.  Her husband repairs and services all kinds of vehicles and needs spare parts for making repairs.  Her husband operates the business from their house and he works 8 hours a day.  The loan will go to buy the supplies and equipment--tools, hydraulic lifts, etc.--he needs to carry on the business.  Doña Erika has been a member of the group for a year and likes Fundación because it processes loans quickly and makes it possible for its clients to maintain and grow their businesses.
For the future, she wants to be a better mechanic.

loans.use: to buy supplies & equipment for her auto repair business.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is a 24-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He earns a living through his small bakery. He bakes goods and then delivers to his customers in his area. Gene has been in the business for more than a year now. 

Gene is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, baking powder, butter and other ingredients. This loan will allow him to bake and sell more, thus improving his income and profits. In the future, Gene dreams of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, baking powder, butter and other ingredients.

loans.name: Margery

texts.en:
Margery is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy additional supplies and merchandise for her direct selling business. She is thankful that her earnings helps meet her daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use to pay for clothing, cosmetics, footwear, and undergarments to meet the orders of her regular customers. Her income from her business is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Margery dreams of having her own store to display her products and attract more customers. She prays for good health and protection of her family. Every week, she meets up with her fellowship group* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 52 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Elsie has been in this business for 24 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 30 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries,like snack foods and canned goods, for resale at her store.

Jean has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns income from selling personal use products.

Jean aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, like snack foods and canned goods for resale.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 31 years old, married, and has three children, two of which are currently in school.  Gene works very hard to provide for them.

Gene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like biscuits, candies, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.

Gene has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Gene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like biscuits, candies, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years old and single.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Helen requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock for resale.

Helen has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for resale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Vilma is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more inventory of rice to sell to customers.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two children, Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a cheese making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Jane is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Irshad Baigum

texts.en:
Irshad Baigum is the responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his Taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance expenses on daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Irshad Baigum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Irshad Baigum's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs, and provide better transport facilities, earning profitable income. Irshad Baigum also plans to save money with the profits from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Irshad Baigum is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to make repairs to her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water
